text: Serious question:  Have you guys stopped caring?  It's supposed to be an upscale experience, yes?  Then why are the theaters not cleaned in a timely fashion?  And then, when you finally get to go into the theater why are they STILL dirty from the last movie (straw wrappers, popcorn, misc everything everywhere)?  And why, when we arrived a 1/2 hr ahead of schedule so we could get drinks, food, etc.. we now have to order During the previews because the theater wasn't ready and our sever completely skipped our row.    Dear AMC Esplanade: Step Up Your Game!     We gave you another shot, but for the money we end up spending I think we'll just go to the IPic instead.

My wife and I had our date night at the Esplanade for the first time since it's renovation.  I was surprised at the changes made to the place.  Gone was the old ticket booth, and the lobby/concession stand area was turned into a bar lounge type atmosphere.  Looked like a cool spot to hang out and wait for your movie if you were early, or even to it and chat, if on a date, after the movie.  You can purchase your tickets at the automated machines, or buy/pick them up inside at Guest Services.    The employees were very cordial as we passed them on our way to our seats inside the theater.  We decided on the Cinema Suites, since it was 21&over.  We were impressed with the layout, and the very comfortable seats that recline.  Our server was very nice and informative.  I was surprised when she was entering our order into her pad, the other servers were bring our drinks and appetizers.  WOW!  That's faster and more impressive than a restaurant.    I had the sirloin tips and mashed potato's, and my wife had the fried shrimp with fries.  I can't comment on any mixed drinks, (another reviewer complained of watered down drinks) mainly because we had wine.   All in all, it was ok.  Kinda like food at an Applebee's, or Chili's.  Nothing to go crazy about, mediocre, and over priced, but it WAS a MOVIE THEATER.  I mean, It's not a Michelin Star restaurant.  I don't care that it is in the Biltmore area.  The thing that annoyed us the most were the 2 pompous couple's we sat between.  They constantly complained about something.  Mostly their refills.  The waitress explains to you, should you need something, PUSH the call button.  They never did.  They expected someone to come by.  The point of the call button is to minimize the wait staff running around disturbing patrons who are watching the movie.    This is the main reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5. They were really annoying.   It's like this.......You are at a THEATER that serves food and drinks.  Not at a Fancy restaurant that shows a movie.  You're paying for the comfort and experience of being able to relax, enjoy a drink or dinner, all while watching a movie.  Bottom line, Food was ok, a little over priced, so watch what or how much, you order.  If you like to drink, have a beer, wine, or straight drink, if you are so worried of getting it watered down.  The employees from beginning to end were excellent.  And the over all experience was very enjoyable and fun.  We would definitely do it again real soon.

Loved this place. I had my doubts because of a prior experience. Years ago I went to Farelli's Cinema Supper Club in Scottsdale and it wasn't great. Bad food, seating wasn't ideal and just not a good experience overall. But wow. As soon as I walked into the newly remodeled AMC 14 I was impressed. A full bar where the concession stand use to be and nice tables and seating filled the lobby. The vibe was much more adult and cool right from the start. My friend pre-purchased tickets for six of us. We had our own row and when I sat down in the super comfy recliner I was in heaven! Great menu selection and the drinks were good. Got a cosmo and it was very good. Not the best I've ever had but really good. I honestly didn't expect the drinks to be drinkable. Not at a movie theater but I was pleasantly surprised.  I got a Swiss mushroom cheeseburger and it was delicious. A few nice touches really made this an extra nice experience: while we waited for our drinks and food, we all got a cup of chocolate covered popcorn and when we left the theater, an employee was holding a tray of mint chocolate Ghiradelli squares. Nice touch. We had a few issues with the credit cards being charged properly and the bills mixed up but the management fixed things right away and gave re-admit passes without question. Nice service. This may not be for everyone if you just want your run of the mill popcorn, soda and movie but it's a fun treat to go here. I highly recommend it and will go back for sure!

Terrible food. Expensive. Really disappointed. I ordered "blackened chicken Alfredo" and it was disgusting. Chicken was raw! Pasta overcooked and almost no Alfredo and very unsalted. I am not going back there again. Also we have been waiting to order food for 20 minutes and nobody came, so we had to summon the waiter by pushing the assistance button.

A few things I heart about this theater is:  1) Ability to purchase tickets online, which allows you to reserve seats & avoid lines so you can show up last minute. 2) Comfy seats and some recline...yummy!  3) Having a server  Areas needing improvement:  1) The food! Oh gosh, if you're going to sell this place as a dine in theater amp it up AMC! In this case simple is better. Go with the classic movie foods: hotdogs, pretzels, roasted almond. Just amp up the quality to differentiate yourselves from the other movie theaters. Make them gourmet classics. Even Ipic got that right!   All in all it's a fun way to watch a movie, convenient & comfortable but the food makes me miss the classic movie theaters.

It's a nice theatre, with comfortable reclining seats. There is unfortunately one major design flaw. When you recline even slightly, the panel in front of you blocks the bottom 1/4th of the screen. So I didn't recline the whole movie which defeats the purpose. Still better than a regular theatre, but not as nice as the ipic due to the design flaw.

Has potential but...  Beer I ordered wasn't cold and the appetizer we ordered never arrived. Makes paying attention to the movie difficult when you're wondering what's up with the service and for the price you're paying this shouldn't happen.

My boyfriend and I decided to check out this dine and view theater last weekend for the debut of TED. This AMC was remodeled into a dine and drink type of theater. They have certain theaters that are called "Fork and Screen" and the other "Cinema Suites". Cinema suites have recliner chairs and are 21 and up, less seats. Fork and Screen are cushy seats but no reclining. We went with the Fork and Screen as that was all that was available. We arrived early and had a drink at MacGuffins Bar inside the lobby. Ryan had a PBJ drink that tasted like a PBJ sandwich. I had a Southern Slam - Southern Comfort, Amaretto and Sour Apple Pucker shaken with orange juice. Quite yummy and strong. I may have had several..... We headed into the theater. The seats were setup with 2 4 2 across the theater. We were able to get 2 seats on the right about 3 rows up. They have tables that slide out in front of you for dining. Full silverware setting, side table area for drinks, etc. Our server was quite attentive and wasn't annoying. We never had to press our button to call him. He had water brought immediately. We started with Parmesan Fries which were quite tasty, Deep-fried until crispy and tossed with our seasoned salt, Parmesan cheese blend and Italian flat leaf parsley. Served with ketchup and garlic basil aioli. Ryan ordered the fish and chips meal. He said it was nothing special and was good for what it was. I had the Bruschetta Shrimp Pasta - Pan-seared jumbo shrimp tossed in zesty seasoning with corkscrew pasta and creamy sun dried tomato sauce, and sprinkled with fresh tomato and basil bruschetta. The flavor was great. My only criticism is that I wish it would have had more shrimp. But over all it was a great experience. I want to go back and try other entrees. They are about average as far as costs. Our entrees ran 12-14 dollars each.  I would suggest checking this place out for sure! Great date night or a good girls/guys night out! They have underground parking and do validate.

We were so excited to check out this theater!! Comfy seats, dinner, and a movie?! Sounds great! It was ok. Movie was great! Seats were more comfy than typical theater seats but were made of some material that you kind of stick to...which in hot Arizona weather isn't so nice. Service was ok, our server was on the rude side and acted as if we were an inconvenience to him. Food was ok, about what you'd expect from a theater. I would give it another try but I'd go for the upgraded cinema seating next time.

To start, the service was not great. The gal at the check in counter was unfriendly (to say the least).   Next, the seats are not that comfortable. Comparing to regular stadium seats they're average. BUT comparing to the reclining seats that the AMC at Desert Ridge provides they're pathetic. I know this part sounds a little whiney, but hang in there...you'll learn soon enough why this fact is significant.   Ok so the FOOD was ok. My kids got the chicken tenders and fries. What you'd expect from like a Chili's or Applebee's.   But here's where things took a turn for me. They charge $5.19 for an iced tea. Like a 10 oz that you'd get from a Chili's or Applebees. And refills are NOT free.   Not to mention the service while you're in the theater is slow as hell!   So for what you actually get, it's not worth the price in my opinion.

Forty dollars per person for a family movie night with no alcoholic beverages.  The tables were dirty with very little legroom, misbehaved children kicking chair backs and running around theater.  We will not be returning and recommend that readers not repeat my mistake.

This was without a doubt the worst experience I have ever had at a movie theater. Went to see the hobbit battle of five armies with my girlfriend. Some family decided to bring their 1.5 year old child. For the first hour they were fairly quite but after that it was nonstop crying or laughing or babbling, none of it on the quite side. Listen, I understand kids will be kids but if they are that young do not take them to a theater and ruin everyone's experience. And to top it off the employees there did absolutely nothing about it. Ruined the movie and I sure as hell will never be back.

Treated myself to Star Wars as a Christmas gift from my out-of-town father. I had never experienced the 18+ fork and knife (dine-in experience). For my first solo movie experience, I figured THIS is the way to see the most epic movie! Boy.. was I disappointed. Be warned service moves very slow or maybe my server had too large of a section. As a industry individual myself, I know the need for speed as it equals cash. I ordered a burger (the royal-bison... the best part of my experience! ORDER IT!) and a glass of water from a girl helping out. It came as it should in an appropriate amount of time for a burger- dropped off by another server. About an hour and fifteen minutes in or so, I push the button for a neat jameson. I wait. I see a male server past by four times in over twenty minutes before anyone even comes by to see what I'm requesting. I think to myself three things: 1. Is the button broken 2. Should I cancel if they ever come over 3. $1 tip on $24 it is. I did notice my server, who never introduced herself, was limping and could have been pregnant. Bare in mind G5 is near the back and I saw her working the front near the screen. I really should have got up, missed epic parts, and got a drink from the bar. But it's Star Wars and why chose the fork and screen if your drinks are served in over a half hour? Glad I got my cocktail ten minutes before the movie ended.  Needless to say, I will be preparing ahead of time as well as making the drive to a theatre with more prompt service.

Pros: - Comfortable seats, reasonably good pub-style food.   Cons: - Too much ambient light for 3-D films - glare on the glasses.  - Teach the servers how to master the billing system - or get a better billing system - there's no reason in this day and age for multiple checks during a single sitting (film).  Work out the kinks and this is a very viable business. Farrelli's had better food, but AMC gets points for seating.

I enjoy going to the Esplanade for the whole movie experience they offer. The food was pretty good, especially the parmesan fries and fried shrimp. I've been to movies in both the Fork and Screen and the Suites, and found seating in both to be very comfortable.

So far we've been waiting for 10 minutes to be served it took a little longer but the guy was really nice and handled my friends and I orders with ease it made so extravagant what a treat. Although the service kind of slow the food it self was A-OK 3/5

Nnnnooo...I prefer to order my own snacks for a movie before I enter the theater, thank you very much. I don't like buzzing my server like I'm in a Boeing 747 cabin & then wwwwwait for a damn popcornsies and soda.  I've seen TOO many movies here, but by gosh it's close to home. Last weekend I went to a random Harkins in the East Valley and the customer service and food seemed like a damn paradise compared to the Sit N PoOt AMC Dine-in and Get Gassy Theatres Esplanade 14.  The low-down:  1) Do you like sitting next to gassy neighbors eating greasy burgers, fries, jalapeno poppers and drinkin beer in the dark? Do you like smelling the results during 120 minutes of CGI space villains?  2) Some of the servers here are friendly and on-it. Some have seen better days. But no matter WHAT it takes too long to order...too long to get yer food...and too long to PAY. And of course the check/tip/process comes during the movie's conclusion. Annoyburgers! Grrrr!  3) THE VOLUME IN THESE THEATERS = ALWAYS WAY TO LLLOOOWWW. Seriously you will be straining to hear the movie because either the projector room dudes are slackin and smokin, or the speaker systems here are freakin WEAK. Or maybe both.  4) In ALL my times here, I have never once seen a manager enter the theater during a movie to test the picture and sound...something good movie theaters do regularly. Again, AMC PoOt and Toot doesn't care about your experience, so wtf, ya know?  5) Only a few seats per theater means if you go during peak times and you don't order ahead online to reserve your seat, forget it. I am a fan of the online reservation system. However I am NOT a fan of 30 seats per theater.  6), 7) and 8) Probably THE MOST ANNOYING facet of the Poot N Toot theater is the PAPER THIN WALLS, so you will always hear the movies playing next door to you. AMAZING since when you're in the damn theater you can barely hear YOUR movie. It's like all the speakers are positioned away from the audience and towards the walls. ARGH!!!  9) and 10) 20-40 minutes of trailers and commercials before your main attraction starts. F*ck you, AMC.  The good:  -Parking is easy. Just validate, jabroni. -They tend to show the movies you want to see. -The central Phx location.  Will I go back here? Unfortunately, yes. Just. Because. It's. So. Close. Will I go often? No. Will I EVER again patronize their gross food/kitchen? No. Popcorn = cold. Meats = cheap. Suds = not while I'm watching a movie, boss. I will pay as little as I possibly can because I just. want. to. see. the. movie.  Stupid concept. Indifferent management. Gross operations. Awesome location.  Poot.

I used to think that this was the most awesome place to see a movie!  The seats in the Cinema Suites are superior to the I Pics theaters and the price was very reasonable (half of the I Pics theaters).  The Menu USED to be packed with high quality food and an extensive menu.  I used to be more excited to eat here than to even see the movie!  I loved the Asian chicken salad and the pasta dishes with chicken or shrimp were fantastic!  The wedge salad was also great with shrimp added.  I could't wait to order and I have even come here for lunch without seeing a movie.  Well that all changed!!!!!  The folded card menu with no pictures is a cheap substitute with options that are low quality, finger, junk foods!!!  Total garbage and just reading the menu wanted to make me vomit!!!  If you think greasy french fries that are hours old, macaroni and cheese and chicken fingers are exciting then this is the place for you!  Forget about anything healthy!  Nothing is fresh, nothing is healthy and is only junk food that is promoting obesity!  So the  last time I went there and I saw the menu I was extremely disgusted!  I was so hungry because I expected to eat there I tried to find something edible.  I chose the sushi roll thinking at least that would be a healthier option.  It was the worst sushi I have ever had in my life.  It was obviously rolled the previous day or rolled by a factor somewhere, the rice was hard, there was barely any artificial crab in it (yes, artificial), the wasabi was not wasabi.  I think it is just a blob of flour that they added green food coloring in to make it appear like it was wasabi.  The entire blob had no wasabi flavor!  Then to make it even more disgusting they squirted mayonnaise all over the plate!  But they called it "Japanese mayonnaise" so that makes it legitimate, right? I never had a chance to complain and return the dish because I never saw the waiter again until at the end when I wanted to just leave.  I did complain before I ordered that the menu is horrible and the waiter simply agreed that the menu now "sucks" but he could't do anything about it. I noticed that the service has declined and also that the price of the tickets has gone up too! I was asked if I wanted to renew my "stubs card" registration and pay the yearly fee but after realizing that the food sucks, the price is higher and that the experience is NOT what it used to be, I declined.  I will not eat here again and will visit a local restaurant before seeing a movie.  By the way, "Ten" at the base of the escalator is wonderful to eat at.

The Cinema Suites are the way to go...21 yrs and older, GREAT recliners, good food and no proximity to other moviegoers. I wish I could rate this 6 stars. Better than watching it at home...and someone is bringing you food and drink!!!

I hate writing a review based on one bad experience, but it was an exceptionally bad experience.  I had an order of chicken nachos and some popcorn, and regretted it immensely 6 hours later.  Got incredibly sick, and so did my friend who ate the same things.  I assume that it had to be the chicken nachos.  They tasted alright, but the repercussions were not worth a single bite.  Take precautions while eating food in the dark!
Theater was not very clean Staff was courteous but not attentive.  Complained it was not a good place to work. Chairs are very comfortable Food was not good.  Sent mine back. Would not go back!

Just had one of the worst experiences ever at this theater! NO service for over 20 minutes when we go there. NO one even came in when we lit our call lights, the entire row! Staff outside of theater was VERY rude! The manager Mario was nice, and tried his best to be helpful, but once the movie started, the server was absent even when called! Messed up our drink orders, forgot to use the coupon the manager gave us for desert, mixed up our tab with someone else in the theater when presenting the bill, NO pens in the binders to sign with, and clearly didn't want to be there!

We attended the preview Fork & Screen weekend and was not impressed. It was nice to experience a free movie and lunch, but we will not be returning. All workers were friendly and helpful. The large seats were nice but leaned back too much. I felt like I got a great ab workout leaning back too far. There is a small light at the top of the armrest but it is generally blocked by your arm and too dim to see the menu or bill. I ordered a pepperoni pizza entree that came with a side of fries. My husband ordered the coconut shrimp. We both though the food was bland. We ordered a bag of popcorn to share and were shocked at the small size of it for $6.99. Usually AMC has great popcorn, but this was awful. It tasted like the oil they cooked it in was burnt and had a strange aftertaste. The concept sounds great, but I would rather eat at a sit down restaurant inside the theater and not be bothered by a waiter while watching my movie.   Pros: bigger chairs, validate parking, *It was free* full bar Cons: blah food, bad popcorn, waiters interrupting, parking, too dark to read menu, chairs that won't sit up enough

Use to work at this location. Horrible management and over worked employees.  Food is over priced its Apple bees quality with Ruth Chris prices!!! Tickets are expensive as well. Not worth trying in my opinion

I thought this would be expensive, and waiters going in and out annoying. This place was AMAZING! The seats were so comfortable, and the way the theater is laid out you don't even notice the waiters. the food and drinks are normal price compared to a restaurant, and not overpriced like I thought it would be (like a normal theater for popcorn/drinks/candy, etc). The bar in the lobby is awesome, and the staff is friendly. We had a problem with our tickets, they split us up (you mainly order ahead of time and get reserved seating). they helped us and got us exactly what we wanted. I cant wait to go back!

Comfortable? Sure.  Drinks are way expensive.  I don't eat dinner at a theater regardless, so can't tell you how good that is.  If you want popcorn, it's "one size fits all" and it's huge!  Way too much for two people, might as well share with the whole row and just pass the bowl.  Service great, and friendly, but in some theaters they can get in the way while watching a movie.  I still prefer iPic.

Cinema suites! Recliners are the best!  We've gone to a total of 4 movies in the Cinema Suites over 2 visits.  We rarely go to movies when we're home.    The menu is solid.  Every item we ordered (dessert, drinks, entrees) were good.    The tickets for the Cinema Suites are a few dollars more, but the experience is worth the extra money.  You get to choose your seats when you purchase your tickets.  Therefore, you don't have to worry about getting to the theater early to get a good seat.    The commercials and trailers are a bit too long (or maybe I just don't go to enough movies in the theaters).  I'm in the reclined position with a drink in my hand, so I don't mind the extra 15 minutes of trailers.
The server was incredibly rude and loud when taking orders from other movie goers during the movie. I felt like the seats were not as comfortable as other dine in theaters. I will not be returning.

Theatre was great. I had never been there before. The only thing I would say is that they should have a little bit more complex items on their menu. Some of them are big dishes and when they come out it stinks up the theatre. Other than that it was really nice.

They have Cinemasuites AND Fork and Screen. I was so skeptical the first time someone told me a dinner theater could actually be a pleasant experience, since usually you go and it's noisy and the food isn't as good as it could be elsewhere, and movie theater food is always suspicious anyways. But AMC actually trained their employees to serve food during a movie without being intrusive, and I've seen three or four movies with dinner and drinks now and had a great time every time. The food is actually good! Regular movie tickets cost enough anyway you might as well make a night of it and have dinner and drinks all at the same place. Speaking of drinks, they don't skimp on the booze either.

I could not be more obsessed with the Cinema Suites option at this theater. Plush, comfy leather chairs that completely recline and are reserved in advance so there is no hassle. A mini bowl of complimentary popcorn. Great service. A little chocolate when you leave. It is the absolute best! I wish I could go everyday. And I'm not even a movie person...

A really disappointing experience with AMC starts by getting to a PG13 movie in time for a 4:15 show. Kids were excited to see a teen flick "Divergent". Unfortunately, AMC was showing that in a 21-and -older theatre. Huh? Come back in 2.5 hours or drive across Phoenix to another AMC that's playing Divergent in 30 minutes. When we get to the second AMC, they've canceled the showing for "maintenance". Ugh.  This is supposed to be entertainment, not a wild goose chase.

Coke sprite and diet...what about the other 97 choices on the menu....dump, dirty , rippped seats, dirty floor no soap in restrooms.  Servers are nice but place is worn and a  Dump... Harkins is way better.

We love coming here, it's always good service and cozy seats, but if you are looking to eat go to iPic, the new and "improved" menu is absolutely terrible, I would have rather eaten at McDonald's (I hate McDonald's). Other than the new menu we still love going and is always a good experience, please please bring your old menu back!!!

I love coming here!! This is the only place I come for movies, but it's a shame that the bar staff is not very knowledgeable about basic drinks ie sidecar and an old fashions with the prices we pay you would think they would be awesome I will continue to come for the movies but guess I'll just stick to beers until the bar staff fix themselves

My favorite movie theater. Why? It's clean, the refreshment lines are short, many nearby dining & drinking options (and not just a Sbarro's or Chile's), covered parking (underground), it's a relatively safe neighborhood, and it's not tucked in a shopping mall. Add another plus - customer service. Last night we lingered at Morton's so long that we missed our 7PM show for which we prepurchased tickets. No problem they said, and handed us tickets for the 8PM. Very cool.

True to my word, I have to amend this review. We went on Valentine's Day a few years ago and it was slammed and the service/experience suffered for it. BUT we've been back twice since then and it's been great. Nice seats, quick and friendly service, good food!  I have to say that they have just recently changed their entire menu and from looking online all of our favorites are gone! Prices look a little higher and there's a little less variety. Maybe check out the menu on their website before you buy tickets. But overall this can be a fun place to see a movie.

Wow surprised to read some bad experiences because me and my partner had a fabulous first time here. We called ahead of time to confirm what they provided and a gentlemen named Alex was so kind and very helpful over the phone. He was very detailed explaining everything to us even how to get there from our destination. We got there and everything was so smooth. We were extremely surprised on the emptiness, since this was a Saturday night we were expecting the place to be packed and cramped but it was great! As we sat down there is mood lighting on your chairs so you can see your food as you eat and our waiter was so kind and chill. It was a casual vibe which we didn't mind at all because lets be honest it would have been weird to see someone walk up to us in a tie or something. Honestly there is so much I can say about this that it will take to long to write so here are the basics.  1. Great service 2. Great environment and vibe. 3. Amazing food. 4. We didn't mind the prices at all because honestly its like any other restaurant. 5. WE ARE HOOKED!!!! Definitely will be coming here more often.
At last a theater for adults, this place is awesome drinks are great but the food is so so this is the only theater that I go to.

Food is so so. Service was poor. The food is also a bit pricey especially for what you get. The portions are a little on the small side. My date ordered the quinoa bowl and for $12 you get barely half a bowel of food. The burger I got was OK but there were hardly any fries.   Comparing this to Roadhouse Cinemas in Tucson, this place looses. The chairs are not as comfortable and the food is nowhere as good.   Having said all that the movie was good and the popcorn was delicious.

Very fun experience -- we ordered the white cheese nachos, and they were pretty yummy. I thought the ticket prices were very fair. I'm giving it four stars instead of five because I thought the wine was pretty overpriced. Come on, people, more than fifteen bucks for a glass of Cupcake malbec??  Even so, we had a good time. We'll definitely come back if we're in the Phoenix area and want an out-of-the-ordinary movie-watching experience.
This is a perfect place to go on a date! The seats are so comfortable and they have a good menu. It's a little pricey but it's worth it! Their smoothies are also super good.

$8 for popcorn.  That is not right.  Seriously I can't order a smaller size.  I would rather go to a regular theater and not be bothered by the inattentive server, the people eating noisily with fork and knife around me, and the light that is so bright next to my side that it is distracting.  Blah!!  I think I am most upset about the popcorn.  The food is average  and over priced and the whole serving people with in a movie is really not a great idea.    I like many other Americans appreciate value and good deals.  The amc esplanade offers neither when it comes to food at least.  If you are going to pay $9 for some potato skins at least make them really good.   They were actually ok but the whole experience leaves a sour taste.

If I could give separate ratings for the movie theater experience and the restaurant/bar experience, I would give the theater a 4 star rating and the bar/restaurant a 2 or 3 star rating. Here's why:  The movie theater is probably my preferred choice in the Phoenix metro area. Christown? No freakin' way. I don't want to get shot on the way to my car. Tempe marketplace? Not unless you want to watch 17-year olds make out in every row. Arizona Center, nope. Not there, either.    The theater is pretty clean, and paying the extra two bucks to sit in giant, reclining chairs, have an assigned seat, not deal with kids talking, etc. is totally worth it, IMO. I can just purchase my tickets online and avoid having to wait in line or the possibility that the showing will be sold out. Genius.  Parking is in an attached garage and is free when you remember to validate.  Honestly, the only negative thing I really have to say about the theatre itself is that every time I go into a restroom there, the first stall is always out of tp. Always. Sometimes the second, too. The bathrooms seem to be cleaned and maintained regularly, except for this detail, which kind of turns into a big detail when there are twenty women waiting in line for the bathroom when the movie gets out. It must be the Murphy's Law of movie theatre bathrooms. Ugh.   The bar/restaurant is mehhh. If it were just a stand alone restaurant, it wouldn't be anywhere I'd frequent for the food itself. Think an above-average Applebee's. But having the option to actually order real food (and DRINKS!) in the theatre is pretty neat. The waitstaff always does a good job of not being disruptive during the movie, and are usually very friendly. Candy/soda/popcorn can also be ordered, at pretty typical movie theatre prices. But again, not having to stand in line with 50 other people for a package of red vines and a sprite makes it SO worth it.  Lastly, there are two theatre types. Cinema Suites and Fork & Screen. When you go online to check showtimes/purchase tickets, it shows you what type of theatre every particular showing is in. There's usually some in each type of theatre for each movie. This is where it gets kinda weird-fork and screen is fine, I would still come here if that was the only type of theatre. Still a comfy chair in a way better theatre. But after sitting in the cinema suites, you won't want to go back. Huge seats (that recline! woot!) and way more space in between the groups of seats. Because the last thing you want is to be sitting THIS CLOSE to a stranger who's apparently never eaten a taco before and loves to elbow bump all movie long.

Terrible Service! Never going back!  My girlfriend and I went to see Dawn of the Planet of the Apes here and had quite a poor experience. The tickets were expensive ($13 a person) and when we sat down someone came after about 5 minutes to get our drink order. We ordered two waters and a few minutes later the server came back for our food order. We told her what we wanted (potato skins, two burgers).  The appetizer came and we had still not received our waters that we initially ordered. I told the server that we had not received them and asked that she get them for us. We also asked for silverware and napkins. She said she would check on them but the bar was really backed up at this point. What bothered me the most was that the people in front of us ordered their drinks when they got there and received them within 2 minutes. As did everyone else around us.   We finished our appetizer and the burgers came out. Still no water... We asked the person delivering the food if she could bring us some water as we had been waiting 45 minutes on our drinks. She said she would check. No water ever came. We finished our burgers waited about 5 more minutes and then asked the next person we saw for water as we had been waiting 70 minutes for two simple waters. 10 minutes later they were brought out. We never received silverware or napkins either. The wait staff constantly got the seats mixed up for people's orders.   The movie was very good. The food was above average. Better than I expected. The service.... completely terrible. I will honestly say that I will never visit this theater again because of the service alone.

Major fail today... couldn't load a one day showing of the Yokai kids movie... needless to say there was a theater full of very disappointed kids that had been waiting to see this movie for weeks that unfortunately missed because it was showing for ONE DAY ONLY. Expected more from a movie chain this large!

The light from the table next to you for your food is sooo annoying!! You'll notice it out of the corner of your eyes during the entire movie!! I thought this place would be really cool - eating more than just popcorn in a theater! The FOOD IS CRAP!! Like cheap frozen food they pop in the microwave. We tried a lot of different food here. Prime example: the brownies - they didn't taste like box brownies (I think boxed are good), they tasted like the packaged brownies you buy at a gas station except they warm them up in the microwave. Why would you pay so much more to go here other then to eat and maybe drink?? It's just annoying sitting with servers constantly walking in front of you and bothering you.

Loved this and will totally do it again. This is first class all the way with reserved seating, great food and service and  yet surprisingly affordable. Seats are comfortable and roomy. Service is friendly and efficient. Food was delicious and affordably priced. This takes dinner and a movie to a whole new level.

I have been coming here for several years, since they first opened this dine in theater. I have watched menu prices go up as quality of food and service has gone down. Arriving this afternoon, I noticed just how shabby the theater has become.. The seats and armrests in the auditoriums are cracked and ripped. The carpeting is stained.  The walls need a good cleaning and/or coat of paint. There is a new theater in town (Roadhouse Cinemas) that is doing a much better job with comfort, quality, pricing and menu selection. It might be a little further drive, but it is most definitely work making the trip to Roadhouse Cinemas.

I give these guys a HUGE plus for the seating (be warned make sure and get the cinema suites not the fork and screen for a really comfy movie watching experience). I love having the option to lay out in a huge recliner and catch the newest Harry Potter,  but they really need to work on some of their food items. I have tried 5 different menu items and they all needed some TLC from the chef. However you can't go too hard on the food #1 your eating and getting waited at the movies so WOOHOO, and number #2 you can enjoy your favorite glass (or bottle) of wine maybe even a 23 ounce Blue Moon.

Not worth it.  First, we went to a 4pm matinee and it cost $24 ... that is $10 more than seeing a matinee at our usual theater.  Then we ordered some of their Italiano (sausage and pepperoni) pizza.  It tasted like bad frozen pizza and it was $10 per pizza.  The ice tea was $4.50 for unlimited refills, but it didn't taste good and we couldn't even get the server to bring us a glass of ice (since they put hardly any ice in it).  The popcorn was $7.75 with unlimited refills, but I was the only one eating popcorn and didn't need refills.  My usual theater gives me free popcorn if I spend $20 yearly for a t-shirt and $1 drink refills on their souvenir cup.  Our total tab was around $64 including tip.  Thought it was just too much for bad food.  Seats are okay, but I find them uncomfortable since I don't like to lean.  They aren't really any more spacious than a regular theater since you have the moveable tray.   I think I enjoy eating at a restaurant and then seeing a movie; I would spend some time talking to my spouse when I go out.

If there was a zero star button I would have selected it. Definitely the worse customer service I have ever received my entire life. The guy who gives out tickets is incredibly rude! I have been coming to this theater since 2005 and then stopped going about 2 years ago because of the staff change. This location is literally down the street from my house and I still would 100% rather go to any Harkins (Tempe Marketplace 20-30mins away!) Than to ever go back to amc esplanade again.  I just recently went to try out the dine - in experience and watch a movie. The second I walked up to the ticket counter was when it all went downhill. I'm sure by reading these previous reviews, everyone is talking about the same guy I'm talking about. They really need to reevaluate their staff. Horrible!

If you compare the total experience here to any other traditional theatre in the valley, it's hands down the best.   Reserved Seating:  You can select and reserve your seats online. Sooo if you are dying to see a new movie you can reserve your seat instead of showing up an hour early to stand in line! That is worth any price to me! Jus sayin.   Theatre Seats:  The seats themselves both in the Fork n Screen and the Suites are superior over any other theatre seating.  The seats are far enough from strangers that you don't feel uncomfortable or smell their breath! lol  (The Suite side for adults have recliners)  Food Service: You have a waiter/waitress. All you have to do is press a button and they come runnin!  Can't get that at any traditional movie theatre!  One experience the waiter brought our food late into the movie, and didn't respond to the button, so the manager took care of the bill.   Food: It's bar and grill food. If you're ordering gourmet food and expecting it to taste like Dominicks Steak House, etc., then you're mistaken.   Drinks and popcorn: All you can drink soda and popcorn. If you don't like it, have them replace it.   The overall experience is positive, especially if you're on a date. The recliners go all the way back...side grin. Oh, and don't get the seats up on top. There's a wall the separates the last seats from the rest and it's in the way of the view.

My husband and I have been pretty regular visitors here and not only enjoyed the comfy seats,  but also the food offered.... There was something for everybody on the menu, even healthy choices.  What were the thinking  changing  to a menu that offers nothing but fried stuff.. And a five types of macaroni and cheese  dishes...... Really!  What really topped it off today was the fact that the have thus elaborate drink menu but when I went to order,  was told they did not have any of the drinks listed!!  Having a business of my own,  I cannot follow this strategy.  I like the comfy chairs,  don't think I will be back any time soon.... Nor recommend this theatre.

Read the fine print. Some movies are only 21+ because of the alcohol even though it's not explicit when buying tickets online which is a joke. A lot of time and gas wasted driving over for a movie. I don't recommend.

So disappointed in AMC... They changed their menu,and are now serving crappy food but with the same high prices. I used to come here for a good lunch (beef tips and mashed potatoes, lettuce wraps, wedge salad),but now its stale popcorn and hard pretzles and cheese. What a let-down.  Signed, X-AMC fan
Love love love this theater. Amazing to sit down and eat during the movie. Staff is very attentive.

Love this venue. Its in a great location next to the best shopping venues in Scottsdale and the theater is never crowded! You get friendly servers and a descent menu selection.   I went here for the first time with some of my girl friends to see Side Effects! Loved the movie very hot and sensual! Its an awesome spot for a date night too. I will definitely be back!

This dine-in, drink-in theater was truly a wild experience. When you walk in and see a full bar in the lobby, you know it is different. As for the food, I will say the bacon, cheeseburger I had was incredible!! I also like the concept that in a lot of the theaters it is age restricted to nobody under 21 which also comes with lazy-boy reclining chairs. You also have assigned seats so it's important to either get there earlier or pay the extra $1 charge to order online so you get good seats (but how they have it spread out really makes most of the seats really good).  My only hold back is that this place is not cheap! A large import beer was $7, the burger was $10, small popcorn $7 (with unlimited refills), and my ticket was $12 for a matinee on a Sunday. But this is definitely something that must be experienced.

This AMC sounded like a great alternative to Studio Movie Grill in Scottsdale.  However, we were greatly disappointed. In addition to a server telling us our sodas were going to take 25 minutes to get to us, this brought us their loaded chicken nacho styled appetizer. It was so spicy that just the smell made my eyes water. We requested to change it out with something else. An hour into the movie, we finally got our soft drinks and the new appetizer of mozzarella sticks. Now, with the mozzarella sticks appetizer it states it comes with marinara sauce. They brought us salsa. At the end of the movie, they brought our check. The check was wrong. The waitress asked to just take our card and she'd be back to grab it with the correct receipt attached. She didn't come. We sat thru the credits wondering when she'd come. Finally she came. To ensure no error was made, we circled and wrote directly onto the receipt to take off the chicken disaster. If you want an experience not from hell and want to enjoy a movie with food, go to Studio Movie Grill in Scottsdale or rent from Redbox and make your own food. This dump isn't worth the ticket, let alone the shitty food and service that comes with it.

This definitely makes for a fun date night!  I've been here twice now since it reopened as a dine-in theatre and have enjoyed each experience, although customer service was much better the second time around.  Both times we've gone, our movies have only been in the Fork & Screen theatres - looking forward to trying the next level up.   The last time I was there, we weren't able to make reservations online since we were paying with gift cards. So we got there early, enjoyed a drink around the corner at my fave bar - Merc. And then arrived 10 mins before previews started to order our dinner. It worked out perfectly. I ordered their brisket sandwich concoction - it's not even on the menu yet - and I was quite pleased with it. And my pomegranate martini was delish - a little on the sweet side - but that's what I prefer!  The previous time we went, we split their queso blanco dip w/chips and thai coconut chicken skewers. The chicken skewers were pretty good, but the queso dip was horrible. Tasted like your typical concession stand nacho cheese. So i would stay away from that.  All in all, I'm a fan and will be back soon!

I get it. This is supposed to be really cool - eating and drinking in the theater. Sadly, it wasn't until after I'd purchased my ticket that I realized what I was getting myself into, and at the time I was just looking to see a movie - not have an "experience."   I'm going to try really hard not to just be a curmudgeon about the whole thing, but there are a few flaws I'd like to see fixed before I ever go again.  1) Figure out some way to make the lights next to the seats optional. I hated having a light on the entire movie. I didn't need it but there was no way to shut it off. 2) Get the servers more comfortable with serving. They were a little slow and forgetful. I'm figuring it's just due to the fact that we're in a dark theater and this is a new thing. 3) I know that there is a poster talking about how the whole thing works, but I didn't see it. I'm not the type to just go asking for help because I'm stubborn and want to figure most things out myself. (Grumpy Becky is voicing her opinions now, sorry.) That being said, I kinda wish it would have been easier for me to figure out on my own and through a little less trial-and-error. (I sat for about fifteen minutes waiting for service before realizing that I needed to push the service button.) I know, I'm being THAT girl.  Also, let it be noted that if you're going in a group of three, be ready for the third wheel to feel even more excluded. The seats are set up perfectly for couples...and that's about it.  I will probably try this place at least one more time, but I'll hope to swindle someone into buying my ticket for me.

I was really looking forward to coming here with my mom. She was taking me to see Mike and Dave for my 20th birthday. We reserved our tickets online, not knowing that this was a 21+ movie. There is a TINY sign when buying the ticket online that says 21+ but it was definitely too small for me to notice. Upon arrival, the cashier scanned the tickets and charged us for the tickets. AFTER they already charged my moms card, the cashier asked me how old I was and I told her I was 20. She proceeded to tell me I could not enter the auditorium. She should have asked me before she charged our card. She didn't apologize for the inconvenience but instead, argued with us and told us that we should have seen the 21+ warning on the web site. We asked to get a refund since I couldn't be admitted inside and she just rolled her eyes and walked away to get a manager. They ended up just letting us see the movie. I was very disappointed with the service :(   AMC, if you read these, PLEASE, have your employees check ID before you charge us. And work on making it more obvious that a movie will be 21+ for people reserving seats online. Because clearly it's not that noticeable.

This used to be our favorite theater. Not so anymore. We went last night and asked to see if they had seats together for a show. We were told no, so we got separate seats. When we got into the theater the entire last two rows were open. Second, they've started showing literally 30 minutes of previews. Third, when we pressed the service button to order food, 30 more minutes elapsed and no one ever came up to us. I went to complain, but there was no manager to be found. The bartender had to run food to me. By the time I ordered food from the bar (and missed the movie in the process) no one had helped my friends who  still had their call lights on.  Between the crappy service and previews, there's just literally no reason to come to this theater anymore. Go to desert ridge if you must--avoid this theater at all costs.

AMC Dine-In is easily the premiere eat-in movie experience.  It's not just the fact that you can get food and drinks during your movie (which is great), but the quality of the whole experience.  Service is fast and awesome.  The menu is huge - this is no bar menu.  The seats and super comfortable leather recliners with power recline - you could easily sleep in these seats.  Table tops and cup holders are perfect for dining or keeping out of your way.  I don't even want to go to regular movies anymore.

Great experience.   While not as classy as iPic, located in the center Biltmore, surrounded by vistas of the Phoenix mountains makes up for it being just a regular theater.   Really really cheap tickets, but it's to encourage you to order food. I did have an issue with getting someone to talk to about ordering, but it was resolved quickly. So other than that this is a great theater, with big comfy chairs, however don't expect them to bring you a blanket and pillow like at iPic.   It's a great place for a date, knocking out a dinner and movie at one place for a nice price.
Comfy seats, good service, below average food. Don't forget to bring your parking pass to get it validated.

I'm going to start with you are paying for the experience of having dinner and a movie.  For someone who works in the "industry" we have a saying "Hotel and Airport prices... what can you do."  The same applies here.  You should expect to drop $100 for tickets, app, 2 entrees, and dessert (their shakes are huge so you can easily share this)The food is mediocre but the serving sizes are fair.   Here's  why they got too stars.  Part of the experience is having a button in case you need a refill on your drink, want to order something a little extra etc.  Kind of like calling your steward on an airplane.  So half way through the movie I push my button.  My $4.50 + tax coke was empty.  10 minutes go by still no one comes.  My daughter pushes her button as she doesn't have any more of her drink left.  Another ten minutes go by STILL no one comes.   Okay... SHIT happens.  I get up and leave the theater (like you would at a normal theater where drinks are only $3) and go ask the very sweet bartender if I can get some assistance in the theater because we've pushed the button and could really use some drinks.  She says absolutely.  I kid you not 15 minutes before the movie ends a girl (who was not the person I ordered from) rudely asked what we needed.  Really!?!?!   For the price that you are paying for the "experience" service should be included.  And if you provide a tool to help with that service it should be used.  And when it's  used and you fall short when I ask for help (politely as I totally get it the things happen) don't  be rude.   I will eat at a restaurant next time and go to a movie afterwards.  Sorry AMC

I love movies. Going to see the latest flick is one of my favorite things to do, and I don't mind doing so at AMC Esplanade. Here they give you the option to do the Dine-In theatre, where you get big comfy recliner chairs and a waitress who will serve you restaurant style food and drinks - alcohol included! It is a fun movie-going experience, and makes for a great date night or a night out with friends. The only real con is that prices can add up fast as tickets, food, and drinks are all paid for separately. But the overall experience is nice, and I'd recommend checking it out.

This place is amazing! I read the reviews and I must say I have had completely different experiences. The staff is both courteous and friendly. they offered me several suggestions and the wait for drinks and food was minimal. I suggest to the people who dislike this theatre so much please go somewhere else and save the good seats for those of us who love this place! AMC you hit a home run here and we love you for it...

This was always my go to theater.  Our experience last night was not what I expected here.  The menu here has changed.  It is not anywhere near as good as it used to be.  The food we did get was mediocre at best.    The seats were filthy when we came in and had to wait for someone to come and clean them before we could even sit down.  The menus were also filthy and sticky.  Definitely NOT worth the premium price anymore.  I live really close to this theater and it really is sad that I'll now drive elsewhere for a movie.
What an amazing laid back theater! Literally you can lay all the way back in the seats. Not to mention a friendly waiter or waitress is always just a ring of a bell away
There was no server available at all this is happened three times we were only two people in the whole theater do yourself a favor and go to Harkins instead

This was our third visit to the AMC on Camelback.  The first time was before it became a dine in venue, and the second time was before we KNEW it had become a dine in venue.  That time, the guest services agent was so rude to us when they came to understand we had not made a reservation before brazenly appearing 20 minutes before a start time I would never have returned to the location again.    Since a friend had given us some vouchers and gift cards we decided to brave it with a little better planning after my husband had knee surgery.  We thought the reclining seats would be more comfortable for him.  So I called the day before to find out how we could use the vouchers if we had to purchase our tickets online ahead of time to get a seat.  The agent was friendly enough and advised us we could purchase the tickets and they would exchange the vouchers after the show.  I suspected it would not be as easy as that, and my instincts were right. After the show, the cashier said she didn't know if she could do what we were asking and called the MOD.  This person had the poorest customer service skills I have ever encountered, and having worked (and managed) in customer service/retail/restuarants myself, I know there was something he could have done.  He chose rather to refuse to make it right, so at the end of the day, we paid for the tickets out of pocket and were stuck with the vouchers to a theater we would neither return to NOR send our friends to by regifting the vouchers. More on this below*  Additionally, while the server was nice, the tray and menus at my seat were dripping with something unknown and sticky and greasy.  She served me a flat coke and when I sent it back, she brought me one that was good, then brought my refill with the FLAT coke again.  REALLY?  The popcorn was stale and not hot, so I would definitly have saved $9.  Considering that I have again and again commented to my husband how GOOD the service is at our locally owned theatres, Harkins, I don't think I would consider going anywhere else unless he gets the other knee done and needs the recliner.  So all in all, the only thing that wasn't terrible about this experience was the chair and the movie.  *being suspicious of the ease of the exchange was my problem here. I used the CG to buy the ticket online, rather than use my debit card since under no circumstances did I want any credit for this awful theatre when the day was over. When I went to the counter to see what they could do with my vouchers, they were unable to refund the balance i paid online back to the card so I could then use it to pay $20 for the stale popcorn and flat coke.  The manager had a choice between us leaving pissed and figuring something out, but he was unable to think of a thing.  In the same position, I would have perhaps comped us a bill credit on our concessions in exchange for the vouchers rather than seeing us walk out angry and ready to write a terrible review about stuff I would have let slide, like the crappy popcorn or the goo I stuck my hand in when I opened the menu.  Let it be known I still tipped her 25% even though I would certainly not have re-served flat coke to a guest.  She wouldn't be working in a dine in theatre on a weekday if she were a rocket scientist.

Tried to buy movie tickets online and was told "movie tickets were not available at this time". I called to ask if our movie was sold out and if we could pick another time so we wouldn't have to drive all the way out to Scottsdale if it was unavailable and was transferred to an assistant who told me to call again later.

Super comfy chairs.. relaxing... and a good time to get away and just relax. The new bar is always a plus.. and our waiter Phillip was pretty awesome as well. The only down side to our adventure? We sat in the top row and if you put your chair back at all the little wall in front of you cuts off about half of the screen... design flaw much? Other than that.. pretty great.. can't wait for another movie!

Went to see Captain America tonight. Movie was great. I ordered the hamburger, it was good, the fries were cold. Date ordered nachos, they were cold and they couldn't make new ones because they were out. Ordered drink- margarita, it was $12 and good but not $12 worth.
This theater is amazing. I love being able to go to the movies, be comfortable, have some drinks, and best of all have no screaming children ruining the movie. Love this place

So disappointed in the experience I had Friday night when I took my family to see Leap.  My 8 year old daughter was very excited for the dinner & movie concept, but the food was not properly cooked and the popcorn was stale.  Our server Abby was very nice and tried hard to accommodate us, but the overall experience was not the quality that I would expect for the prices paid.

Dining experience was well executed, but the quality of the food and price did not do it justice. How do you screw up chicken tenders? I've had better from fast food joints. Seating was clever and practical, just no where to hang a jacket. If you're not from the area, it can be a pain to find the entrance and parking. Didn't help the movie I was dragged to sucked, but the service was actually really good. Crappy food, cumbersome locale and parking, and overpriced.... Eat at a restaurant first, then go to a normal theatre.
Overpriced tickets, lousy communication, passive aggressive employees. I walked out before I even got my tickets. If I could rate this zero stars I would.
The food was fresh, the seats are wonderful, lots of room, all round a great date. But for the drinks guy who kept acting like he really didn't want to be there, this is a five star place. Superb.

Still the best place to watch a movie, but no longer a complete date in one location. They just downsized their menu and filled it with sushi and quinoa and 12-dollar mac and cheese. Bring back a real menu and you get your other 2 stars back, AMC.

I don't care how much it costs. I'll never see another movie in anything other than their cinema suites again. Ever.  I love their leather recliners! They are just as comfortable as the one at your grandparents house. Plus, you get beer delivered to you at the touch of a button and prices are surprisingly reasonable (4 for a pint of domestic, 5 for imports). Plus, you get a sample of specialty popcorn, a warm towel, and a Ghirardelli chocolate on your way out.   It can get crowded in the evenings, so you might want to consider purchasing your tickets ahead of time.  Don't go expecting AMC to serve you a gourmet meal unless you think Applebee's is a real treat.

We go to Film Bar fairly regularly.  You can bring your own food or purchase theirs, which includes some very fine tamales.  Since we were going to be at the Biltmore, we decided to try the Esplanade 14 dine-in theater.  We chose the fork&screen option.  The seats were well padded and leaned slightly backwards, but did not actually recline.  So they were comfortable except that to eat you had to sit up straight while your seat remained in its slightly reclined position.  On the tray next to your seat, the theater provides a dinner-sized cloth napkin, restaurant grade, wrapped around metal bread knife and fork.  Very nice!  However, be sure you open your napkin and check your utensils before the lights go off.  Both of ours were dirty, especially the knives with dried food particles.  Hoping to avoid bothering the server and because we were alone in our row with no others in the rows before or behind us, we opened and checked other utensil packages (4 additional sets), none of which were clean.  Our server graciously provided clean utensils. The food itself was fine, not great, but good enough.  I had fish and chips at $12, which was as good as Rose McCaffrey's. The meal included fries, a brussels sprouts slaw (slightly bitter), and garlic cheddar buttermilk biscuits (very good).  My partner had a hamburger; he thought the $12 price high but he was well satisfied with quality. His hamburger came with french fries.  Our server asked if he would prefer tater tots or their special fires instead.  He decided on tater tots but did not discover that meant an extra charge until the check arrived.  This on top of the $12!, especially since our server did not warn there would be an extra charge for substituting tater tots.  However, other than failing to tell us about the extra charge, our server was polite and helpful.  Next time we chose fork&screen, we'll avoid being uncomfortable while eating by ordering drinks and finger food.  That way we can continuously decline with our slightly reclined, well-padded chairs.  The movie was good, so overall we had a pleasant evening.

Wow! This theatre has redefined a night out at the movies. They've taken everything we dislike about most movie theatres and replaced it with a new way to cater to America's favorite obsession. Here are some examples (but you've gotta experience this for yourself to fully appreciate it):  Typical theatre: Get to the movie early so you can beat the crowds and find a good seat.  Esplanade 14: Choose your seat beforehand (all seats same price)  Typical theatre: stand in line at the concession stand and give up a better seat or part of your movie and expect major price gouging.  Esplanade 14: pay reasonably priced concessions from the comfort of your seat with the help of a server (included).   Typical theatre: small, dirty/sticky, cloth seats with little leg room Esplanade 14: big plush leather seats with a fold out table with so much leg room you should never touch the seat in front of you. And they were thinking large Americans here- No problems for the 300+ pounders. They won't be spilling over into the seat next to them.  These seats rock!...literally   Typical theatre: various popcorn sizes and drink sizes all rediculously priced.  Esplanade 14: one popcorn size 7.50 (free refills and large enough to feed anyone), one drink size (large with free refills). Not a rip off either.   Typical theatre: $10-$11 Esplanade 14: $13 and probably should cost more.   Only one negative thing to say: I don't like the extra butter for my popcorn on the side in a small plastic cup. I don't know how to put it on like the specially trained concessions staff and it's difficult in the dark. The theatre should complete the preparation of the popcorn before it reaches your seat.

Out of all the dine-in theaters we have in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area  I do take preference to this one due to price and service. iPic is awesome but extremely overpriced, and the rest are a dud.    I love having the cinema suites with 21+ only to avoid children and crying babies which is often the culprit of a ruined movie experience.    The drinks are a little expensive, but I wouldn't expect any less at a dine in theater. I've definitely paid more for a cocktail in Old Town,    The food is served in fair portions, but as stated in other reviews the menu is like a Chili's. Their Parmesan fries are ridiculously good!   Service is always fast and attentive, staff overall is great.    We will be back for other movies!

Horrible! 8 dollars for popcorn. You kidding me?  Seating is terrible. The self serve machines in the lobby don't work. Very overpriced tickets. Piss poor food. Terrible candy options. Please read what I am writing and trust me...GO TO HARKINS!!!

Not bad.... But not unbelievably great either. This place is a bit overpriced for what it is and the food is mediocre at best (comparable to maybe say, Applebee's, or something along those lines?). The location is convenient for those living in east or central Phoenix and the leather chairs and recliners are nice touches as well. Choosing your seat ahead of time helps ensure you know what you're signing up for and eliminates the need to hunt around in the dark to get a group seated together, etc. All things considered, I wouldn't go out of my way to catch a flick here and I'd definitely grab something to eat somewhere else before or after the movie.

My husband and friend went to see "The Other Women" on 5-25 and had a family behind us that had a 10 month old who cried often (of course it was his nap time) and then with his boredom he tipped over glasses and kept pushing the service buttom, The 2 women had their phones on talking out loud. When we complained to the manager he told us that babies/children were allowed in the theatre in the am and afternoons and they weren't allowed to ask families to leave. The manager was extremely arrogant and continued to insult our sensibilities with stupid excuses how children prevailed even though before the movie the rest of us are told to turn our phones off and not to disturb others during the movie. I have never had this experience with Harkin's anywhere in the Valley, and even though this is considered a higher class establishment i would rate it very low. I was told that you have to attend movies where kids aren't welcomed  (theatre's 1-7),  however what if you want to see that peticular movie?  This was by NO means a child's movie much less an appropriate movie for a baby. We purchased our seats and the theatre was full and small so moving wasn't an option. My husband and friend are post cancer patience's so attending a movie at night is difficult for them.  Be aware of this place, know the rules and stay away during the day with theatre's (8-14 ). If there is a movie you want to see don't go there if it's during the day in the movie theatre's allowing babies and children.  They gave us free tickets to come back but after being insulted by the rude manager, I returned them and told him to give them to someone who cares. We will never step back in this place again. I am in Pediatrics and love children, but not all parents are insightful enough to respect others when they go to the movies. And, then again, I guess they knew what they were doing because their poor choices are reinforced by the Management.  Our first 2 times there were very nice but this last time was our last. Good Luck and be very paranoid.

This is the only movie theatre I enjoy going to. I like to know exactly where I am going to sit. The seats are big and somewhat comfy-after getting settled in. I appreciate my personal space which I get here. The fact that we can order food and drinks from a full bar....enough said. It's clean way more than not. Noticed once the seat/console area needed to be wiped down better and one of our menus looked like someone literally took a bite out of it, no biggie tho. The staff has always been friendly, helpful, and attentive. We've never had an issue with parking and they have a machine to validate the garage ticket. AMC Esplanade is our first choice to go watch a movie.

Nothing like paying $15 a ticket only to have to watch ads blare on a big screen before the movie. I expect to be able to talk to my date before the show, but the ads make it entirely unpleasant. Give us a repreive. Or at least give us some sort of original programming.

This place has seen better days.  The 2 escalators leading up to the theater have been broken for (literally) months, and now one of the elevators is down too.  Just a few flights of stairs, though, so workable for me, but perhaps not for others.  Anyway, we ordered tickets online a week in advance, but when we got to the theater, we learned that our movie had been "canceled."  I've never had this happen before. They did refund the cost of my tickets, but not the $3.50 convenience fee I had to pay when I ordered the tickets online.  That seems unfair since I was greatly inconvenienced at having to travel to the theater to learn my movie was canceled.  Why no email from the theater in advance, which would have saved me the trip?  Basically I paid AMC $3.50 to give them the opportunity to disappoint me.  It worked.

Gross... Make sure to check your silverware.  Accidentally set the silverware in the light and it was covered in food parts and dirty right out of the rolled napkin.  Seating is great but I wouldn't eat the food.  Stick to popcorn and drinks.  Manager was 17 and offered nothing but an apology and two free passes to come back.  Wouldn't do anything toward the bill. See pictures I took of the silverware in the photos. Time for a health inspection?
Terrible food. Not great service and the movie was 25 minutes late.  Didn't even offer anything to make up for the huge delay.  Not coming back.

Comfortable reclining seats in the 21+ theater, while enjoying a glass of wine, sign me up! If only there wasn't a giant wall that cuts off a portion of the screen! I'm a pretty short person so this was even more inconvenient for me. I found myself pushing off the seat to see the screen at times throughout the movie, which is sad. The other rooms don't offer the reclining seats and the seats are a lot more close together so you don't have very much space.  We like going here, 1, because it's really close to our place; 2, you can reserve your seats in advance and avoid lines or having to get to the theater early just to get a good seat; and 3, because they sometimes offer reduced prices (I'm talking $5) for earlier showings. I'm a morning person so this works out great on the weekends! The food isn't the best meal you'll eat, but it does beat standard movie food. However, with all the great restaurant options within walking distance, I'd suggest you save your money on a better meal. I will say that we went to Studio Movie Grill last year and we were not impressed at all. In my opinion, AMC is slightly better. If AMC got rid of the giant walls blocking the screen, this would be my favorite theater.

This is the best movie theater ever. We usually go see movies in the cinema suites if available. Basically you get to watch from the comfort of a la-z boy that reclines. It's also great that there are servers who bring you food and booze. My only complaint would be that the food is not spectacular, but who cares. Just fill up on beer. I'm not sure I can ever go back to a regular theater.
What a nice way to watch a movie! Big comfy seats,Waiter service and refillable popcorn! It was great! The food was good. I don't think that I can enjoy a normal theatre again.

It's awesome to have a movie theater with NO KIDS. It's awesome to have a movie theater where the white trash behind you cannot kick your chair.   Food: better than any other movie theater around. Chicken tenders are awesome, and when I ask for extra ranch dressing, oh boy do they comply.  This is my favorite theater and I cannot say anything better.

I don't know if it is because it's a full moon, or a Monday night or what but tonight it was difficult for me to enjoy my movie because on our right, a couple guys brought their own carrots and on our left, a couple not only brought their own crunchy snacks but also bottled beer...yes bottles of beer! And to top it off, they were smoking off electric cigarettes that each time emitted a blue, LED light and an awful, sickly smoke. REALLY? AMC management really sucks at this location if they are so BLIND and other sensory impaired that they don't see this abuse. And here we are paying all this money not just for tickets but to buy their expensive mediocre food and wine only to be assaulted by this experience. EPIC FAIL AMC.

I really enjoy coming to this theater for a little "treat yo' self" as a fun alternative to a regular theater. We like to grab seats in the cinema suites if we can - there's nothing better than feeling like an extra in wall-e as you recline in giant red leather chairs pushing a button for someone to come wait on you as you enjoy fine theatrical entertainment. It is straight up American relaxation.   The drinks are pretty delicious - I would suggest the electric lemonade or the southern slammer. I think my only complaint is the food. For $12 chicken fingers, I would expect more than pre-formed frozen chicken strips that I could get in a high school cafeteria. But I will forgive the chicken strips. Because lounging in those comfy chairs instead of praying someone doesn't sit in front of me in a regular theater with a drink in my hand is totally worth the extra $5 in my world.

As far as movies go, this is one of my favorite theaters in the area! You can always find good deals (ie, buy one get one) and regular movie tickets are very reasonably-priced. The seating is luxurious and extremely comfortable. They keep it very clean and neat. While the food is alright, the prices are way too steep for what they offer. Beers are reasonable and the service the three times I've been has been really friendly inside the theater. The bar, however, is a different story. While never totally full, it takes a very long time to be served. Your best bet is just to order something inside the movie!

Phew there are a lot of reviews. My wife and kids love the comfy chairs and chicken tenders. Seems crazy to me, but have a real hard time getting them to go to a traditional movie theater now.   BTW my star rating is based on experience,  balanced with hit to the pocket book.

The dine-in theater at AMC is the PERFECT place to take a date.  With dine-in experiences being 18+ there are no children running around.  The food is the same price as a Chili's and they bring it right to your seat while you enjoy the feature.  I'm definitely going back!

I was excited to visit an AMC dine in theater during a house hunting trip. Food was cold. Ordered a margarita that I nick named, "ass water". Seriously, the worst thing I have ever tasted. Service was awful.

Was so glad when I found out about this place because I love the Cinema Suites! It is similar to iPic but way less as expensive and just as good, in it's own way. Love how you press the button for service if you want to order and the great seats that recline. The only downside was that the wall in front of us kind of blocked the screen when you reclined the chair. Other then that, love it! I can't go to a regular theater anymore!

Except for the fact that this theater doesn't have Dr. Pepper, this place rocks!!!  Power reclining leather chairs.  No one is cramped.  Every seat is as roomy as your leather recliner at home...if you have one.  Waiters / Waitresses serve a variety of beverages, alcohol included along with food.  This is the place to see a movie.

First off, the staff is GREAT.  Friendly, professional, and thorough.  Big kudos to whoever hires these folks.  Great brand ambassadors.  The product, however, is just okay.  The food's about the quality you might find at a Chili's in an airport.  It's not bad, it's just nothing you can't get a million of other places.    Then there's the theater.  Great idea.  Needs some fine-tuning.    After getting there, we found out that the movie we wanted to see was showing in a theater without Lazyboy chairs.  (Wish we had known before we bought tix and drove there.)  We wanted to experience the Lazyboys and switched movies.  Upon sitting in our seats, we noticed there was a partition (you can kinda see this in one of the photos here on Yelp) that covered the bottom 20% of the screen. (25% if you're short like one of the women with us.)    Then we tried to order some more food.  Turns out what we wanted was listed in the menu, but only available in select locations - one of which, this was NOT.  So between the food being mediocre, stuff we wanted being unavailable and the theater sightlines being compromised, we left before the film started.  I can't think of a reason to ever go back.  But one more time - the people are terrific.  AMC just needs to give them a better product to represent.

What a great place!  I've been going here for the past year about twice per week.  The facility is always clean and the staff is friendly.  The concept of this theater is nothing but fun. They have a bar located in the lobby with seating if you choose to have a drink while waiting for friends. You can take your drink with you in the movie if you do not finish it.  There are "2" theater types. Fork N Screen permits children where "Cinema Suites" only permits 21 and over. Both serve the same food & drink menu. The Fork N Screen has more seating but the seats do not recline where the Cinema Suites are far more private and the seats recline. I love the little red help buttons next to each seat if you need service, hit the button and voila... they show up! The food is average, the apps are pretty good, and the drinks are fun. There are really good restaurants located in the Esplande if you choose to have dinner elsewhere and then see a movie.  They also validate for parking for 4 hours!  Overall, this is a great spot for a night alone, date night, girls night, or a family afternoon. AMC also has a stubs program ($12.00 year) I use it to earn points and free dollars to use.

In the past, this WAS the greatest way to see a movie, great menu, surprisingly excellent food, comfortable seats, advanced purchase reserved seating that's effortless... What changed is that the last three visits the food was terrible. The menu is simpler but it's a much lower quality in preparation and ingredients. The Avacado/crab sushi last night did it for me though, it was by far the worst sushi roll I have ever tasted. Will not be going back.

This place is so awesome that I literally can't stand to see movies at any other theater now.  I feel like I'm in international first class when I sit in the higher end "Cinema Suites."  I feel like I'm in my living room recliner with a server when I'm in the "Fork and Screen."  So basically, it's awesome.  Most comfortable theater in the Valley hands down.  The food and drinks are pretty good, and not insanely expensive either.  I can't stop going back.

It was 2013 and we decided to come down for mini-vacation from San Diego to see my folks. My parents gave us the a parent's pass that weekend out and so we decided to give this a try from the traditional theater. It was an amazing experience and to be honest we haven't been to another theater since... Moving forward we decided to move to Phoenix from San Diego Spring of this year and we've been coming here at least 2-3 times a month (gotta love the Stubs Rewards). I mean seriously we can nit pick about this and that but when it comes to enjoying a movie that you paid a pretty penny for the last thing you want is some teeny-boppers obnoxious ass talking next you or smacking on their food... Love the freedom of having to reserve your seat in advance and the food/drinks aren't that bad.

I bought tickets and reserved seats 22 hours before the movie. Don't bother doing all that.  I got to my seats and they were taken. Again, I had reserved them- had confirmation emails and codes. Apparently it didn't matter. According to Mario ( a manager but I'm hoping not for much longer) it's first come first serve. We eventually moved to other seats, but the woman who had reserved them wanted us to move. I had yet another bewildering and belittling conversation with MARIO who TOLD us to move. We didn't.
