Another manager with some actual communication skills found seating for the other displaced party.  Usually I wouldn't care where I sat, but I needed my broken foot elevated.  I was treated condescendingly and very poorly by this untrained and confused Mario.  Will never return to this theatre. Going to I pic from now on.

This is the first dine-in theater I've ever been to, and I love it. For one, the big, cushiony chairs are super comfortable. The first time I came to this theater, about a month and a half ago, I did not realize this is a dine-in theater and was a little surprised to find no concession station in the cinema lobby. At first, when I entered the actual theater for the movie and looked at the menu, I was skeptical. My previous experience with theater food, outside of popcorn, nachos, and soft pretzels, told me that the quality of the food would be low, but then I wasn't pleasantly surprised. The first time I ordered the fire-roasted veggie quesadillas and they were excellent, definitely restaurant-quality. A couple of times I ordered their mushroom Swiss burger and it was excellent. My only complaint is that sometimes when I would ask for a refill for my iced tea and was told that it was coming up, the refill would never appear. Other than this, I have enjoyed my film-viewing experiences here. True, it is slightly more expensive than regular theaters, including the price of admission, but it's a nice change from the regular theater experience. Because of the price, however, I don't go here all of the time when a movie I want to see comes out.

Ugh, I used to love coming to this movie theater and have been for years. The last time we went we were headed to see The Revenant (great movie by the way, from what we could see...read on..) and were placed in theater 5. My boyfriend went to the movies to purchase our tickets a few days in advance and the seats that were available were up higher in the back. So we arrive ready and excited since we normally love this movie theater and we sit down. UMMM to our surprise, we can't see the bottom 25% of the screen like others have mentioned. A block of wall literally blocks your view. I had to sit with my feet underneath me as high as I possibly could just to hopefully be able to see the whole movie. Even then, I couldn't see some of the subtitles. WTH? Who builds the inside of a movie theater like that?  It was also extremely hot in the room. We were sweating throughout the whole movie and that's gross. So much for a relaxing experience.. Service was whatever, but I've been in the service industry so I am more understanding to things like that. We also didn't order food that night so I can't comment on that.  I've had the food there a few times and honestly, it never really bothered me. It wasn't wonderful but it wasn't terrible.  But with this experience, we will never be back. What a waste!! Get your sh*t together

Came here for the first time last night - was a little hesitant due to the negative reviews. We saw Batman in the Forks and Screen theater. Loved it! The seats are comfortable (despite what another reviewer said), everything was clean at our seats and our server came by right away like he said he would. We each ordered appetizers and already had drinks from the bar. The food was great! The only negative would be that it's pretty distracting having servers going in and out during the movie. But it's to be expected at a place like this and just something you have to deal with. 4 stars because of price - we had two tickets, two drinks and three apps. It was over $80 - not sure that it's worth that. But good for a once in a while date!

Super disappointed at this theater! We ordered tickets online for the 3 of us and drove 45 minutes only to find out about the rule of over 21 for the theater with reclining seats. Our daughter that was with us is 17 and accompanied by 2 parents. She's sure not disruptive and was standing there with the manager and was told she couldn't go in because people pay to not be around others under 21. I totally get the rule if kids try to come in as a group of rowdy teens or preteens but I feel like an exception could have been made for this case - especially since the rule isn't spelled out on the website at all. The girl and manager explained you have to hover over an icon to see the rule!! Really - well that's the last time we will come here. How disappointing for our family night out!!
Love these movie theaters with the lay down seats and service while you watch a movie! Saw The Decendants, great movie great theater!

I used to give this place 5 stars, but since corporate changed the food I downgraded it. Everything is completely inedible - how do you screw up pretzels?? However, we love the reclining chairs and the staff is amazing - they even know us by name! (Thanks to Simone, Ana and Lindsey!) We had two incidents where the movie was canceled because the fire alarm came on and the power went out, but they quickly gave everyone refunds and free tickets to a future show.  All in all, still great, but please change back the food!!

Once again disappointing experience at AMC esplanade. No one taking tickets at the entrance (had purchased online and printed) had to ask employee that acted highly disturbed to speak to a customer which theater. Bathroom and theater not clean as usual. Was in knife and fork theater, no wait staff stopped by in two hours or even glanced in our direction. Customer service at this place is virtually non existent. Oh and the escalators once again not working. Not sure why I pay a premium to see a movie here?
Sushi is absolutely terrible. The tables that are with the seating have been dirty/sticky, along with the menus and silverware. The service is good but the cleanliness is a huge problem.

Contrary to everyone else, we really enjoyed our free movie experience.  Super friendly grand opening staff ... almost bordering on Disney-esque enthusiasm. Hope the energy stays on!  We definitely would come here again, larger seating, quieter atmosphere due to 18+ age group, and decent dining without scary airport-like pricing (entrees $8.99-12.99)...  Food quality is Applebee's level, so set expectations accordingly...  Chicken tenders - run of the mill normal strips, no hint of coconut but there was the odd ponzu sauce.  Battered shrimp - received 7 large tender (not overcooked) shrimp, better but the ponzu sauce is corn syrup scary.  Allowed me to sub the typical fries for a small side salad (romaine).  Chicken fried steak - ok, came w/ hearty portion of mashed red potatoes and snap peas.  Smokey salmon sandwich - would order this again, came with chips  Triple berry stack - unmemorable  Chocolate brownie and ice cream - warm and delicious

It was so expensive and it was a thin Little burger... nothing like what it shows in the pictures displayed all over the theater. It look like it was just thrown together and it took 45 minutes to receive. I will never eat there again!

I mean, who doesn't like the idea of being able to sit back comfortably and eat while you watch a movie? This isn't my first time watching here, but this has changed the way I like to watch movies in theaters. Their seats are far more comfortable in my opinion than 'regular' movie theaters and you reserve your spots when you purchase tickets, but note that Not all rooms have recliner seating. I ordered food while here and got their southern style chicken tenders which came with buttermilk biscuits and fries. The tenders were really good and so were the fries, but the biscuits I couldn't eat because they were so hard. Oh well, still enjoyed my experience here and will most likely keep coming back to watch movies. Also, this particular location is garage parking only with a fee, but AMC validates your parking ticket.

I came to see Jurassic World with my boys.   I haven't been here in years but I did like the underground parking options.  It's so hot and parking outside in the summer with leather seats in not a good idea.  There was plenty of parking and we were able to park by the elevator.   We got upstairs and the view is nice you can see camelback mountain.  It's right in front of the Biltmore shops too.   The facility is really nice, they have a seating area and had lots of bottles.  It's nice to relax and watch a movie.  We found our seats right away.  It's reserved seating and we did everything online.  It was very easy and convenient because you just print your tickets and go to your theatre.   The service is good and the food is comparable to Applebee's appetizer menu.  They also have sushi, pizza and burgers.  We got fish and chips, nachos and popcorn.  It's a good options to go watch a movie and eat lunch/dinner.  We got our parking ticket validated and called it a day.  Overall great experience!

My favorite movie theatre in our neighborhood! I love that we can order our tickets ahead, so that we don't have to arrive early to look for seats. They always play all the latest blockbusters, so you have plenty of movie choices. I love the comfortable seats here, but not all theaters offer the same seating (some recline others don't). They do have a nice variety of food options, but I usually stick to popcorn. The French fries are pretty tasty though so that's a must have. Good service, comfy seats, & good popcorn so you can't go wrong with this theatre.

This is def 1 of my Absolute Favor8 places 2 go every opportunity I can & I'd luv 2 give them a Perfect score but unfortun8ly out of the countless Xs I've been there, my 1st experience there doesn't allow 4 that 2 b the case. Guess it's pretty impressive that out of all those Xs since, it's been nothing but an EXCEPTIONAL experience Every single time in service & food (other than WAY 2 much salt on popcorn once), but it still can't take away what wasn't handled as it should have been 4 the 1st impression. Have dined in both the fork & screen & the Cinema Suites (both r Gr8 but our preference is the Suites: b~n roomier & more luxurious)!     My 1st visit was 4 a special occasion 2 celebr8 the birthday of my very special guest.  Unfortun8ly it never fails, there was a crazy lady seated 2 our left in the row behind us.  I'd like 2 think she had tourette's syndrome but found out rather quickly she was a deliber8 instig8or &/or a bitter attention wh*re hag who was trying 2 ruin every1 else's time, not just immedi8ly around her but in the entire theater. 4 whatever reason (in her head) she put most of her focus upon us. Glad 2 know obviously we weren't the only 1s feeling that way...

I am torn about this theater. Yes the seats are super huge and comfy but I am not sure if it helps the movie experience. If you are on a date its really hard to be cozy without acting like you are in bed.  The food is not very good.

I want to love this place, I really do. We come here all the time, it's convenient because we live right down the street.  The food, tastes good, but is overpriced and hit or miss if you get it hot.  We went this last weekend for Rogue One, saw it on Sunday.  The first thing I noticed was that despite the fact the theatre remodel is less than 5 years old, had the seats were covered in duct tape due to rips and wear, while not a big deal, as expensive as the place is, makes it seem a bit rundown.  The server tried really hard and for the most part did a good job, but the kitchen was not prepared, they ran out of not one, but both of the meals my wife wanted and by the time they figured that out, the rest of us had finished our food.  We have had other times when the server was more concerned about getting paid than providing actual service. This place really needs to step it up if they want to be worth the price otherwise I'll just go downtown.  The ONLY thing I like about this place at this point is the reserved seating...

I just love this theater! It's made going to the movies fun again!!  I highly recommend the cinema suites experience if you can swing it... Big reclining chairs coupled with a great theatre food & drink menu, make it the ultimate way to catch the latest flick! (also, the cinema suites are adults only!)  I also recommend buying your tickets in advance online.  If you go to see more than a couple of movies a year, I would also consider joining the AMC stubs program, which waves of the online ticket fee, and gives you money back for $$ spent on tickets and concession items.  It costs $12/year to be a member, but I've made way more than that back in the year I've had it!  Oh and if you've got a sweet tooth, I would suggest ordering the ice cream waffle sundae with bacon bits... Yum!   TIP: Always remember to bring your parking stub from the garage downstairs up to the theater to be validated!

From parking to credits. The theater is not hard to find, however the parking is not cheap. I entered a parking garage labled theater and shop parking, over 70% of the spots were reserved so that was the first frustration... As you enter it says 1$per 20 min... Max 12$. After parking getting through the snake of stairs and elevators was rediculas. One set of elevators says not to use if you're a patron to the theatre and to use the staircase on the west end.  Then you go down a flight of stairs find another parking garage, go up a flight of stairs find an elevator around the corner and then you're finally at the entrance.  The movie we saw said start time at 1:30, no where on the website did it say to arrive early so we got there at 130. When we sat down at 135 the previews were playing and all the lights were off. The only light is a small dim light on the corner of the chair. I decided that I wanted to order the bbq brisket Mac and cheese for 13$ and an $8 blue moon. When it arrived the bowl was cold, the noodles were undercooked, and there was about 3 bites of dry hard brisket. The only thing good about the experience was the blue moon and the waiter who was pleasant for only being able to say few words while the movie played. So much potential in this but it fell soooo short
Awesome. The place is well kept and I can't wait to go their again. The prices are good and the service is excellent! Highly recommend!

A fun film to watch, "Secret Life of Pets." Great sound quality, perfect size of the screen and color in the film. That is the main reason why I added the third star. I have to say the worst experience ever in any theater we have ever experienced in our life time. Sad..... Comfortable seating, good sushi, & wine. It was difficult to see what we were eating because by the time we got our food the movie started and it was dark. Very expensive food and the service is not so great. Staff look like they don't want to be there and I was ignored when I stood by the bar waiting for service.  Two bartenders there who looked like they didn't want to be there and neither did the staff. I noticed two of the staff there kept looking at me as if I was going to steal something. No greeting or a smile or are you being helped? ...the waiter who served our food was almost on top of everything.  He was friendly and not slow and he knew what he was doing. Another staff person there was helpful too to let me know more about the theater. She was friendly and helpful. I have to say the experience we had with the manager there was pretty rude. We got there to meet with a non-profit organization and we were not able to find them. We had thought we had arrived to the wrong theater that day. All the staff there had no idea there was an event and neither did the manager. She looked on her list and didn't see the organization event on there. One of the cashiers there was helpful and even contacted the manager to find out what was going on. When we were about to leave we ran into the gal who is the owner of the organization. It was the correct theater and we walked back inside. We bought our tickets and my good friend saw the manager and approached her to let her know that the non profit organization was there and he pointed out where our table was just in case other people came in and could not find us. The manager's comment back was, "...we DON'T have any event here!, ....they sure didn't buy tickets from us!" she walked away. WTF! ....seriously? The non-profit organization did buy tickets from them. It was a very unprofessional rude comment that she made. We didn't want to let our fun evening go sour as it already did when we first arrived. I really don't think we plan to return.

Movie time!  We went to see "Chef"  what a great movie!  The food this time however left much to be desired.  I always have the Thai Bang Shrimp Tacos and this time the corn tortillas were old and dried out, and there was almost no shrimp to speak of.  My hubby had the Coconut chicken tenders and he did like those.  The rest of the experience was good as usual and this will not prevent us from coming back.  I just may ask this time if they changed the recipe.

After hearing about it for a while, we were very excited to try this theater for their food, drinks and movie. We made reservations online and got perfect seats which is a big plus. Front row=I don't go.   It's awesome to be able to sit down and order food when you're cutting it close on time for a movie. I was a little disappointed by the menu - it reminded me of a bar menu and nothing really jumped out at me. The waitress took my order before the previews - a chicken wrap and popcorn. The chicken wrap came about 15 minutes later and was decent.   The popcorn took 45 MINUTES. When we inquired about the popcorn, we were scolded with "it's not my department" from the waitress. By the time it came we were over it, so the $7/free refill deal is a joke considering the service is so slow.   Garage parking is free with validation.  I would go again just because the seating is so comfortable, but I would rather eat before!
In credible seats....well worth the the ticket price.  The food is overpriced and some is much better than others.  Nice for going on a date night!

Just went to see the hobbit marathon on mon and I got to say if I spent a whole day at a movie theater it would be at the amc esplanade 14 dine in theater the seats comfortable (even though there not cinema suite seats!) the service was great and super friendly and helpful and the food was even better from the drinks, appetizers, entrees and desserts I love this place I'd go everyday if I could I and would suggest this to anyone who wants a great movie experience.

I think the concept of AMC Esplanade 14 is great and the remodel is definitely looking nice but honestly,  the last thing I want while i'm sharing a room with far too many strangers is the smell of someones Smokehouse Beef and Cheddar lingering from behind me for two hours. Can't we enjoy movies with a drink, Red Vines, and popcorn anymore? Why do you need a New York Strip while you watch Prometheus?  I just don't get it. 3D movie plus a huge meal= vomit. Just saying.  Plus, who wants someone (servers) walking back and forth, back and forth, yada yada.. while you are trying to watch a movie? They do a great job of being quiet, courteous, etc.. but over all the service is just ok. We told our server before we ordered that my boyfriend and I were on a separate check from a friend and he still only brought us one check. Super annoying.   I say, if you are going to have a menu keep it small. They have tons of drink options that seem like they would be great but again, I doubt I'll down a margarita in a movie theatre. I promise I'm not boring. Hell, maybe I am.   I'm sure many people will rave about this and go on and on about how great it is to ring your server 5 times during a movie for more food... god. But this just isn't for me. I'll go and I'll bring my own Milk Duds and Red Vines. Don't tattle.

If I could give this place a zero I would! The customer service could be a lot better. Ask to speak to the manager regarding a issue with my waitress and the manager was very rude. He refused to let me speak and was very condescending! Don't even waste your time trying to contact corporate because they will never get back! Plus if you happen to be in one of the later movies, you'll surely catch most of the staff just hanging out at the bar and talking story about their personal lives for all to hear! No wonder it takes 30-45 min for my soda to come! When this theatre first started at this location many years ago it was good and lately I'm not sure if it's new staff or just complacency but this place has really declined! Do not go here! Go to anywhere else but this place! Seriously!!! Anywhere else!!! You've been warned!

I went to see "X-men: Days of Future Past" 3D in one of the Cinema Suites. The powered recliners are AWESOME! I was in row D, but in the future will only sit in lower rows as you can't fully recline without cropping out some of the bottom part of the screen. The theater was about 70% full by my estimation (25-30 people) and based on other reviews I was certainly worried about noise from people ordering food, etc. However, I found it to be a non-issue. It was maybe a little noisy for the first 10-15 mins of the movie, but it was so minimal that it's barely remarkable. There's such a drop in height from one row to the next that I think it prevents one from really being bothered by what's going on in rows that are in front/behind them. Also, I didn't feel that it was really any brighter after the movie started than it would be at any other "regular" theater. However, the little call/menu light was reflecting off of the inside of my 3D glasses. So, I took the cloth napkin and had it covering the light for most of the movie. For non-3D movies, I don't think this would be a problem. I ordered the Jalapeno Chipotle Burger with Parmesan Fries and it was HUGE and also pretty tasty. Not the best burger I've ever had, but good.The servers were really attentive, but not annoying. All in all, I was pretty impressed and feel that the $6-7 mark-up over a traditional first-run theater ticket is worth it, even if you don't get anything to eat.

Recently my uncle rented out a theatre at this location to celebrate my aunts 55th birthday! This would be this first time I've been to this theatre since they changed it into the dine-in movies. Lets just say I was very impressed! A few family members showed up early to set things up but when we arrived the staff was already on top of it! We requested to play a short video as soon as all the guests arrived and the staff had no problem accommodating that request. As the guests arrived the friendly staff walked around taking drink orders and quickly returned with the beverages and continued to take orders and help out with anything we requested. After a few minuets of greeting each other we sat down in our huge comfy recliners and started our private viewing of Iron man 3. During the beginning of the film the wait staff walked around taking food orders from the guests, we were given a fixed menu to choose our meals from. We had the option on a chicken quesadilla or loaded potato skins to choose from for an appetizer, and for the main course we could choose from four different burgers or a chicken Ceaser wrap (all options came with a choice or house made potato chips or french fries). I ordered the potato skins as my appetizer and the bacon cheese burger with french fries as my main meal. The potato skins were very good... not amazing but defiantly better that what I expected. Burger and fries were average.   The bar is pretty expensive... 40+ $ for a bottle of wine? 10+$ for a glass? That's okay if I'm fine dinning but get real... The wine selection wasn't even that great.   All in all the service was fantastic and the food was better than expected (but not wonderful)... Ill be back.

Horrible. They bring out my Jim beam wrong first go around. Then 15 minutes later our water and iced tea come out. This is after they bring us an order of wings that was wrong. Then the wings come back and they're ice cold!  We get those removed for some average popcorn and it comes with three sides of melted butter when it's already swimming in butter wth??  The waitress just stopped coming by and had other people drop off our stuff. We only saw her again when she dropped off the check that after all of that really should've been taken care of since it was only the soda tea and a shot of Jim beam. The soft drinks are 5.20!  Stay away. Shit service couldn't speak to the food.

What a great way to watch a movie!! We got to do the dinner theater, which cost $12 per ticket. Huge oversized stuffed chairs, great service. They, suprisingly, had a great well rounded menu for food and a full bar. I didn't have any drinks, but I did snag  an order of fish and chips with an ice tea that was perfect while watching a good movie. All in all, super fan!!!

This place was awesome! Danny and I love going to the movies, but this was our first Dine-in theaters. He loved the idea and ordered popcorn from our seats. We were able to make a 745 PM showing, even though we showed up right at 745 PM. It was a Thursday night, but the service was great and the usher that helped us to our seat was also really nice. I tried to order a drink at the full bar and that is where I wasn't greeted for a couple minutes. (No smile, no acknowledgement) It felt a little awkward and I almost left to go back to my seat. The bartender took my order brought my drink but took another couple minutes to charge my card to go. She proceeded to get other orders, not sure what they're protocol is, but I think it can be improved for timings sake. I wasn't an angry customer but I could tell you that another person or two were annoyed/not happy. Regardless, I came back to my seat and Danny was already enjoying his popcorn and next time I will just order from the seat! Much easier with less hassle!

The last few times we have been here the theatres auditorium was still dirty from the previous showings. I have always had really good service but the cleanliness is a real issue, especially considering that I have noticed and that is without the lights on. I also will caution you that the seats anywhere other than the cinema suites recliners are uncomfortable during long movies.

A Nice Change. Unique Experience. Food & Movie Experience Simultaneously. I sat in Fork & Screen for the matinee (only $6 per person). Other people said they had bad customer service in fork & screen, but I received awesome customer service. I got there before the movie started and placed my order during the previews. My food came out quick and Diner quality (tasty, but probably not awesome quality).   Quick Note Regarding Parking: Park behind the movie theatre, by where it says AMC & Shops. The movie theatre will validate your parking for 4 hours of FREE parking.   If you are a shopper....You can walk the underground path to the Biltmore mall afterwards for some quick shopping.

I have had high expectations for Esplande, but very bad management, hospitality and the timing on delivering food. My friend and I came to watch Black Panther 20 minutes before the movie started ordered our drinks and dinner, we could not enjoy the movie since we were waiting for our service... an hour later into the movie NOTHING yet. Went to check what was going on and still the staff scrambling on the food and drinks. Highly recommend coming to this theatre to just WATCH a movie and not DINE-IN.
Once you go to the movies here, you will never go to the normal movie theater again.  So nice to have a drink while watching the movie.

Other dine-in theaters around town are nicer...(your seats totally recline...but NOT here).   Food is pricey for the quality (and very carb- as you would expect)...and the DRINKS....wooooo $18 for a 3/4 full vodka martini and seemed watered down.  OUCH and BOOOO!  You can't beat $5 Tuesday though....that saved a star.

Seemed like a good idea on a hot day. Found out shortly after the previews started the AC wasn't working properly. It was cooler than being stuck outside in 117 degree heat. Had a tall beer and a recliner so I top a nap.

This was the worst food ever!!!  My husband and I both ended up sick the next day with food poisoning from the chicken we ate.  I would expect a lot more for the prices they charge for food/drinks.    I made a complaint about the experience which was never followed up on.  For a company as large as AMC I had hoped for better customer care practices.

I have been here several times and with the exception of my last visit, it has been a great experience (hence 4 stars). The difference between the Fork and Dine and the Cinema Suites is like business class vs. first class. Both are great but ones a little more plush. Food is good, service is good, it's comfortable,fun and a nice way to have lunch or dinner, a cocktail and a movie. I will continue to enjoy going here.

haven't been to a dine in for years.  the seats were comfortable but the food was horrible.  ordered a Quesada and it was soggy on the bottom.  the service was wasn't good at all.  when asked for an extra plate, the girl  who brought the food said "you ask your server for that" and very abrupt.  the server came eventually with a plate.  we were surrounded by several people and we got our food/drinks last.  i can understand if it takes longer to cook but it wasn't good.  $16 for a Quesada?  two pieces?  are you kidding.  prices really very high for everything and definitely not worth it.  the place looked like a ghost town and the theater is hard to find.  will not be going here again.

Been here a handful of times and nearly every time has been a total disappointment. Uncomfortable seats, theaters that smell like rotting food, the sound of falling forks and smacking lips the whole time, waiters running through the theater during movies... I understand the concept but man is it a terrible execution.

Boy oh boy do I like this theater... I must since I've probably dropped over $100 here in the past month between the 25 minute drive, the ticket price, and food; but I've got to say it's worth every penny!  In the past month, the Hubs and I have frequented the AMC Fork and Screen twice and have had the best experiences.  By combining two of my favorite activities, food and movies, AMC has made me one happy girl.  Ever since Farrelli's closed, we've been craving a similar experience.  Now with SMG and Fork and Screen we are set!  The service at this theater is great.  I love the fact you press one button and can get anything you want.  The food selection is good - chili's quality, but perfect for the movie and dining experience.  I've liked most everything I've eaten with the exception of the chicken fingers, which really tasted by McDonald's mcnuggets (which I usually like, but wasn't expecting here).  The tacos and pizza were great and overall, can't beat the prices.  The soda price is a little high, but that's ok you can get refills during the movie.  The seats/ atmosphere are awesome and everything is clean and new.  I can say without a doubt we'll be back... you can pick your seats in advance and have a no-hassle dinner/movie experience... what more could you want!

This has got to be the worst movie theater in town!!! Even when you call in multiple times for information, they cannot provide it, or worse yet they lie to you so that when you show up to purchase your reserved ticket from 30 minutes before and there are no seats left. Their min wage employees do not care about how quickly they are running this theater into the ground, they're just waiting around to go home.

ok this place is really nice and fancy!me and my friend is been coming to this place 2 or 3 times a week i dont mine spending that much money because i really enjoy coming to this place and its close in my house.but for the past 6 months have raise the price!it was 9.50 each person then.then it became 12.00 each person then on new year it was 13.00 dollars already that is abusing customers and taking advantage the people!we wont be back in this place anymore...they lost us as a customer!

This is how to watch a movie. Recline, order you meal and wine and enjoy. It's the service and theater experience that we lost. Love it. The 3d movies are excellent. Saw Guardians of the Galaxy in 3d. Awesome!!!! Don't just pick make sure you are in the full service nice  theaters

My first time was my last time. I may have to go see Atomic Blonde at another theater because I was so distracted by the awfulness of this place  The seats are horrible. They are barely an upgrade from the hard tiny theater seats of the 80s. These seats are naturally reclined at the strangest angle so that as a 5'4" woman my feet are slightly off the ground and my back is awkwardly arched as I am leaned back in the seat. It's not relaxing at all. In fact, sitting forward on the edge of the seat is so much better - but not really for 2 hours.   The tiny incandescent bulbs used to read the menus are on throughout the entire movie and high enough that they nag at my peripheral vision the entire time. It was horribly distracting.   The crab and avocado roll had the worst chemical smell to it that my wife and I both noticed as soon as it was brought to us. On top of that, when the server handed it to me, there was something slimy and crusty all over the bottom of the plate. Imagine wondering what the hell that is in the dark.   Lastly, right in the middle of an intense scene, the lights suddenly came on in the theater. Then about a minute later, they just as suddenly shut off. What a nice touch.   Not one single thing about this place impressed me.  I'd never return.

This place has comfortable chairs but I found a few things very irritating....  They started the show half hour late, for that half hour there was nothing being played on the screen... They delayed to deliver ppl's order... Also, during the show, servers were walking up and down to service ppl's request and blocking view of the screen... This totally kills the experience... The ticket is pricier than regular AMC theaters but the experience is worse... I am never coming here again

Tasteless and bland foods that will send you to an early grave. The food here is so bad that it completely detracts from the romanticism behind the idea of dining out and watching a movie at the same time. The food here is seriously bad and expensive. As if paying for bad food with your wallet wasn't bad enough you will also be paying for this food on the treadmill because just about every dish is within a short range of 1000 calories! Keep a careful eye out for the calorie listings on the menu if you go in. Terrible and unhealthy foods aside, I must say it wouldn't be a bad place to go for a dessert. I would not recommend going here for drinks though, since they are so expensive.  Friendly and attentive employees and waitstaff.

Love the concept! Dinner & drinks all while you watch a movie on the big screen! I'd been once before a couple years ago & remember really loving it! This time was just as enjoyable but only because of my date. Our server was also nice & efficient! The downfall was the theater was so dirty! There were crumbs on my seat & our tables. There was trash on the floor & the menus were sticky! It was surprising the state it was in. I liked my food but my husband wasn't happy the fries came room temperature. To be honest I don't think we'll go back. It's a nicer experience to get dinner somewhere else & go to a regular, clean theater.
The service and food was terrible!!! The food was cold. The fries was old and hard. The waiter took forever to bring drinks!!!! I couldn't even enjoy my movie!!! It was TERRIBLE!!!!

I would have given zero stars if it was allowed.  The Theatre is dirty, the concessions MUST be ordered through a waiter, who stands in front of you during the movie while the show is playing..  They also have a wall in front of each row, and sitting in the back row, the wall blocked 1/3rd of the screen, so the subtitles could not be read if you were reclined, and you have to crane your neck when sitting upright to see the bottom of the screen. This is true for any of the seats in the upper section, back from the screen. This Theatre was built several years ago and it shows it's age.  I would not recommend it, the Harkins at Scottsdale Fashion Square is much nicer, clean and you can get your own concessions.  When I complained about this viewing problem, the client service staff never got off their chairs and acted as if they could care less, so I asked to speak to the manager, and she was even less helpful.  Really horrible experience.

We loved going to this theatre when it first opened - having food and drinks during the movie was novel to us. Our first visit back in a couple of years was really disappointing. We arrived early (15 minutes) to order drinks and dinner to take in. There being no food menus in the lobby area we got wine (which took almost 10 minutes even though there was no line). Once in the theatre, we pressed our button to order and waited. The couple in front of us had already been waiting 15 minutes and (about 10 minutes apart) we separately approached theatre staff to request service (or to order). It took over 30 minutes for the wait staff to make an appearance in our section, while other sections had multiple staff in each.  Separately, I didn't recall how little room there is between rows. I couldn't cross my legs without having to be very careful to avoid kicking the back of the seat in front of me - and my seat was kicked throughout the movie.  We won't be back soon if at all. There are other options in the area.

Our Favorite Theater Experience Love the reclining seats, waiters, are really friendly and helpful. You've must try this place.  The only reason I don't give it a 5 star was the food. This was the second time we visited this theater and the second time the food wasn't the high-light. From now on when we go it's drinks and desert. Our thought is if we are going to spend $15 a meal not including drinks we really want to love the food.

I'll start by saying we've been going to the Esplanade for years, even before it was a Dine-In theater but we've experienced the Cinema Suites side 24 times now (by looking at my AMC Stubs) since it became Dine-In.  It was great when it first opened and I would even say up until this last year.  We moved to Florence a year ago and even still we drive out to Phoenix just to come to the Esplanade for a night out of dinner & a movie.  The movie quality is consistently good but I have got to say, if you are going there for the novelty of eating dinner while you watch a movie....just don't waste your money.  Or order popcorn or some candy, something that they cannot screw up.  This last visit on 8/11/15 might very well be our "last" visit to this theater.  The chairs were dirty and even had popcorn still sitting on the seat, not even brushed off.  The menus were sticky and/or slimy depending which page you were on, just absolutely filthy.  Our server did do a good job, so I have no complaints about him and the tip we left reflected his job but definitely not the food quality.  We ordered an appetizer and dinners x 3.  My friend ordered the tenderloin tips which he said were very much over cooked.  I ordered chicken tenders which honestly, how do you screw up chicken tenders?  Apparently if you want to find out, contact whoever works the fryer at AMC Esplanade.  The "tenders" were rock hard, overcooked chunks of chicken jerky.  I'm not expecting 5 star quality food, but when you spend $90 (including tip) for an appetizer, 3 dinners and 3 non-alcoholic drinks, you should get something a little higher quality than "I'm too drunk to taste this" greasy bar food.  The only positives and which is why I'm giving them two stars is for movie choices/quality, ability to pre-purchase seats (reserved seating) and our servers have been helpful.

This WAS our go to date night spot when we needed to squeeze in dinner and a movie in a few hours.  We drove from Gilbert, just to come here.  However, after this last visit, we will not be back.  We will most likely go back to Studio Movie Grill, even though they don't have reclining seats.    The menu changed the last time we came.  It was very short and not a lot of options.  I immediately thought maybe we accidentally got fork and dine menus, nope these are the new cinema suites menus!  The food was way overpriced.... $16 for mediocre fish and chips.  No thank you!  I ordered a $8 milkshake, it tasted like they left a pint of chocolate ice cream out to melt then poured it into a glass....awful!    The service this last time sucked!  Our food was taking forever, so we hit the button to figure out what the problem was and it took 10 minutes for someone to come.  Because of how late our food was, we didn't order popcorn....  The only nice thing about this theatre are the comfy reclining seats, but not worth the crappy food and service.  Save your money and go elsewhere!

I like the idea of being able to dine and have cocktails at the movies. The only problem I have is these AMC theaters aren't very clean. Seems they need an update. The carpet is dirty and worn. The experience is fun, but it's very pricy so I am expecting a current and clean space

My wife and I decided to go out for date night recently and thought we would give this a try. Here's my recommendation, if you want to do dinner and a movie, pick a good restaurant, eat your dinner and then go see a movie... preferably at a Harkin's Theater.  We hadn't seen a movie here since they turned it into a dinner theater so we thought we would give it a try. First of all, you can't even talk to a human ticket seller without paying to join the AMC VIP club. Luckily, they give you a discount the first time you do, so it didn't cost too much extra.  The theater itself was tiny, like the little shopping mall multiplexes from the 80's. In fact, I'm pretty sure that there are houses in the Biltmore or Paradise Valley with bigger home theaters and better screens. And yes, the seats were fairly comfortable but not all that great.  As for the food, we were not impressed at all. I had a hamburger and fries which were just boring and my wife had the chicken fingers which she said had little to no flavor, despite the menu description and endorsement of our server. Sure I was able to drink a beer, but that didn't make up for the poor food.  Well at least we got to see a movie right? True, but the sound quality was terrible. I noticed that they didn't play the Dolby intro at the beginning of the film and it's clear that the theater did not have surround sound. All of the sound appeared to be coming from speakers at the front of the room and nothing from the side or behind which was a big disappointment when you are trying to see a musical like La La Land.  Overall I was very disappointed in the experience and will not be returning and would not recommend anyone else waste their money at this location.

I love this place. The seating is the reason to go here.  My favorite auditorium is not the one with the reclining seats that practically lay down.  You can't see the full screen because of the wall between the rows.  The bottom of the screen is out of view.  I like the one without the half wall between the rows.  No obstructions.  Movie theater popcorn is not what is used to be.   But, theirs is ok, not fabulous, but ok.  Free refills though and so are the large drinks.  I guess that makes up for it.  Buy in advance, it's a breeze to get it, validate your parking and you're in like Flynn!  I wouldn't go anywhere else to see a movie since this is an option.

This is an OK place to watch a movie.  I like it because it's close by, usually has the films I want to see and it's relatively clean - although the other day I did step on gum in the theater.  Ugh.  Nice selection of corporate pre-date chow in the area, too.  Downsides are the film selection and parking layout.  The film selection could involve more creativity.  Why are they showing 3 screens of Pirates.  Is that really necessary?   I think AMC could show an indie film or two - I think the Biltmore / Central Phoenix types would really eat it up.     I find the parking set-up to be fine, really.  But for the first-timer used to parking in a flat parking lot and walking straight into the theater it might be a bit confusing - because it's all urban, mixed-used development parking garage and stuff.  The stairs leading out of the garage to the walkway of the theater is REALLY confusing.  I can never remember which alternating staircase I took or which floor I'm on - Gila Monster, or Cactus Wren?  Hmmmm.

We went here to watch "The Book Of Henry" ,and also wanted to get dinner along with our movie. We were very pleased to find that there was a small slide out tray big enough to put many dishes of food on. The service was very fast, and we got our food about 5 to 10 minutes into the movie. When the food arrived it was very warm and luckily not cold. Overall, the food was above and beyond to be something that was served in a dine in theater. I got the country style chicken and biscuits along with French fries and red slaw. The service was great, and things that we needed were quickly brought to us. For dessert I had the chocolate brownie milkshake. It was  rich and creamy, and the brownie was very delicious. The brownie could have been served by itself as a dessert and still would have impressed. Nicely pulled of meal overall. The only things negative I'd have to say about the food and the theater was that the seats did not recline whatsoever, and there was not enough sauce to go along with the meal. But, I still was impressed by the first experience of going to the AMC Dine In Theater!

My husband and I love going to see movies, so for my birthday he took me here because it was highly recommended. I had such an amazing time! It was so nice to go to a theater where anyone under 18 had to be accompanied by an adult. It cuts down on the obnoxious teenager factor. The service was amazing. I was skeptical at first because I thought that servers walking around was going to disturb the movie but it didn't. The food was great and we loved that you could order food in the lobby while you wait for your movie. I just have 3 complaints: the ticket prices are so expensive, but considering they have to pay wages to the servers, I get why they increase the tickets, but still, $20 is a bit much. They also don't have student discounts to lower those prices. My last complaint is that the movie selection isn't as high as some of the other theaters so it was difficult to find a movie that both my husband and I wanted to see. So 4 stars for me because of the down sides, so an overall good time for me.

I will inevitably return to this place since it is the closest theater to me, but now I know what to expect for next time. I got an aisle seat and ordered some grub. I picked some coconut tenders, thinking they would be an easy finger food during the movie. At $13 (and another extra $1 for my truffle fries), I was very surprised that the tenders were just like longer versions of chicken mcnuggets and I didn't bother eating them. The truffle fries were pretty good though my waiter didn't seem to care that what I thought of the tenders either. Also, they charge you the regular movie theater price for coke - around $5. I figured at $5, it would come in a big cup like regular movie theaters or whatever. Oh, no, it comes in a restaurant sized coke glass filled to the top with ice and very little soda. They sometimes give you refills. I say sometimes because around 40-50 minutes before the movie ended, my waiter asked me if I wanted a refill. I said sure. 20 minutes later when he brought the check, he said it was "coming soon", but I never got it. I don't mind returning to watch movies, but dinner is another story.

I am an AMC MovieWatcher... and I have the card to prove it!  I always catch the before-noon shows because they are only $5- even for new releases. The perfect treat for an early morning. The theatre is clean and there is usually a line but I skip right to the self-serve kiosks and get my tickets right away.  Also, sign up for the MovieWatchers' club. You can earn points and get discounts on snacks, free popcorn, candy and even movie tickets. I've cashed in on a couple free movie nights already.   The concession stand moves slow. I wish sometimes the kids at the counter would just move a bit faster to get our things,especially when there is a long line. However, they are really good about upselling.   The butter factory is clean and works! The jalapenos for the nachos are fresh and packed in its separate containers which makes it easy and I don't have to fish around a container of juice and soggy jalapenos for them.  The seats are comfortable and leave me with plenty of leg room, not that I need a lot of room but at least I know its there. It is a bit chilly so bring a light sweater.   I haven't tried any restaurants nearby because it seems like there isn't any marketing for any. Most people come here just for the movies.  Oh yeah and don't forget to validate because if you didn't, the gate guards will make you go back to get it.
Been here multiple times I love this place! Friendly staff, clean facilities and yummy food.

I will say the theatre is overall a success. Dine-in theatres seem to be trending nowadays instead of the uncomfortable rows of old, and even with several competitors now sitting in the Valley, the Esplanade hasn't changed much. Which may not be a good thing.  Tickets will be a little pricier due to the couch seating and the opt-in dining service. Unlike some of the recently renovated theatres, the seats don't recline, but there's plenty of cushion to make it work. The tables swing in from the side like a desk, and there's a call button behind you on one of your sides.  The food selection is actually good. I think it's better than Studio Movie Grill myself, just think of an Applebee's that doesn't suck. They can swipe your card when you order and you'll get a check near the end of the movie.  With dine-in theatres you have an expectation. Inevitably someone will drop their forks on the floor, and you'll have to deal with people constantly walking around to bring your orders. Then it starts getting a little mediocre. Service to me has been slower compared to other dine-in theatres. Last couple times I go here, sometimes it'll take up to 10 minutes for a call. Which I get when it's busy, but sometimes I don't see any movement at all.   Well at least there's validated parking. But even with a sick bar and a clean theatre, Esplanade feels complacent to me.

Love the concept of this theater but it definitely needs some fine tuning. The food was on par with Applebee's. (Maybe? Haven't eaten there in years) Our drinks were decent and my husband had free refills on his Arnold Palmer. The brownie sundae was ah.may.zing. Seriously shocked and would probably return just for that. The seats are fantastic. The real issue is the service. Everyone we encountered had the look and service skills of an awkward high schooler. It took forever for anyone to respond to your button in the theater and then another forever for whatever it was you ordered to arrive. Also how do they not have touch screen ordering? It's so distracting trying to talk to someone in the middle of a movie when there is plenty of affordable technology to make it a much smoother experience.

I went to watch the new Star Wars movie Wednesday night and was highly disappointed that AMC would allow 29 minutes of previews!!!! The movie didn't start until more than a half hour after the advertised start time. Totally unacceptable!! AMC is a big corporation and should not subject anyone to that much of a delayed start.   While it's hard to beat the big screen experience, it's no wonder why people just wait to watch movies at home!
Had a business meeting down in Biltmore and decided to come here with some co workers and wasnt all that i thought it would be, prices were too high and traffic was terrible

Very limited selection of movies and seats. To sit at the luxury side to watch a movie was $16.50 plus tax. For this price you basically get an assigned leather plush reclinable couch seat with tray and cup holders. You also have a server who takes your food and drink order. Just push the service button - like the button you push at your seat on a plane. The theatre was cold so the cloth napkin was of great use to cover my lap. Ordered a hot cup of cappuccino for $5 and their only one size popcorn $8.50 come in a large square bowl. It didn't taste as fresh.  Either my hearing is really great or the movie sounds was extra loud - I think might have gotten slightly deaf. Would I come back? Um not so sure. My couch and the comfort of my home would have been a sweeter deal for that moment.

The seats are great and the concept is great, but the service is unfortunate. I usually let things slide because I don't know how busy it may be, if they're short-staffed, or something else outside of the staff's control, but this has been a common experience. I saw Pitch Perfect 2 here a few months ago and they completely forgot to put in our food order so we got it when the movie was nearly done. I just saw Suicide Squad and they didn't put in my food again, brought me the wrong drink, said they would rectify it, never did and then charged me for the incorrect drink. Often it takes about 30-40 minutes to get a drink so you should order right when you get yours if you want another one during the film. The staff are friendly, but the responsiveness and delivery for orders is absolutely horrible!

Stopped at this place to watch IT and the experience was horrible from the moment we walked in. The young gal at the customer service desk clearly did not want to be there. After a very long wait to get service we ordered only to have our drinks come out 20 minutes later. Half of our food order finally made it out well into the movie. The call buttons are useless as no one bothered to stop by even though our call light was on during the entire film. The only other time our waiter came by was to drop off the check. I told him I hadn't received my order and his response was, "yes you did." I would never return to such a hyped place. Definitely NOT recommended.

I dont know what's worse... Not being greeted by the grungy boring staff at the bar or paying $8 for 5 quarter size boneless wings...its safe to say i will not be returning to this once great location, as everything has gone downhill since my last visit here.   This is the biltmore for God's sake, you have an image of being a high class establishment in a well to do area. Guess that doesnt matter anymore considering every staff member i saw needed to take a shower and brush their hair.  And when you work at the bar its good to engage with the customers and maybe smile a lil bit.   Also we bought tickets for a movie that surprised everyone as being 3D, when that was not indicated on the tickets we bought. I hate 3D movies because they make me sick and my eyes dont adjust well which makes a lot of the movie hard to watch and out of focus. Also if you want to recline in your seat you might want to rethink that, because you wont be able to see the bottom half the screen because each row is separated by walls that are much too tall. Good luck to anyone who wants a mediocre experience with overly high prices. Never to return!

Their 21+ "Cinema Suites" theaters with Lazy-boy style seats are the most wonderful way to see a movie.  Make sure you buy your tickets ahead of time as the seats are reserved.    On the other hand, I've been in their 18-and-up "Fork & Screen" style theater once ... and haven't bothered with it since.  If you want to bring your kids here, this is the theater style you'll have to go to, but personally I thought the seats were uncomfortable (the seats in any standard, non-fancy-pants theater are far better).  Trust me, if you're not in the Cinema Suites theater, just go to a regular theater instead.

This place is great! Make sure to reserve your seats before stopping in! As soon as you enter you'll see a nice bar. Servers are friendly. The seats are nice but don't recline. Wouldn't recommend the food here, stick with the popcorn or nachos!

I really want to love this place! I'm afraid I have gone for the last time.  I enjoy the comfortable seats but service will be keeping me away.   I have had cold popcorn delivered to me, and red wine when I ordered white. One time I ordered a bottle of wine and received an open bottle with wine missing. Bartenders are overwhelmed easily and the bar is often filthy when any guests are present. The quality of food isn't worthy of the experience.   I don't expect much from this place anymore which is sad. They have so much potential if they would take their service seriously.

The AMC Esplanade is an enjoyable experience when watching a movie. This is the only theater I will go to, specifically, because you can pick your own seat, ordering tickets online and even food. The staff are quick with orders and always helpful. Further, I saw complaints about the elevator and escalator; however, I don't believe that is AMC's fault for them being down. With the competition between movie theaters, I doubt AMC wants those facilities to be down.  Love AMC Theaters and this place especially!

Great way to see a movie.   Pros: Comfortable, assigned seating (buy online in advance) ensures you don't have to rush or wait in line.   Lobby bar is a great place to meet for a drink or three before the movie.  Cons: Cocktails seem a bit watered-down on multiple visits. Count on spending at least $50/person if you're talking dinner/movie/drink.

Was served two flat beers, the pizza for my two year old came out cold, along with cold stiff fries.  The salads were fine, the shrimp I served was good.  The service they do have down, the wait staff was gracious and did the best they could.  The back kitchen needs SERIOUS work... SERIOUS work.  I will wait for a long time before I go back again.

This AMC has gone way down hill for the area it exists in. Have gone there twice in last two month. Once the will call buttons didn't work so it was impossible to get service. The second time their ovens weren't working so majority of menu wasn't available.  Save your time and go somewhere else.

Went here with my wife and another couple to watch Star Wars on New Years Eve. We were going to eat dinner here and have some drinks, but after the iffy Yelp reviews, we went to a real restaurant instead. Glad we did - because after we took our seats, I ordered popcorn well before the start of the movie. It took 20 minutes to arrive; and it was cold, and way over-salted. I paid the tab at the end of the movie - over $8.00 for the bucket, and handed the waitress a $20 bill. Rather than making change on the spot, we all had to wait at least 10 minutes for her to come back. Altogether, the waitresses walking around the place during the movie was distracting; the seats, as others have commented, were not very comfortable; and if they can't get popcorn right, I can't see trusting them with anything more complex- like a burger. We won't be returning.
This was our first time. The food was good but the service was horrible. Our server was Imran. He made it a horrible experience. We probably won't go back.
Average. I am spoiled by seats that adjust to the point where I'm almost in bed. :).  Food was average. Couldn't see it so that was scary yet it may have helped.

I love this theatre because it is for adults only. This makes a simple date night into more of pleasant experience because their are NO babies, young kids, crying or screaming!  Man....and they sell angry orchard!  Gluten free alcohol sipping boy I was.   I will say if you can avoid the spoon and fork theatre.  The better one is the other theatre because the chairs are bigger and they recline without touching the person behind or in front of you.    Happy viewing!!!

I used to love coming to this theatre. Now they changed their dinner menu to something you could find at a dive bar. Way overpriced for mediocre at best food. Absolutely terrible. Changed review to a 1 star after sitting thru an entire moving with what sounded like a vaccum going off every 2 mins during the whole 2hr movie. Asked the waiter the theatre is claiming "wind" what a joke. We were in theatre 7 right near the kitchen. Don't plan on heading back to this location.
This was the best theater I have been to in the Valley that serves food & drinks in the movie. Great lobby, statium seating, clean and friendly service. I'll be back!

Great place! I've been going here for years I take my fianc, and when all my other family visits I take them here. I recently moved away from the area but I enjoy going here so much I do not mind the extra distance. The food and drinks are really good as well. If there was one improvement that I may recommend it would be faster service. Sometimes it drags out a bit--again just a recommendation not a complaint. Love it overall and I remain loyal!

Tried this theater because it offered food.   First one of the escalators is broken but you can take the elevator. By the way, not that it's the theater's fault but the drivers in the parking g structure are very reckless so be cautious.   Anyway, the theater is what you'd expect for AMC. The theaters are small with nice sized seats. These do not recline all the way, no foot rests and don't have heaters. The backs will recline slightly and the seats are cushy but they aren't comfortable for someone as small as I am. We noticed some seats worn and torn. The table is ample sized with back-stops to prevent things from sliding off.   As for the food, it's good. Not spectacular just good. Had the jalapeo burger, it was tasty. It didn't have any heat to it but it was satisfying. The burger and fries were fresh and hot. My husband had an appetizer platter and he enjoyed his food.   Now it was the service that really disappoints. We were among the first to order, having arrived about 15 minutes early. It took them about 10 minutes to even respond.   One in our party got their food and drink within 15 minutes. The remaining three of us didn't get our food until 45 minutes into the movie. I didn't get my cocktail until shortly after. We complained to the manager and he told us our order only took 16 minutes.  Rather than argue in the middle of the movie, we just went with it. The food runners seemed extremely confused. Throughout the first hour you can see him asking around whose order was whose. Distracting.   We won't return to this AMC because it's out of our way and the food and service wouldn't make the trip worth it. Well, if it was only 10 minutes away I'm still not sure we'd go back because of the poor service.

I love this theater.  First, let me just say, the 21+ theater - BRILLIANT.  I love that I can go to the movies, sit in a recliner, order booze and food delivered directly to me, AND I don't have to deal with screaming children????  (Don't worry - those of you with children they separate the theater into two sides, one for all ages and one for 21+.)  The food is good, not great, but definitely good.  If the food quality was just a bit better I would have rated this place 5 stars.  The set up is fantastic, I can actually see the screen from any seat no matter who sits in front of me and my husband (who is 6'1") no longer has to slouch in his seat out of fear he is blocking the person behind him.  My suggestion, buy the $12 stubs rewards card.  It's worth it.  You avoid the internet ticket purchasing fees, plus earn rewards towards free credits.

Awesome experience overall.  The seats are as comfy as can be.  The food is very good bit a bit pricy.   But that's why I don't go every weekend.  The employees are very friendly but occasionally they forget to bring something when you ask for it.  The service is still fast though.

I have been here before and love the concept. I went out with my mom on Saturday and told her how great this theater was.  Boy did I look like a schmo. We usually go to Arrowhead. Should have stuck with that location. The online ticket portal specifically said "reclining seats." Imagine my surprise when I got basically a coach airplane seat. The seat "rocked" back and forth but in no way did it recline. I inquired with our server about this and it was obvious that I was not the only one who was victim to AMC's bait and switch. He said only the first 5 theaters have recliners and ther is NO WAY to know what theater you are booking online. Um hello....am I no longer in 2017? What am I supposed to do, go down there 4 days in advance an inquire. Absolutely unacceptable.  On a happy note, our server was great, food was ok and my mom and I had a good time. But I am just not ok with this flat out false advertising by AMC.
Bought two seats and the one my husband sat in made a squeaky sound every time he moved! He had to sit still throughout movie. Not worth a second visit from me.

Honestly, this AMC was a pretty big let down. It's not at all clear from the area how to even find the movie theater; from our spot in the parking garage, we probably wandered around the Esplanade for 10 minutes before we found stairs leading to the theater. Upon walking inside, there is no immediately clear direction as to what you're supposed to do; we bought our tickets online, so we assumed that we had to check in or get printed tickets somewhere. Nope, apparently not. The only counter in the front lobby is for something called premiere guests. We actually didn't ever have our tickets checked once... So, good thing we're not terrible people and didn't lie about where we were supposed to be, I guess?   We were killing some time before our movie started, so we headed to the bar to check out our food and drink options before we went to sit down in our auditorium. We were there for a while before a bartender addressed us, and when we asked to see a food menu along with the drinks, he seemed a little taken aback and had to call on another employee for help. The other employee scampered off and returned a few minutes later with a food menu. Not a big deal, but a little confusing as to why they don't have those on hand.   We went to our auditorium, and pushed the call button upon making our food/drink decisions. Now granted, we were sitting in the back row. But, it was probably a full 40 minutes between the time we pushed the call button and when an employee actually arrived to take our order. It seemed that there was only one server working our entire auditorium, so she started with the front row and wound her way back to us. We felt really bad for her, as she was clearly flustered and overwhelmed. When we asked about their gluten free options, she said she'd return with a list of which menu items were gluten free--no dice, she said it "wasn't where it's normally kept" so we kind of just had to gamble on it. Our food came out probably half an hour later, which was more or less expected, but we didn't get water until probably a full hour into the actual movie itself (which, for the record, started about 40 minutes after the posted time).   The whole shebang just seemed super unorganized, and was an unnecessarily stressful movie-going experience. Our checks weren't brought out until the movie had fully ended, and the party next to us actually just walked out without paying; I can't speak to whether or not they meant to, or just genuinely forgot that they hadn't yet paid, but it was kind of a bummer for the already-stressed server who was clearly overworked and definitely should've had some help.   The one upside? Super comfy recliners. Unfortunately, we weren't able to make full use of them, as there is a little wall between your seat and the row in front of you. Even sitting up fully, I probably couldn't see the bottom two feet of the screen. When I was fully reclined, I was missing about the bottom 50% of the movie. Cool.  Definitely will be sticking with Roadhouse in the future.

I don't know if it was senior day here but they were everywhere on Sunday. They were in the way and very mean. If they do have senior day here I highly recommend not coming on that day.   Having just gone to the movies 3 days prior and having such a wonderful experience at the other theater, this theater did not meet those expectations.   I liked how big and clean it is in here and the air conditioning was at just the right setting.   The concession stand line was confusing. With elderly wondering around it made it even more confusing.   I got Popcorn, A Coke Zero (YAY!!!) and a Soft Pretzel with no salt.   You had to put your own butter on your popcorn. How am I supposed to get the layered effect if I'm handed a full bag of popcorn? This is a luxury that I will never take for granted again.   Also the butter had a bad aftertaste that I didn't like.   There is also nothing to put the mustard in for your pretzel. I had to wade back through Bermuda shorts, beige socks pulled up the calf, canes and blue hairs to the concession stand to get a small cup to put mustard in for dipping.   I will say the pretzel was pretty darn good and chewy and moist.   The seats were uncomfortable. They did have those lifting arms which is nice to spread out.   Its OK, not to busy except for the schoals of old people wondering around. Its just OK in my book

I would usually give this place 4-5 stars. My fianc and I see a movie here about once a week. Today we saw the Purge Anarchy. We didn't receive water until 30 minutes into the movie! THEN we had the service light on for another 20 minutes to get our water refilled and get silverware before the waitress ever came over. THEN, when the waitress came to give us silverware (all that was left at our seats were the dirty fork and napkins from the people who sat there before us) she kept forgetting my water! I even reminded her AGAIN when the check came. I never once received a refill on water in AZ when it was 111 degrees outside!! The waitress was named Jocelyne. We left a $1 tip for a $26 meal...I thought I was being too nice.

The over-sized, electronic reclining seats are worth the price of admission alone. No kids is a big plus. The food hits the spot and the serving sizes are good, no skimping. Makes for a nice date night. The seats are a little far apart so you'll have to make due with making out in the parking lot.

I don't understand why the bar/snack register does not have the candy readily available or on display. The bartender had to leave her station to walk halfway across the theater to get our order making us late for the movie. Then it was quite warm inside the theater, enough to make me uncomfortable throughout the movie.

We would never go back.  $17.50 per ticket with these big comfortable seats, and a pony wall in front of you that blocks about 2 feet of the lower screen.  Thanks but no thanks.  We used to come there often but when they made the change to the intimate theaters, we are passing!

This is the only place I go to watch movies now.... They have a full bar, the food menu is extensive for a movie theater. Drinks are pretty good and you even get a glow stick in some of the specialty cocktails. Servers have always been helpful without being pushy. Appetizer sampler is a good starter... Don't forget you can also get candy and popcorn like a regular movie concession. BTW the order of regular popcorn is HUGE-GANTIC!!! Parmesan Fries are also good and the portion is huge! Don't forget the full bar!! You can meet up before the movies and get a little toasted! Hahaha  Try to get a theater that has the touch button recliners. They are so comfortable... It makes it feel like you're watching a movie in bed. Don't forget to validate your parking.

According to Yelp, I've checked in here 27 times.  Yesterday just might be my last.  As I've stated in previous reviews, we pretty much only come to Esplanade which is about a 40 minute drive from my house.    Despite a few bad experiences, we've patronized the Esplanade theater since it opened.  We used to love to go there for dinner and drinks while enjoying a movie.  The food went downhill so we started skipping meals there and eating elsewhere before or after.  The drinks were never terribly good (way too sweet and stingy pours) so we started going elsewhere for that too.  (Beer and cider are safe but the cider never changes.)    Yesterday, we arrived at our Cinema Suites theater to find our seats and seating area filthy.  There was popcorn in the cupholders.  The table area between the sets of two was full of crumbs.  The floor appeared to be dirty as well - I kept my purse in my lap during the movie.  I was tempted to contact a manager right then but the movie was starting and I didn't want to miss it.    I also requested water and never got it.   Additionally, two of our three purchased seats had tears and were taped over.  The theater is showing obvious signs of wear and tear which really detracts from the "luxury experience" of having recliners and no children.    I did speak with a manager after the show and he seemed very disinterested.  I explained that I was a long time customer and explained the issues.  He clarified which theater it was and said he would have someone take a look at it.  No apology.  No contriteness.  Nothing.   Needless to say, I'm extremely disappointed in our experience and even more so at the lack of interest from the manager.  Everybody can have a bad day and maybe someone missed cleaning that theater... that's where the manager comes in.  An apology and a remote interest in keeping a customer would have gone a long way.

My husband and I  went there on Friday the 12th. We were both disappointed with our movie going experience. First, the popcorn tasted like it had been sitting out for days, it wasn't fresh, and it was tasted burnt. We figured that if they could not do popcorn right, why would we order any food? We will not be going back.

Our favorite place to come watch a movie. The only place we come to, but since the menu change we have started to eat before the movie. Which cuts down a lot of revenue for the theater. We used to leave with at least a $70-$100. The traditional wings here used to be amazing, now it feels as if it's chicken nuggets. There's no more dynamite chicken. The Loaded Tots are good and the Brussel sprouts but the Mac and cheese are all good but over reaching. I had the Grill Chicken quinoa and I didn't enjoy it, it came out cold.   So the place is good but it used to be great and it felt like it got boring. Lacked inspiration. The boneless chicken wings and the southern chicken tenders are the same. Drinks are still good, but since I eat now before I come it's not fun to order a drink. I'm looking forward to a revamp again. This place could be amazing. I used to talk about how great the chefs choices and how the cooks were, now it's blah.

I love the concept and the seating is amazing but the operations side needs help.  I arrived 30 minutes before show time when I was supposed to be seated. I had to stand outside the theater for an additional 20 minutes while they supposedly cleaned. Only one or two people went in or out of the theater and then we were able to enter.  We didn't have time to order our meal and get settled before the previews started.

This AMC is located in the Biltmore area near the Ritz-Carlton and has a parking garage behind it which did not have a fee. The area in which this AMC is in has a lot of shops and the corridors are architecturally detailed.   The service was great from entrance to exit especially the waiters during the movie. They came in about twice during the movie even though we didn't ring (press a button for service). The menu is pretty large. Most of the food is of the "American" variety. The desserts were tempting but overall it was a bit pricey for the type of food offered and serving portions.   The best part of this theater has to be the giant cherry red recliners. The most comfortable movie theater seats I have ever enjoyed a movie in.   The screen and movie display was relatively the same as any AMC, nothing special there.  Oh and this theater has a full bar instead of a candy case in the lobby. That has to be an incentive for some people. Candy and popcorn can be found on the menu received when seated for your movie, don't worry.

It's run down, the service wasn't great. Parking was confusing. Waited a really long time for our food. No refills offered on our drinks. My seat was broken and clicking everytime i moved. Gave it two stars because I enjoyed the movie itself.
My first time here and definitely going back! You can drink adult beverages and eat while watching a movie!! Food is actually good and reasonably priced.

First time and will not go back....   maybe I will. Seats are bigger and spacious but not comfortable. I felt like I was going to slide off. My husband purchesed middle seats which is normally eye level to the screen not here you will be looking down to the screen. Which is not bad but your seat is shaped to your back and your head sits on the chair facing upward. It smelled like onions right from the start.  I did not have dinner just soda, popcorn and candy way over priced. My husband loved the fact that he could drink his beer and enjoy the movie. He and my son ordered the special nachos. They were not good but looked delicious. Well what can I say, I sleep like baby but they did not have a good night.

If you are looking for a premier movie-watching experience, this place is for you. Plush leather chairs that fully recline AND drink/meal service throughout the screening? Dayummm. Can't go wrong. We even ordered off the menu items and were fully accommodated.

One of the best places I have ever watched movies at. Not only can I go to the matinees I can share it with friends a wonderful time of lunch and a good movie and a totally comfortable environment. Services are phenomenal you were treated with total respect and as if you were the only person in the entire theater while you're watching your movie. I travel almost 40 miles one way just to go to this specific Theater. Have never had a bad experience and take all my out-of-town guests today's special place.

It would be cool if the waiters menu tablets signalized with the call buttons, creates a bit of lag waiting for them if they're not around or see your light right away. Otherwise convenient, comfortable and decent menu. Mac and cheese, chicken tenders, etc., and bottomless popcorn!

This is a good theatre. Tickets are $5.00 in the morning, the seats are comfortable and the service is friendly. Plus, how many places can you pay $5.00 to see a show and then share a bottle of prosecco? Plus, the prosecco was a decent bottle.   If you are going here to eat really amazing good, you may be disappointed. This eat-in theatre is good for the classic popcorn, candy, nachos and does have a couple of decent appetizers such as the pretzel bites, I recommend shying away from the sushi and seafood choices.

Here's a huge upside of the AMC dine in theater, you get to reserve and pick your own seats. Wait staff take your order for various movie treats along with a Full dining and drink menu including alcoholic beverages. The theater is nice and clean and I like that the theater seems to be making an effort to go green by using reusable dishes and flatware versus disposable.
