There is also covered parking which is really nice especially in the heat of the summer. Remember to get your parking ticket validated. The one down the side is that it is very expensive if you decide to order food and drinks.

Regular movie theaters have been ruined for me. Esplanade is fantastic and while it's a bit of a drive for us, it is a a theater  I will gladly put miles on my car for. Between the two types of theaters, I would recommend the Cinema Suites. These theaters are smaller (less people to annoy you,) no kids allowed,  the cushy seats recline, no one can kick your chair (you're in your own partitioned row,) and best of all you have your very own server in your very own reserved seat.  It's in a great part of Phoenix, the Biltmore area has plenty of options should you choose to have dinner outside of the the theater. Make sure if you park in the garage you have the front desk validate your ticket. Also, reserve tickets online before you head out the door. The theaters are small and sell out very quickly. Looking forward to seeing The Dark Knight Rises midnight premier this week and NOT have to wait in line! God bless reserved seating.

Definitely not your average theater and it doesn't have to be expensive if you can figure out when the cheap shows are.  Too bad the website is confusing and it's hard to figure out. I ended up just hovering over the times and saw different prices ranging from $6.75 - $17. Guess it doesn't matter if you've got the cash flow but I'm a student and would save this place for a special night out.  Harkins student tix are always $7. Free 4 hour parking with validation.  The theater is very clean and there are large screens, even in the small auditoriums.  The seats are pretty comfortable but are arranged in sets of two. Every 3rd person will feel a bit away from your group because the extra armrest/service-tray thing.  It's a good concept to have food but I found the smell of others eating to be annoying when I wasn't hungry.  The light next to each seat bothered me a lot and I used a menu to cover it up.  Servers coming in and out of the room during the movie was also disruptive for me, especially when they made wrong deliveries and had to find out who ordered what. And there were definitely kids running around the lobby. Kids aren't not allowed; they just need to be with an adult.    If you wan't dinner and a movie, go out somewhere where you can actually see your date and have a conversation. I'll probably be back for the cheapest shows because I like clean theaters... but I don't think it's worth paying extra for.

Dine in theater which is a plus for those wanting to have dinner and a movie. Cheap pricing considering we got to reserve our seats. Comfortable seats, only complaint is they were at a weird angle, but you get used to it. Parking was a little bit of a mission -- lots of garages around, but it was hard to figure out which one the movie theater was for. Once we found it, we had to climb three flights of stairs to get to the front of the theater. On the plus, parking is validated for up to 4 hours!

Sat in the second row from the top, and from there we couldn't see the bottom third of the screen while reclining, and couldn't see the bottom quarter while sitting upright due to the wall that divides the rows (I'm 6' 0")  Wait service was good and discreet while the movie was playing.  Prices are comparable to a Diamondbacks or Suns game as far as food and drink.  Theater was clean; the restroom could have used some work.

As I mentioned in my check in... 3 hours still no nachos. Got to the theatre, checked out the menu and the best option for us was to get a couple of snacks, turns out it was the biggest mistake in AMC history. The wings were good but they were the only food we got that we ordered. Ordered the loaded nachos but they probably couldn't carry them out of the kitchen because I never got them. #thatswhatyoucallloaded. Went to customer service to ask about my nachos and they said they were going to send out a manager, three hours later I'm still sitting here waiting for said manager. How much longer should I wait?  In all honesty, horrible customer service, you should spend your money on Harkins
Parking is horrible  . The place is very busy. . But it is an experience  to be there. The sound system  is great and seats very comfortable.  Just a challenge

Worst food ever. I mean I wasn't expecting like high quality but come on. The mac and cheese I ordered was dry and cold. No cheese whatever. The bacon that was suppose to come in it but just pieces of bacon stuck together by grease.

My wife and I heard about this new cinemasuites thing at a christmas party. So we decided to go check it out. It was totally worth the drive to get there. All guests at the cinemasuites have to be over 21yrs old. The seats are all leather lazy boys with electronic recliners. You have a button to push for service, and there are drink menus and food. Its like being first class on an airplane only better! Movies before Noon are 9$ and movies after noon are 12$. Not too bad for such an experience!!

I am a major movie fan! I have been to this theater a number of times.  Last night 5 servers standing at the front of the theater bitching about their schedules.  At the end of the movie I'm told to hurry and leave and be sure to tell my friends no after credits so they can clean sooner.  This morning first in and my server didn't show up for almost 25 minutes 10 couples served before I get my food.  Fries cold and burger not prepared correctly.   Spoke with mgmt and I hear the service person complaining about her sciatic nerve.

I'm not a huge movie theater person, preferring to spend my free time outside. However, when a friend suggested we have a girls' night and take in a movie at the Dine-in theater, I thought, "why not?" The AMC Dine-in theatre is a pretty luxurious experience; from the seat-side service and multiple food and drink options to the huge, cushy seats, all was an enjoyable experience. Prices are on the high side (theatre prices!). I got one veggie sushi roll ($10 for 8 pieces, 670 calories -- one of the items lowest in calories!) and a glass of white wine (I think it was about $10) while my friend ordered the classic burger and fries ($12, 1330 calories for the burger; 850 calories for the fries) and a glass of red wine. You order your food and drink whilst lounging in your chair...then staff come by and deliver your order. A person can get used to that!  A couple of things: 1) Don't go to the dine-in theatre if you are counting calories and trying to save money. You can easily spend $40 per person from the movie ticket, food, and drink. 2) That said, if you want to try and make healthy dining choices, at least you have calorie info!  This won't be a regular place to visit, but if I want to splurge and indulge, I know where to go!

Now this must be how movie heaven feels like. As a pauper =( having the opportunity to enjoy the experience a couple times a year does it for me. It's first class seats and service for a mere $15 for a movie ticket, then add on drinks and an appetizer, and you end up spending close to $40. Not bad, especially if it's a real big blockbuster movie, then it makes it more worth it. check it out, it's awesome.

This place was amazing.  I was in town for business trip and had a free afternoon. Decided to take the bus down to the AMC. My only complaint, ONLY. No sign to advertise this theater from the ground floor. Me, like an idiot walked around the entire building not knowing the theater was on the third floor of the building. For a non-local it was hard to find.  Once I got upstairs, I found they dont have box offices. Just kiosks to buy tickets. Very self explanatory. Easy. Once I purchased my ticket, an really nice guy directed me to my theater. Made chit chat about where I was from. Great service. In the lobby is a gigantic bar. Filled with booze and beer. I'm from Vegas, I like this bar! It felt like home :)  I asked the guy where I can get popcorn and a drink. He said you just go in the theater and a waiter will serve you drinks and popcorn. What! 'Thats $&^%^ Awesome!' He replied that it is very awesome.  The theater is huge. Very big. it was 4 in the afternoon so nobody was in the theater besides two other people. I ordered wings and a coke zero. Fast service, even got a free refill. Movie sound was great, huge screen. Little chilly in the theater, which is the way it should be :) I'll be back ! Suggesting it to all my traveling friends. Customer for Life !

I have now been here twice and I have no real desire to go back. I give it two stars instead of just one because the beer I ordered was very cold, which I enjoyed. Otherwise this theater wasn't too pleasant. My friend and I went to see Rogue One recently, and like others have complained it took forever to get our food. And speaking of food, we probably heard about 7 or 8 pieces of silverware hit the ground during the movie. Lol. The seat I was sitting in had duct tape on the arm rest. I had seen the same red duct tape on another armrest in a recliner theater here during a previous visit. The seats behind us were too close and the children sitting behind us kept kicking the seat (I thought this theater didn't let anyone under 18 in. Has that changed?)   The servers are super nice and are trying their best! Don't give them a hard time, these issues should reflect poorly on management and not the staff.   If you're looking for a better luxury movie going experience I suggest trying out Harkins at Scottsdale Fashion Square.

I've been to this theater several times. It is a bit pricey compared to most. I invited a friend to this facility. And OMG! he is still complaining about the admission. That was my fault. I should have given him a heads up.   I like the place. You can choose your seating when you purchase your ticket(s). The seating is VERY comfortable...oversized, recycling seats! Don't sit on the very back row...you won't get the full effects of the these seats.  Staff come around before the start of the show to take your food and beverage order. However, you can purchased a beverage and/or eat prior to entering the theater. The staff has always been pleasant and knowledgeable of the menu items as well as the what's currently playing.  There is plenty of garage parking. Staff will validate your ticket.

The only way to watch a movie, this is the best movie theater in Phoenix, little costly but worth it for watching a movie while seating in a reclining lazy-boy and a full bar and the food is pretty good..

Since the menu change....yes a few vegetarian options...but the kids menu options are crap and half the size and quality they used to be.  My sons chicken strips were cold and stale...wow what a disappointment.  The prices are insane for shitty food as well.  We will not be eating here ever again!  The Biltmore mall restaurants are a short stroll away....and well worth the price over this place.  If the theater is losing money, jacking up the prices on horrible food isn't gonna buy them much time.

MoviePass works at AMC in Biltmore!!!!!!   Wow, this is another game changer for MoviePass and the film industry.  I like AMC but it could get a little pricy with everything so I feel much better going since my ticket is "free".  The ticket process was smooth and no issues to boot.

Kinda hard to find for people new to Phoenix. Escalators were not working and no signs directing you to the elevators or stairs. Nice area for grown ups who want to drink and get nice VIP treatment. Reclining chairs laid all the way down, they were so comfy I could almost fall sleep in them if it wasn't for the movie lol. Service was fast and friendly.  Although we were bummed they didn't offer regular nachos with cheese. Everything was served on a nice silver player..fancy! Very pricey but worth the theater experience. No complaints! We will be back soon!

AMC refused to serve my 84-year-old grandmother a drink on her birthday because she left her ID in the car. Not kidding.  The manager of this theatre is on a pathetic, little power trip. He went above and beyond to be condescending during the whole ordeal, making sure that we knew if anyone else bought my elderly grandmother a vodka it would be confiscated. He said this even after we said we'd go to the car to get her ID. He wouldn't even allow the drink to get started while the ID was being retrieved from the parking garage. I mean, jesus christ. I wanted to freak out on this guy, but decided against it. His life, as a movie theatre manager, is thankless enough.   P.S. Congrats on being condescending towards an old lady whose only pleasure in life at the moment is vodka. Did I mention her husband recently passed away? Way to ruin the only movie she's been to in over a decade, jerk.  P.S.S. As it turned out, this also ended up being the last movie she ever went to and the last birthday she ever celebrated ... so good job manager-douche. The next time an 80-something year old person wants an adult beverage, just give it to them.

I've lived in the neighborhood for while, but never tried out AMC Esplanade until a few weeks ago.  We'd always go to Harkins or Studio Movie Grill out of habit.  And while I really like the quality of the theater and the location, the food leaves much to be desired.  First off, I love being able to pick my seats online ahead of time.  We use the AMC app to book our tickets, which also allows us to get points through their AMC Stubs rewards program.  The seats themselves are great - plush leather reclining seats.  Super comfy for watching a movie.  And the theaters only hold maybe 40 people max, so it feels much more like a private theater.  The food is really the only thing I don't like.  We've tried the appetizer sampler, the burger, and the chicken tenders.  All were really greasy and poor quality for what you pay for.  I'd almost prefer regular movie theater conessions to this.  I did try the quinoa bowl which is the only item on the menu I've enjoyed there.  Great for a matinee, but if you want a full service movie theater I'd recommend studio movie grill or iPic.

Firstly I want to say that service here was just phenomenal! Alexander served us tonight while we watched captain America and we had a good time. Do expect a large amount of white noise from all the other patrons eating. The servers walk around and deliver food and it all provides for a rather distracting experience. I'm not sure I would go for a movie that I really want to enjoy, but if you're here to drink beer and watch The Expendables, than you are in the right place!  Cheers!

I absolutely love coming here to watch movies. Being able to pick my seat ahead of time and have a cocktail while watching a movie is awesome! The icing on the cake is the 21 and up cinema suites.  The food isn't bad but I normally eat elsewhere before heading here. If you're drinking, go for beer or cocktails, the wine is typically warm and a little overpriced. The beer gets you the most bang for your buck especially if you get a pitcher.

Came to Amc to see Sully and the projector doesn't work for a straight 15 minutes! They came in and told us that it was fixed but it has still been 5 minutes since playing AND skipped previews because of a majority vote... Wtffffff. Movie was supposed to start at 1045 and didn't start until well after 11pm. We asked for popcorn after we got our drinks but it never came until we pressed our res assist button. Movie was good, seats didn't recline all the way. Won't be coming back

my boyfriend and i went out for a date night and decided to try something new with the dine in theatre. we saw "daddy's home" which was hilarious and a great choice for the first time dine in experience. we ordered the chicken quesadilla and the the buffalo hot wing plate. the food was quite good for a theatre and the service was amazing. the waiters were quiet and tried their best not to disrupt the show which was really nice. we ended the movie with a delicious chocolate milkshake which was woah to die for! over all our experience was great! the movie was funny, the food was tasty, and the service was top notch. not an all the time date night because it is pricey, however it is a once in awhile experience we would do again in a heartbeat.

This is the closest theater to my house - and I am digging matinee pricing. I work second shift, so the lunchtime showing of movie plus lunch at the same time makes weekday movies a possibility for me.  Is the food fantastic?  Not really.  But it's predictable and tasty - the servers I have dealt with are all friendly and well trained not to impede with the movie.  Glad it's here - and as long as the quality and cleanliness keeps up, I'll be a regular!

I had a great experience. Not all theaters here have reclining seats, so I made sure to pick the showing that does have them. I had two pair martinis. They were delicious. Service was great. I ordered the shrimp flat bread and the Parmesan fry's. It was great for movie theater food. The parking is always free. Just get your ticket validated inside AMC. There is an escalator past the elevator if you actually look.
Make sure you double check your bill. Two people in our party had incorrect bills. Great concept but a redbox and a Papa Murphy's pizza is about $80 cheaper.

Okay, it's gone downhill a little bit...  First issue is the menu changed, and the food selection and quality have definitely gone down, while the prices went up.  Beyond this, is the fact that on opening week for a blockbuster movie, they only have 1 or two cinema suites showings a week... Frankly, the Fork and Screen showings aren't worth it.  This has now happened for Star Wars and for Deadpool.  Not to mention that back in August (Phoenix is freakishly hot), was stuck in the elevator for nearly an hour (about 140 degrees in there).  The service the past few times I've went was pretty bad.  AMC really needs to pull their heads out of their asses and actually have more cinema suites showings of top selling movies... They are consistently sold out, except for the handicap spaces that don't actually have seats, and no indication on the website as such.  Beyond this, every time you have to go back on their website to pick another time, it takes forever for the current day to load before you can change days, then it takes a long time again... it's like the programmers at AMC never heard of data caching.
Always use to get a wonderful shake with the movie it was expensive but worth it. Now they are horrible, filled with ice. Way too much money for a ice filled shake. Shame on you!
The new design and layout of the theater is great, but what makes this my new favorite place to catch a movie would have to be the seat side service and the pretty good bar food selection they have.
HOLY CRAP I LOVE THIS PLACE.  the chairs are awesome and the servers are great.

I love this place!!! Hate waiting in line for a movie hate having to look for a good seat because they are always taken... But this place.. I love how it os just s few seats so you don't have to worry about other being too loud or having to worry about where to sit. Just buy your tickets online and you get to pick where you sit and the best part bout it is that they are reserved! I love going to the 21 and over, their seats are so comfy and so huge you can literally lay on the couch! It's like being at home and having s waiter! YES!!!

went there last night with my parents and boyfriend to see Jurassic World.  Movie was awesome!!! :)  Theater was nice and clean...but we had to pre buy our tickets a couple days before, and the only four seats we could get together were in the last row.  Last row was fine, not too far away seeing how there is only like 6 rows total, but DO NOT sit up there if you're under 6 feet tall.  You can not see the bottom of the screen because of the wall in front of you, therefore you cannot use your big comfy recliner at all!!!  :( so i was pretty much sitting on my legs to use as a booster seat so i could see the whole screen.  Note to self, i will never sit in the last row again.  As for the food, it was good...service was a little slow.  i had my button pressed for a good 15 mins, server never came, so i had my bf press his also, and finally ten mins later the server came.  so movie and food and theater was good.....seats were horrible and service was not so good.

Great movie! Awful service. I order one mixed drink from their menu at the beginning of the movie and 1.5 hours later after asking for the drink twice still nothing. I went down to the bar to get my own drink and my order was just sitting by the bar! The novel was great but I would not recommend visiting this theater ever.

We basically only go to this theater because it is the closest around and we can reserve seats. It's overpriced because it is a "dine-in" theater, but the food is pretty bad. There is nothing light on the menu. Also they have enough early showings, they really should add some brunch items. The thing that bugs me the most is that they only have one size for popcorn: massive. Would it kill them to add a medium?  Also most of their theaters do not have reclining seats and the tables are not set up well if you want to share food with your date.

this is by far my favorite theater.  Just to give you an idea, i have two theaters near me (one run by teenagers and the other by people who use the theater as a baby sitter).   So i have no problems driving way out of may way to experience a movie without those distractions.  21+ screenings is the best service idea that has come to the theater industry.  The reclining chairs also are an added plus  the downfall to the theater is the service.  While most of my experiences have been great sometimes they are slow to take your order, other times the food takes forever and the worst is they forget something like your beverage.  I understand that depending on when I placed my order the kitchen could be slammed so i try not to hold that against them.  Despite the sometimes slow service the staff has always been friendly.  Food quality - well for the price you would expect better but i guess you are paying for convenience.  It's not that the food is bad, it just needs a tweek to give it a boost in flavor.  I just wish they had more 21+ showings throughout the week.

I had the chance to visit this theater last week as well as yesterday for free screenings of the new "dine and movie" concept. I watched 4 movies- 2 of which were cinema suites (way better) and 2 Fork and screen. Cinema suites is pretty killer. No IPIC but hey you get what you pay for. The seats reclined all the way back they are big leather comfy seats. The menu was very chain-like. I ordered Thai coconut chix tenders that came with fries and a cpl of chili-asian like dipping sauces. Thank God it was free b/c $10 bux is kinda steep. The best meals I ordered were the smoked salmon BLT and Chicken tenders. Pass on the pizza (blech). The Fork and Screen rooms are not comparable at all to the cinema suites. They had hard leather chairs that basically swiveled a little. Go for the Cinema Suites it was roomier and really comfy. Plus you get a complimentary lil cup of the daily gourmet popcorn, hot washcloth and a ghiradelli choc mint candy when you leave.

I've always been a loyal AMC Esplanade customer. For the past 3-4 few years, AMC on camelback has been our go-to theater. I can't remember the last time I've been to a "regular" theater. Like the other reviewers have pointed out, you become spoiled after you go to a dine in. I've never been particularly a fan of their food, but it's always an enjoyable experience nonetheless.  Last night was the first time that I had a disappointing experience. I wasn't very hungry so I ordered from the Kid's menu, specifically the chicken tenders ($8). The menu had stated that it came with a drink and a fruit cup. I had asked the server for coke as my drink of choice. At the end of the movie, as I was about to sign my tab, I was surprised to find that they had charged me separately for the coke ($5). I went to the front desk area to voice my concern, and one of the staff members rudely told me that it would be a while before she can help me with my tab. She walked out and came back with who I assumed was the manager. I voiced to her my concern, telling her that I thought the kids meal came with a coke which I was charged separately for. She told me that I was not allowed to order from the kid's meal and that was the reason why I was charged. I told her that the server did not inform me that this was the case, and that had I known this I would not have ordered from the kid's menu. The manager made it seem like my fault, and was adamant that she would not take the $5 off my tab.   The manager almost made me feel like I should be thankful they "allowed" me to order from the kid's menu. I didn't get their logic. They charged me $8 for a kid's size portion of chicken tenders, without bringing me the fruit cup that was supposed to accompany it (which I didn't realize until the very end), and charged me $5 separately for a glass of coke.  It's disappointing - it's not about the money. It's about the principle.

This place is filthy.  A filthy filthy mess.   Popcorn, wrappers, crumbs, and food remnants all over the floor.    Seriously?  Clean the flocking theatre before people enter as this place hasn't been cleaned all morning.    You're not the only place in town AMC.  Harkins would NEVEr look like this. This is the ESPLANAde!

I used to go here all the time but moved, so this location was more inconvenient for me, so only came back occasionally. We Just moved back to the area and was excited to be back at my theatre! But instead of leaving with my group talking about the movie, we were left with sticky shoes and questioning how clean the kitchen was.   One of the first in the area, this AMC provides the "total movie going experience" dinner, drinks and snacks are available here and the concept works, but somehow this location stresses me out.   Carpeting needs cleaning, napkins and popcorn everywhere, dirty dishes still on the handicap table, and the floor in the theatre extremely sticky with probably weeks of spilt soda. As you arrive, usually you are served immediately so food and beverage prep can begin, but we waited, and waited, and waited. No one showed for a while so I went out to ask if we could get some service while also mentioning the state of our theatre.   After the previews started service began. No big deal. Get my soda and popcorn pretty quick, but as the movie starts, food jeeps coming. So distracting. We're into the movie by about 20 min and people are still getting their food!   Management really needs to step it up here. One lady was great though. I expressed my disappointment and concerns and she handled it beautifully. Thus is why I'm giving three stars instead of one.
This place has a great bar area and is in a good location. But they don't have reclining seats like most places these days... kinda weird that everything else is so updated?
Great place for lunch! Pretty good food and drinks. Has stock bar too for those that like afternoon drinks. Seating with lounge as well.

Writing an updated review about 4 years since the theatre opened (felt like yesterday!)  Unfortunately, it has gone a little downhill IMHO in regards to how staff is managed, the new menu items and how they're prepped.   Food/Drink  They actually had great menu items in the past with the beer battered chicken tenders/fish sticks and parmasean fries which now have a different texture/taste in the way they're prepped. Or perhaps they are doing business with a different food vendor. Either way, it's not as good as it used to be. I haven't gotten the chance to try their new burgers, but i'll be back another time to try it eventually.   Their beers and cocktail choices have remained the same I believe. I mean, it's drinks. The taste of vodka, tequila, sam adams and what not are always going to be there. Of course, all objective if the tap co2 remains consistent! But great beer selections either way. I also like the 16-20 oz options too.   Service:  It's average. Ultimately, all I care about is that you're efficient in when you respond to the button (unless its a busy weekend, i understand) and if you get me the right items. I don't need you to give me WOW! but just prompt timely service. Unfortunately, even during the weeknights i'm there, that is not always the case. 10-15 minutes for a bar napkin ? cmon!  But the whole coming in during previews or the movie doesn't bug me. What i don't understand about some of these reviews, is that people forget they're in a DINE IN THEATRE. you want snacks and drinks before the movie? go to a gas station or harkins! you don't want to be interrupted during a movie? well what the heck are you doing in the dine in theatre to begin with? that's what the concept is about. Yes, it's not always ideal to hear side conversations during the movie, but thats the sacrifice, and even then it's still worth it.  Prices:  Okay yes, it is a lot of money upfront. But it's for the luxury and convenience of being served at a movie theatre WITH reclining chairs WHILE watching a movie and being able to drink alcohol in the theatre at that. So, the prices are pretty reasonable for the experience. Plus, if you were to go to dinner prior to seeing a movie, you're still dropping a good chunk of money for the evening anyway.   Location:  It's in the heart of biltmore, with a beautiful view of the mountain when you walk out during the day or early evening. Plus, while you do wait for your movie to start, you have the luxury of hanging out by their bar or the biltmore fashion park for drinks/apps if ur not getting any of that in the theatre.   I never really have a bad experience in this movie theatre, and I will be returning back again.

I wanted to love this concept more, but in the end it seemed awkward and more of a hassle. Firstly, these are not reclining seats. They do lean back more than a regular seat, but recline is too much credit. When you order food the server does this before the movie and doesn't really explain the process such as how/when you pay. Food gets brought in and is handed down the line, which is weird when you are sitting next to people you don't know and you are trying to figure out who's got what when the movie is going. More distracting than anything.   The food itself was good for theater junk.  Didn't have high expectations for magically delicious gourmet, but it was decent for sure.   The theater was clean, but confusing. You can't go get your popcorn at the normal place, you have to order it from your seat. The staff was nice. It was a nice screen and the seats (while not fully reclining) were comfy. I feel like this model could be utilized more efficiently and effectively and than this dining experience would be awesome, but as is, it's just not functional.

The place is nice, a little messy, but it is a lot nicer than most dine in movie theaters. The food is overpriced and nothing like what is shown on the menu. Expect fast food quality food for twice the cost.

I love going to the movies. I think I usually go to at least one, if not two movies a week. I love the experience especially when Im at esplanade. I love knowing that my seat is reserved when I get there. The reclining chairs are also great and so relaxing to enjoy the movie. They have a popcorn for $10 but it's MASSIVE so you can easily share it with 4 or 5 people. The service is also really great there. If you want to have a relaxing movie experience, then head to AMC Esplanade.

By far my favorite theatre! Pricing- about $10. 00 a ticket.  Seating- assigned seating so you don't have to worry about getting to the movie theater early to find a spot for you and/or your party.  Snacks- snacks are priced normally but drinks such as Icees  and sodas have  unlimited refills via the self serve machines.  Experience- super comfy recliner seats!!! Perfect if you just want to lay back and watch your movie. Tons of leg space, it's almost impossible to kick someone's chair or have your chair kicked by the person behind you.  I would say this theatre is on par with iPic theaters minus the server, menu options, and price.

I'd like to congratulate the manager or whomever is doing the hiring on selecting a really solid staff.  I took my family to the theater on a busy Friday evening and we interacted with 8-10 of your people.  Each was kind ,courteous and professional.  These days that kind of service can't be taken for granted.  This continues to be my first and only choice for movies in Phoenix. Keep it up!

Not the best of the dining theaters - the food is average and the prices are high for both movie and food.  The portions for the mediocre food is also the smallest I've had at one of these.  The popcorn is the same price as other AMCs so that's not a relief of any sort either.  I probably won't be back to this one..

What a fun way to see a movie! We enjoyed the Jambalaya and Mac and Cheese with our showing of Zoolander 2 and it was a good time. The food is fine...nothing overly special but it is a fun and different way to see a movie. It was nice to be served rather than wait like sheep at the candy counter. It was nice to have someone else cook and clean up. While it's a bit pricey, it's a creative treat for a fun evening.

Ok, this is a "Fork & Screen" and "Cinema Suites" AMC (one of 9 in the USA).  Since it is spanking new from the remodel completed in Sep '11, it is clean and shiny.  The comfy and roomy chairs are nice but not sure why they didn't put at least 2 to 3 more inches between them.  Service was fast at first then seemed to slow down.  If you want to drink alcohol while you watch a movie (instead of going to the AA meeting that you should be at), then this is the place.  Else, there are several other movie theaters near by that are just as comfy and a bit cheaper!

Way too expensive and the seats don't recline, it felt super cramped, and our service was awful. I prefer other AMC theaters like Desert Ridge or Deer Valley. If I'm spending this kind of dough for a dine-in experience, I'd go to iPic or Roadhouse.

Meh. Food is just average, a lot to choose from but nothing I've ever ordered was spectacular. Best thing I've had is the Brussel Sprouts and they were out of them last time. Also out of the cheese and meat appetizer. Services is average. Drink selection is probably the biggest plus.
Always a good time. Hubby and I make it out here often. Comfy seats and attentive staff. Love it. Ready for Bad Moms Christmas  so ready for laugh times

This is my go to theater since the remodel. I've never been much of a movie goer, not a huge fan of the whole crammed like sardines into a room with a bunch of strangers thing...AMC Esplanade is a game changer.   I'm a snob when it comes to almost everything, and hey, now I can be snobby about going to the movies too! The food is actually quite good. A significant step up from traditional bar fare. Offering everything from hot wings to fruit salad to the wonderfully tasty Smoked Salmon BLT. The fries are hot and crispy and the service is quick and friendly.  Now, let's talk liquor. When you walk in, the area that used to house popcorn, candy and soda is now a full bar! That's right, a full bar! Better wine and beer selection than I expected and you can still just get some popcorn and a Coke if you so desire.   The theaters themselves are comfortable and seating is just how I like it, recliner type seating with a lot of room between you and everyone else. We ordered our tickets online prior to the showing and were able to choose our seats which is a nice touch. Go! Go now!

Best place to watch a movie!  I'm more of a rent a video at home gal than go out to the movies, but I'll make an exception for this place.  The reclining seats are fabulous.  Order the popcorn - it's seriously the biggest bowl of popcorn I've ever seen.  The only thing I didn't like was the water / soda comes in a ginormous cup with no lid.

Wow, did we enjoy this theater! I live only a few minutes away, and we hadn't been back since they renovated. We are so happy to see someone investing money into the Esplanade, because inept management of the complex has caused some merchants to leave or go out of business (really grungy, scary garage and elevators bothers a lot of people). But now, with AMC updated like this, there could be a resurgence coming to the Esplanade area! It is the most unique theater experience you can find anywhere. We've been to UltraStar and others who serve food and drink and this is far better. They really pulled it off.  The "fork and screen" theaters are less expensive and they are just like a traditional show with a somewhat nicer leather seat and a tray with a call button for service. The wait staff is friendly and outgoing (thanks Brittany!). But we enjoyed the "CinemaSuites" section of the theater so much more than the "Fork and Screen" side. In the CinemaSuites section, there are huge screens combined with exotic, electric retractable lounge chairs and dining trays that swing in and out of position. I was literally as comfortable as I would be on my own couch (more so!!) and the service was great. I had a White Chocolate Expresso Blender to drink and a delicious bacon cheeseburger. They brought us a little popcorn snack with chocolate in it that was not ordered, nor charged, and it was delicious.   The theater itself has state of the art sound and as I said, a great big screen. It was expensive ($12) but I think very much worth it. There aren't that many seats in the theater because of the amount of room they give you around each seat -- it's really super luxe. Comparing this with an airline, the seats and service are like first class here compared to the tourist/economy seating of a standard show seat like a Harkins. We get it, AMC -- we see what all the fuss is about. This is the way to see movies. The only-average movie we went to see ("The Iron Lady") was made so much better by the comfort and care they gave us. Highly recommended.  The only negatives we had is the continued dirty, grungy appearance of the parking area and the elevator. I agree with another poster that there's too much "Security" presence, but they never bothered us or made us uncomfortable.

I keep going back because it is close by and you can reserve seats.  But again there are so many issues with this amc.  First off amc charge convenience fees for online orders or you can avoid fees by paying a membership fee each year. Either way you pay.  Parking is ok in amc parking in rear, plan though because literally 4 hours and a couple minutes and you get nickel and dimed again (sucks for long movies). Went to theatre #7 and we didn't need a jacket... we needed a personal fan!!!  It was HOT, complained to management and it didn't get better.  Toughed it out but should have left.  Asked for "Iced tea" and received zero ice, and no sweetener.  Asked if they had maybe a cup of ice and some sweet and low, they asked if I had ordered it? Some reason the escalators are down the past few months so be ready for 56 stairs or an elevator ride.  Every time we go it is always something, I no longer order food here as they can't figure out orders and it is always an issue in the middle of a movie to try and fix.

The food tasted OK but you really could not enjoy it. The seats were not adjustable and you were practically eating and lying down. Very uncomfortable! Food was over priced for its quality and the servers kept walking in front of my view.  Very distracting! Bar tenders in the lobby were all kinds of rude and the alcohol was way overpriced. I would recommended IPics!

I reeeeallyyy wanted to love this theater!  Everyone kept raving about it, supposedly the best in Phoenix.  We arrived & were def wowed by the nice lobby & bar.  The seats we definitely not the most comfortable compared to the other AMC theaters & I found it really distracting with the clanging of forks, drinks being dropped on the floor, servers walking back & forth etc.  I know it's the whole experience that's supposed to be neat but I just didn't find it to be my cup of tea.  The sign said the theater we were in was 21 & older but there were tons of loud kids in there which confused me. I also wish there was an option to turn off the light on the side of your seat when you're done eating.  I found it to be pretty bright.  Glad we checked it off our list but we probably won't be running back anytime soon.

I usually like AMC, I do.  But it seems that everytime we go here, there is a problem.  For example, the other night, we wanted to see Date Night. Both MoviePhone.com and Fandango.com had shows at 8:45 and 9:40.  When we showed up, having missed the 8:45, we wanted to go to the 9:40 show. No one was up front selling tickets, so we had to buy it through the machine. It said it was currently 8:51, and that the only show that night was 8:45.  So we figured with previews we'd be fine, bought the tickets...which then came out of the machine completely smeared and unreadable.  Upon entering the theatre, we realize it was way into the movie, so we check out cell phones. It was actually 9:25 -- the machine's clock was off.  We went back to guest services to get a refund, and were told there was no 9:45.  Then I saw his sheet of paper, and pointed out to him that it SAID 9:45 was the next showing.  After a moment of "oh, well, I just didn't see that...and the machine is broken" we asked if we could just go see the 9:45, and were let in.  For the outrageous prices for both tickets and food (and the machine sure doesn't help OR give any student discounts), I'm really underwhelmed.  We'll probably look at another theatre.
Such a fun evening and a nice treat.  I love the comfy seats and attentive service.

Worst experience in a theatre. Sounds good but you have waiters walking in front of you every 2 minutes, or can choose a seat with bad viewing angle. I prefer the old school theatre. This whole-- pick your seat thing is more of a pain than the first come, first serve approach too. Unless you have been there before it is hard to really know where to sit without having someone walk I front of you, and seats are  in pairs so you if you show up with an odd number, one friend gets screwed. The popcorn is disgustingly oily and salty. And, as always, food is overpriced. AMC needs to learn how less can be more

If you want to have an outstanding experience at the movie Theater, this is it.  I sat in a reclining chair, couldn't see the row behind or in front of me and had a waitress serve my order. I ordered a glass of wine and a bowl of popcorn. This is what a movie theater experience should be!

We Came here for the extra SERVICE we've come to expect when paying the extra cost.  Arrived for our movie, found our seats, decided on a drink,some popcorn and sushi. We thought the service light may have been out of order when we pushed it, waited 30 mins and were never acknowledged. My better half walked down to the lobby to find someone, and was told someone would be up to take our order. We waited an additional 10 minutes before he went back to the lobby to place our order. No explanation or apology for why we had not been greeted. The food arrived by two different people in about 10 mins.  We ate and wanted a refill of the $6.00 coke.  This time I had to use the restroom so I went and asked for a refill on the way there. The bathroom was filthy. Trash on the floor, wet sinks, clogged sinks and unflushed toilets. The refill arrived 10 mins after I ordered it. Extremely disappointed in the cleanliness and attentiveness of staff.  Our theater only had about 12 other people so I'm wondering if all the staff was attending to Star Wars opening weekend.

Worst. Food. Ever. Everything is legit microwaved and the chicken tastes like rubber. Definitely not worth over $250 spent of the 6 of us. Drinks were not good either and our server was something else- Seats seemed nice but the parking situation is pretty bad. I'd rather pay more per ticket and go to Ipic or Studio Movie grill. Won't be back.

Best Theater in the Valley  Reserved seats. Good quality food. Good theater viewing and sound. Clean restrooms. These are the things that I'm looking for in a theater and AMC has nailed it.  The grilled salmon is surprisingly good (and healthy) for a place like this. I get it without the sauce and they supplement it with lots of nicely cooked, crisp broccoli. Their milk shakes are also awesome (with a burger...not the salmon :-) ). I'm not sure we've had a bad meal and my family has spent a lot of time here.  The only suggestion I would have is to improve the checkout process. The servers really do not know how to handle the AMC Stubs accounts properly and often are not readily available as the movie ends.

This is pretty much the only theater I go to.  Yes they have increased the prices a little since it first opened up but it's still cheaper than the over rated Ipic in Scottsdale.    The seats are always super comfy and the food is actually really good.  The food is about average price but the drinks can get pricey.  How can you complain though about getting to eat dinner and have a drink while watching a movie!   One thing to stay away from though are the milkshakes (might as well be ice cream flavored milk) and the burgers I haven't had much luck with as you can't get them cooked to order.  Just about everything else I've tried has been great though.

I really enjoyed this movie Theater and would defiantly recommend this for Couples if you have kids keep them at home lol............. This will defiantly be Me and my husbands favorite date night spot. this was our first time at this AMC and I really enjoyed it. the seats were comfortable the server was very polite and prompt on getting our order and refills also the crab dip is very tasty. and I would recommend the fried shrimp it was also very tasty. Great date night would highly recommend this movie Theater to anyone.

The service here is awful. They are insanely slow and literally just forget to bring things. It has happened the last three times I've gone there. The last visit I had to go find the waiter after the movie because he never brought the bill, although he did pre charge the card when I ordered and then never brought me the $8 beer. They are just the worst. And the reviews on the seats are right too. They are really uncomfortable. The tickets and food are overpriced also. I love the location of this theatre, but everything else is horrible.
Management is to be desired and that's putting it mildly.  Someone work with Ricky and the tiny angry child like woman on a power trip.

I went to the dine-in theater last weekend as a treat.  This is my first time experiencing a dine-in theater so I was excited.  I decided to order my tickets in advance on Fandango.  For two tickets the cost came to $30.  This is a little over $10 more than what I'd typically pay for 2 tickets.  However, I did it for the experience.  I arrived at the theater about 15 minutes early in order to make sure that I could order before previews started.  The seats are quite comfortable and you can adjust them to lift the legs up.  You also get a nice long tray to put all your food and beverages on which is attached to the seat.  I ordered water and a cocktail and waited until the server came back to order my food.  I ended up going with the shrimp and fries dish.  The shrimp was jumbo sized and quite good for a theater.  The drink was also pretty good.  The theater has a full bar so you can practically get anything.  The movie viewing experience was standard besides the occasional clinking of silverware and servers making their way through the aisles throughout the movie.  My total bill for two drinks and two entrees came out the $70.  Add that to the price of the ticket and it cost over $100 with tax and tip.  I definitely will only do this on special occasions going forward since it was a little costly in my opinion.  However, definitely a great experience and a very professional staff.
I have gone back a few times, and received much better service each time! Food and drinks are still a bit pricey for what you get, but I would recommend going.

I am a huge fan of this idea, it cost about the same as if you went to a movie and dinner at a place like chili's or TGIF.  The food is very good and the seats are so comfy you will never want to go to a regular theater again.

I haven't written a review on Yelp in a while, but I felt this place warranted one. The prices here are right on some things... Like the movies. The prices are about the same as a regular movie theater. The food is priced about the same as a restaurant. But the drinks are way overpriced. I ordered a peach shandy "beer cocktail" at the bar and it was $12. Yikes. I considered ordering another drink later but the prices talked me out of it. $5.99 for a Bud Light? No thanks. But the worst thing was the service. Someone came over to take our order the minute we sat down so of course we weren't ready. We should have been because it took probably 15 minutes after pressing the button to get a server. Then another 20 minutes to get our food. We were almost halfway through the movie before we got anything. When I finally did get my food, the salsa was pretty spicy, and my drink that was gone by that point. So I pressed the button again. At least another 10 minutes before I got a server and another 5 before I got the water. Everything just took forever. And then the movie ended and we hadn't gotten a check. We easily could've walked out without paying but we didn't. We paid at the bar. Seriously... This is a great concept but the service needs a LOT of improvement.

This cozy theatre is great when you want a little more from your movie experience. I like that they don't price gouge (not like many of the other full-service movie theatres I've been to). The prices are reasonable for the movies and I like the plush seating.   The only issue I have is it's hard to get to unless you know where you are going. This place is tucked away upstairs and I found myself wandering around a bit. However, they do have a very helpful valet downstairs to get you where you need to go. He just happened to be busy when I walked by the first time.

Absolutely the worst most disgusting theater I have ever been to. Don't fall for the "premium power recliner seats" they falsely advertise on the website. They are covered in duct tape! Yes duct tape. Also if you sit in rows D or higher you cannot see half the screen. Something I reported to management which they responded with yes we have been aware of it for 3 years, but don't disclose on their website which is where you reserve seats. This place is a joke. Don't waste your time for something that is falsely advertised!

The experience is not what it used to be!  We waited over 20 minutes for napkins/silverware AFTER food was delivered (they were not next to any of the seats like they used to be).  And then came the baby crying and a toddler screaming... throughout the film. We specifically chose the 'Cinema Suite' theater because it has always been 21 and up only. As a group of 4 adults we wanted to enjoy the movie with some nice drinks - screaming really ruined the atmosphere.  I wrote to corporate asking if they changed their 21+ policy and will update this review when I hear from them.    For now I would say STAY AWAY from this theater. While it used to be our favorite theater it has steadily declined over the last year. Driving to the Harkins IMAX in Tempe is worth the extra time!  UPDATE: Yes AMC changed their policy. They no longer have  21+ theaters. I have went back twice since the prior review. First time went during the day (before 5pm) and experienced fussy toddlers during a rated R movie. Second time we went back at night (after 8pm)  after the R rated movie had been out for a couple weeks and there were only adults in the audience. We may go back in the future at night but the Tempe IMAX is significantly better.

Been here 3 times, we won't likely return.   First time we had a theatre with plush recliners and less seating. The experience was nice.   The last 2 visits we were in older style chairs. Ripped from wear. Quite frankly, the seats at the Cristown Harkins are more comfortable.   After alerting an employee of a group being disruptive-nothing was done.   We ordered cheesy tots (a bad idea, we should have known better) they were covered in roughly chopped green onion. Almost inedible.   Not worth the extra cost.

I've been to both the Fork & Screen, and Cinema Suites sections of this theater, and have never been disappointed with either. However, as a matter of continual patronage, I really prefer the Cinema Suites, as the chairs are more comfortable.  Overall, both venues are a no hassle way of enjoying the movies without all the interference that detract from the experience. At first glance, you may think that the continual flow of servers who assist patrons with their orders would be a distraction. Nonetheless, the aisles themselves are fairly wide, and the theater is designed in such a way that none of this activity is actually obtrusive.   And the fact that all this open space reduces the number of patrons per theater is an added bonus.  The only bad experiences we have had so far were with a fork and screen that had sticky floors (probably someone spilled a drink), and slow service in the Cinema Suites.   Otherwise, the food has been good, and the venue is a great departure from a traditional theater.  We almost always exclusively come here now to watch movies.

Went on 6/16/17 with the family to see Cars 3. When we arrived at the seats, they were dirty. Cup holders were full of trash, trays weren't cleaned and there was even tomato on my arm rest. It took quite a while for someone to return with a less than clean looking rag to wipe it off. The popcorn was pretty good, the food was mediocre at best. (We had chicken tenders, Mac n cheese and a burger.)  While the poor food quality and lack of cleanliness was enough to make us not return, the overall lack of good manners by other customers sealed the deal. This movie theatre was the equivalent of being at Chuck E Cheese with kids shouting, crying and running around the place. It was a very expensive and not enjoyable experience.

Clean theater but the food was over priced and not that good. When I tried the sushi and it tasted bad and asked the waitress, her response was no one likes it and sends it back. If that's the case take it off the menu!

Our go-to theater these days is the Esplanade AMC, mostly because of it's proximity to home.   Reserving seats is really nice because you can come to the movie right on time and be sure to have a great seat. If we find out the movie is in the larger theater, I'm bummed, because I prefer the smaller theaters with the full reclining chairs and a little more space - great for date nights.  I'm not a fan of the movie ticket price, so we try to come when there is a special running such as $5 moves on Tuesdays around the holidays. I also don't love having a server come by during the movie, or having the lights on next to each seat, but it is nice having someone deliver food (popcorn for me please!) when you get to the theater late.

This was my first upscale, premiere dine-in movie theatre experience. It was fabulous, the seats are so comfortable and the servers serve (okay) food and alcohol! There is nothing better than this as long as you are drinking wine during a Jennifer Aniston movie! The theatre we sat in had la-z-boy recliners which you can fall asleep in at any moment. The previous theatre the last time I was here had regular seats, nothing special and paid extra for the ticket. It seems the type of seats vary per theatre so be aware if you buy tickets for a showing.  I don't think I will ever go back to your "typical movie theatre" if I have the option again!

Great setup. Nice bar. Terrible service. Comfy recliner seats.  Buying tickets is an awkward process. Ticket kiosks don't work very well (all of the printers were down. Couldn't buy rated R tickets at the kiosk).   Front desk lady was very short and somewhat rude. She didn't seem to know if the theater offered military discounts on tickets and simply responded "I don't see it...." .... OK..?... Also, would have been nice to be informed which row was the front/rear row when picking seats on the diagram. Would have saved me a second trip back to guest services.  Heavily priced items but the novelty is cool of being served. Press the button on the comfy recliners and your waiter is summoned.  Highly recommend the Parmesan fries!

This is the only place I now watch movies. Its clean, good food, great drinks, good service and no screaming babies. It's pricey but I'm willing to pay it so I can enjoy watching the movie instead of wondering when the kid behind me will stop kicking my seat.

Let me start by saying I used to LOVE to see movies here. My hubby and I are huge movie goers  at least 5-6 movies a month. However my last two trips here have been horrible! Saturday night the theater was so hot I could hardly breath on top of this my seat was broken. I am 5 month pregnant and my waitress felt bad so she said she would get someone to fix the chair.... It took about 15 min of me standing on the side but it did get fixed.   Then today we went back to the movies - different theater this time however, same problem the chair was broken. We were early before the lights went off so I called the waitress over. This time the waitress said to us " I know it's broken I told my manager during the last movie but I guess he choose not to fix it" this one was really uncomfortable.... I could hardly sit. She said she would go talk to her manager and see if he would fix it the .  15 min later The waitress came back and said " sorry there is noway for us to fix now that the lights are off"  so I stuck it out and watched the movie. They then proceeded to charge me $7 for tea- not even a compt drink. This manager working today on 11-23-14 should really learn what Customer service is. I'm not sure I will be back. I'm willing to drive 10 more min to scottsdale.
Best theater out there.  Dine-in, assigned seating, comfortable chairs, and no ghetto teenagers talking throughout the movie.  If you want ghetto, head over to Christown theater...

Never really had a problem here. The crowds aren't awful like the other theaters around me. Annnd it's close to the Gelato Spot, so I can smuggle in some treats.   But what's up with the totally rank sewage odor that you have to suffer through while you go up the escalators? You'd think that in such a nice, upscale area as that, they'd want to fix that immediately, but it's been like that as long as I've been a patron.

Great theater. . Greg and I are movie buffs, were at a movie,  at least once if not twice a week. We spend most of our time at the Esplanade.  Its a good theater.  Unfortunately the food is not my favorite AT ALL.  But,  in general,  the atmosphere of the place is great.

This theatre is run by amateurs.  I knew something was wrong when the theatre was not showing the usual AMC promos but was assured that this was because it was the first show of the day.  Finally, right when the movie was scheduled to start the alleged manager came in reporting the file was corrupted and it would take two hours to download.  I guess checking a movie before it is run is outside the thinking capacity of this crowd.  Never again!!

The chair I sat in was broken and so eating laying half down was a little difficult! c6 was the number.. don't  get that seat! The menu, dinner food and service was great... but the popcorn was old and cheery and they didn't have red vines! Awwww so it was average but not as relaxing as I hoped! They need to put some beauty and cleaning and better seats in the place. I expected better for the Esplanade!

An older theater that's keeping up with the new kids! Comfy, reserved seats with food service with a smile without the astronomical cost found at other luxury theaters. Food was pretty good, or with the great location, you could just go for the show and scope out one of the many nearby restaurants.

This is a Quality over Quantity decision, folks.  You pay a premium for these seats, but they are easily 2x as comfortable, you aren't crowded with others, there are no screeming kids in strollers, in general this is a more upscale audience where you are not likely to get in the middle of a gang fight, etc.  For me, I made the decision to take my family's usual movie going schedule, and spend 1/2 of those seeing a movie at home with Redbox for $1, and half the time taking my family to this theater, paying $2-5 per ticket premium, and having more fun.  The food is Applebees in a theater, basically, with a $3-4 premium per dish for getting served at your seat.  Again, if you were going to an Applebees quality restaurant, pay the premium.  It's fun.  If you wanted upscale, there are lots of restaurants in the complex or across the street (use the tunnel, it's cool!).  One thing I recommend is skipping the popcorn.  It's a small bag, isn't as fresh as a usual theater, and runs $8.  No thanks.  If you want to spend $8, spend it on real food or candy.    For me, the difference between watching a movie in a theater like Harkins Christown or in AMC Esplanade is like the difference between First Class and a middle seat in Coach on a 12 hour transoceanic flight.  Yes, it's that big.    But it only costs $2-4 per ticket premium folks.  That's money well spent.  I mean, for me, it's a complete, total, no-brainer.  By the way, unlike the other reviews, the adults only theaters ARE more comfortable seats, but not THAT much more comfortable.  So if you have an equal choice, go with the adults only theater seats, but if not, don't be scared... still do it.

SSLLOOOWWW service. Had three different people serving us so no wonder one drink was forgotten till we asked again for it. Had to inquire when food would be delivered, it took so long. Check was handed to us without asking if we wanting anything more. Seats not so comfortable. If I wanted to recline, I'd stay home. Don't go hungry.

Disappointing this time...  logistical difficulties to start... 10 minutes before show time still cleaning with large crowd waiting.  Loooooonnnnnng preview and advertising - probably a management attempt to allow for some buffer to take orders, etc.   not the worst idea, I guess.    Matinee show so no major food for us.  Popcorn, sodas and trying the churros out.   Overall, food was as one would expect for a movie:  greasy, salty, sweet.    Several annoying problems during the movie.  Interrupted repeatedly by runners trying to bring us other people's orders.   The one thing I did request (a simple Diet Coke refill) was a no show - despite asking twice.   Oh well.  Seats weren't comfortable and the last shows popcorn was still all over - despite the delay for cleaning...   Have been here several times and quality has been slowly fading, but today was definitely an acceleration.

They just switched from a traditional theater to a "dine-In" theater. More food options are available in lobby or during movie via waiter service. Bigger more comfortable, leather chairs in Fork & Dine screens & leather recliners in suites. You will be paying more for these seats as far fewer seats in theaters. Bacon Cheeseburger and Smoked salmon BLT are nothing spectacular, average at best. Burgers not cooked below medium well

I love this theatre. The first time my husband took me there as a surprise I was so impressed! The Cinema Suite are amazing. Each person has there own extremely comfortable recliner. I have had many meals here and the food is pretty good. The big bonus about this theatre is that they have alcohol! It is so fun to enjoy a beer or cocktail as you recline and watch a movie :) It is a bit more expensive than other theatres, but so very worth it! Especially for a treat.

The chairs in the "Cinema Suites" are The. Most. Comfortable. EVER. The service is great. It does make for a pricey movie going experience, but once in awhile, you gotta Treat. Yo. Self. This is my treat to self of choice.

AMC Esplanade is by far the most successful navigator of the new "Dinner and a Movie" blue ocean the theater industry is starting to penetrate (that's right, I just referenced Blue Ocean Strategy, get over it).  No, it's not an extremely enlightened idea. I've been sneaking Bacardi into theaters since 2003 so it's about time theaters realize they should probably attempt to turn a profit off of it, but AMC really upped the game by not only providing me the option of purchasing alcoholic beverages from THEM, but also upgraded chairs, and a ton of delicious food (Including the obligatory $4 box of candy which is hilarious sitting next to a $9 burger. Like "Don't mind this $9 full meal over here, we still stand firm that Gummi Bears are worth their weight in gold.")  Yes, it's more expensive than a regular ticket. Almost double for the nice seats. But trust me, YOU WANT THOSE SEATS. You will regret not getting the $15 seats if you don't buy the $15 seats so just pony up the cash and delight in the fact that movie theaters are now almost as comfortable as watching a movie in your own home.   This theater is so nice it even makes bad movies tolerable. I saw The Master here and probably would have stabbed myself in the eye with my embezzled Bacardi flask if I didn't have a comfy recliner and three glasses of wine to get me through it. I seriously won't go to a movie anywhere else and I guarantee you'll say the same once you go. FIVE STARS.

For years I've enjoyed going to the movies here The cinema suites HAD the best seats in town  So large and comfy  Just went last night They got cheap and replaced the once comfy recliners  Now they have the same uncomfortable chairs that all the others have Seats go back just enough to keep you squirming trying to be comfy and leave with a hurting back and neck I used to go to the movies once a week Won't be going back AMC

Worst theatre experience ever, seriously avoid this place.  Deadpool 2 was to start at 12:30. "Pre-show" ads played til 12:40. There were then 20 minutes of trailers. The 12:30 film did not start until 1:00. That is simply ridiculous.  Beyond that: 1. The place is dirty. 2. Servers walk around with lit cell phones to take orders. 3. A server was arguing with a guest about his bill during the last few minutes of the movie. 4. Severe lack of signage to find the theatre and parking.

I've come back a few times to give this location another shot since my last review and unfortunately still the same sad experience. This location has so much potential consider the fact that it is in the heart of the Biltmore area. Plenty of parking in the garage which is validated for four hours. Easy access to restaurants and shops for a night out experience but not worth paying extra money for service that is not up to par with restaurant standards.   My last experience was on July 4th at 1:20 pm. My trays were nasty. So bad that I went to the restroom grabbed a paper towel to wet it and wipe the trays that I would be eating on. Imagine going to a restaurant and eating at a dirty table.  Same situation. My menus were sticky which seems to be an ongoing issue at this theater. My server was quick to come take my order but did not receive everything which is kitchen error as I saw him type it in. The first thing to come was my fries not our drinks. They were luke warm. No silverware. The whole row I sat in did not have napkins or utensils. After asking three times for it and wait staff delivery food who kept telling us it was coming it never came. After nearly finishing my food, along with everyone else in my row who all had to eat our food without utensils. I walked down to the bar to ask for it. I was told they ran out and it will take 15 mins to clean everything. I asked for at least paper bar napkins because popcorn butter and pizza grease is not fun all over your hands. The server provided me with some and came to drop off silverware 15 mins later. By that time we were done. No apology. I understand things happen but we should have been told this every time someone asked. I find it disappointing that a dine in theater did not have the proper utensils to provide when serving meals.  The bathrooms were perfect and well stock. The movie played great they just can't get the service down.

This place is sweet.  It eliminates the sucky parts of going to a theater (finding a seat crammed next to a stranger, needing more popcorn during the movie) and replaces them with wait service, seat assignments, and comfy chairs!!

I came here for the first time a few weeks ago and it was a mediocre experience. Obviously, the concept is a great idea- food, drinks, and a movie all at your reclining seat. However, we ordered our tickets and the only seats for four together were the back row; which was no biggie. When we sat down and reclined though, the ledge was blocking our view-so much so that we had to physically pick up and move our seats. Sounded like a great solution until we had to put our recliners down so that the servers could come by each and every time.  The food wasn't too bad, but the kitchen was forty minutes behind...

I am in love with the cinema suite! Being able to stretch out your legs on the LazyBoy recliner is the way to enjoy the movie. The chair is spacious and the room is not crowded with viewers.  The foods are at a reasonable price and the server is nice. For movie that are 2+ hours long, watching movie on the recliner is the best experience. Also great place to go on a date :)

My friends and I will not be returning to this venue. During portions of the movie we could hear staff in the foyer laughing it up and talking about schedules which killed the mood of the scenes. In the meantime, we waited way too long on serving basics such as drink refills, napkins and cutlery to go with the food. Overall food was okay except for some over salted/peppered chicken. Afterwards, these issues were addressed with a non-chalant manager whose response was to give us free movie and dinner tickets which I regifted immediately. He seemed more annoyed to get another complaint than making it an opportunity to educate his staff. Overall, based on the myriad of other reviews, this place is going to be a gamble.

Great theatre, horrible manager.  The manager was working the cash register and told us that they only had front row seats left for our show.  We looked online and came back to the front after discovering that there were plenty of upper row seats available.  Her excuse for telling us there were only front row available was because she thought that my 5'6 girlfriend wouldn't be able to see over the ledge. She also told us that the front row seats were better because they reclined and the others didn't, which was not true.

This place has gone downhill over the years. We thought we had ordered the Cine-Suites but I didn't realize in the description it mentioned it. :-(   We are in the first showing at 9:30am and it's a little sticky.
Ordered food even though I wasn't hungry just because I could. Nowhere like it in NorCal.

What started off to be a nice experience quickly fizzled when an hour after leaving the theatre we realized we were given the wrong credit card. We had to go back to the theatre. My husband spoke to the manger and the senior manager about the issue. They were pleasant, apologized, took down his information so if the other girl comes back with our card they will call us. They also sent him off with a bunch of coupons for free appetizers bogo entrees and a few movie passes. That would have been a very kind gesture if they didn't EXPIRE on 10/15/2011 being that today is 10/9/2011. The few movie passes don't expire for a year which is nice.  Those "might" make up for the time it takes for me to cancel my credit card, change my auto pays to a new card etc.  Tip for the Esplanade: Please give your servers flashlights so they can give out the right credit card to the right customer. (On a side note: our friends that went with us were given the wrong change and had to let the server know or they would have been short-changed)  We will stick with Harkins at Fashion Square.

A friend and I went to AMC dine in theater, I had the burger which was good she had the macaroni and cheese which was cold so she sent it back.  We both shared the macaroni and cheese which was returned to us luke warm.   Within four hours she was violently ill shortly after I experience the same symptoms, we were both severely ill for the next two days, i'm guessing Norwalk virus.  I contacted the Maricopa County health department, I will no longer eat at this establishment.

Ehhh. It was Ok.   Honestly it was a bit of a letdown.  I have been to both luxury theaters in Las Vegas (North Las Vegas and Henderson) and even one in Bangkok, Thailand(Siam Paragon Mall), so I was pretty pumped to experience something similar in Phoenix during a recent visit. I'm sorry, but this one just did not stack up to the others.   It wasn't horrible, though. Our party of 4 went to see the latest Transformers movie in 3D. Matinee tickets were fairly priced at $11 each. Not a problem there. The picture and sound quality were on point, which made the movie easy to enjoy. The A/C was set at a nice "deep-freeze" level, which I greatly appreciate during the face-melting Phoenix summer!  However, there were a few things that were lacking here...  - the seats did not fully recline, which was probably the biggest disappointment here, they would ease back a few inches...but thats it...ehhh..not impressed.. - you just hit a button by your seat to order your food, and while our hostess(?) was very nice(and busy), it got to be distracting from the movie, when you ordered, than when you received your food, than when you got your bill, again when they picked up all the tabs, again when they returned for your signiture, and yet again to deliver your receipt.....and if you want refills, of course you will be visited again..  I understand its all necessary, but i would miss snipits of the movie here and there and it wasn't really an optimal situation.. - $4.50 for a 20 oz soda...ouch...at least kiss me first! -$8.50 for a popcorn, one size only....comparable to a medium at most other places...with 1 free refill..popcorn was tasty though  Overall, it wasn't bad...but I have simply experienced better.  3 stars.
Been here 4 times and the food is just great.  Today I had the pizza and it was the best I've ever had. Have not had an avg or bad meal here.  Far better food then most restaurants in town.

Love love love this place! As good as it gets - the leather reclining seats are like flying first class in an airplane, the food is great, there is a button to call the waiter if you want to order anything else - definitely try it!!

Went here with my family and totally felt discriminated against. The server came and asked if we wanted anything we order some popcorn and sodas and I guess he didn't like our choices.. next thing we knew he came up with his manager and we basically got kicked out. Manager didn't do it in a professional manner. His reasoning was that it was an 21 and over side of the theater and that my son who was 8 months wasn't allowed in there even though it was 10am and there was no one in the theater just us! Horrible horrible horrible....

The only pro was that this is way better than studio movie grill but nowhere close to ipic. I'm so glad we had a gift card because I would've been pissed if we were spending our own money.  Cons: 1. The seat I was in had tears which made it totally uncomfortable in my shorts.  2. They were out of the espresso mix 3. It took 30 minutes to get an iced tea, water and popcorn 4. The servers are not very well versed in customer service  Only way I'm going back is if we have a gift card again.

Eh. The idea is cool but unfortunately this place doesn't meet me expectations.  The seats in the theaters with recliners are awesome! Tons of space and the chairs are comfortable. The service was fast and the employees are very nice.  The last time I went, we were in one of the larger theaters due to the moving being a new release. The service was still fast but these seats are so crammed together. They do not recline and your knees are maybe a few inches from touching the seat in front of you. They are still the cushion type seats but are not comfortable due to how close they all are.  As for the food, falls flat and it's overpriced. I would compare it to the microwaved food from Applebee's, but honestly, it is worse. No flavor and cold. I would guess the tickets to be the same as a regular theater due to the price of the food but the tickets are also more expensive. I know there are plenty of other theaters in the valley with big comfy reclining chairs and the ticket prices are normal.    My last visit the movie was at 10:30, we arrived very early and waited. It took them over 45 minutes to clean the theater and we were not allowed to enter until 10:30, the start time of the movie. This was an inconvenience because they started it up right away giving no one time to really get settled after waiting for the staff forever. I've never had this happen before. I've always been able to enter a theater at least 15 minutes before the previews to get settled in. Maybe they need more staff for cleaning the larger theaters when there are new releases.  ...... And to be honest eating mediocre food in the dark that I can't first see scares me a little.

Only 32 seats in the theater. They are luxurious and motorized fully reclinable old man leather couch chairs. So comfy. Sound was great. Matinee prices very reasonable. I did not take advantage of the full bar or waitstaff food service, but may next time.  Location is sort of odd, across the street from mall area; but there is a walkway underneath the busy street.

I like this place. The food is not that great though. I kind of feel like it's pre-made and then heated up for each person.   What I like:   Nice fancy atmosphere  Comfortable chairs  Helpful service  Plenty of Staff  You can drink in the movie   What I don't like..   The food.. Don't order the quesadilla, mac and cheese or chicken tenders...   The burger is OK...   I love going to this theater and I will keep going, but I don't know if I will order food again, unless I'm starving. The theater would be exceptional if the food was more tasty. I also feel like movies are better when  you go there because you don't have to worry about anything. There is plenty of space in your big comfy chair, the wait staff is at the push of a button and you can always get a good seat. They even ran back to get kid sized 3D glasses.   I have seen 3 movies here so far and am making plans for girl's night to see more in the future, but like I said, I will most likely only order popcorn and maybe dessert to eat.

Love the chairs and the screen experience.  Parts I don't like: While at the bar I noticed the bar back drop some clean cups and water pitchers on the floor as he opened a cabinet. I watched to see if they would clean them after, but they didn't. They took them and filled them with water to be used in the movies. This kind of grossed me out.
