I attempt to go look again in the theater when I am cornered by two more employees who tell me I need to leave, my belongings aren't their responsibility and they don't have them. ( all in disgustingly rude tone) I am in tears at this point as I know they are here and they refuse to look. 1 hour later (now 10:30) pm I am forced to call a Lyft to take me home where I am meeting a locksmith ( my apartment key was also in them). I am charged 150 dollars for the door to be unlocked.  Fast forward to today, I go back in and ask a new person at the ticket counter if they have my keys. Immediately he says no. I lie and say. I spoke to someone in the phone last night who said they're here. He calls the manager and the manager also says no. All the while NOBDOY WILL EVEN LOOK FOR THE DAMN KEYS!!  Five minutes later a girl walks out with my keys in her hand.  Big surprise my keys were there the entire time and these worthless "human beings" couldn't be bothered to just locate them. Now I'm stuck with plenty of bills while they don't give two shits. Screw that.

The new dine-in experience was pretty good. The seats in the "fork and screen" theaters are nice, though it seems like they are going to start to squeak, as they are more like rocking chairs than recliners. The seating is reserved, which I actually like. But be careful if you have a party of more than four people -- most rows of seats are only four across. I recommend any additional people sit in the row behind the main party, as the aisles are extremely wide. I took a peek at the "cinema suites" theaters which look a bit more comfortable, but I didn't get to try it. Note that each movie is usually shown in only one type of theater layout, so you won't have a choice of the type of theater you get.  The food was merely ok, as other reviewers said, on-par with a low-end chain restaurant. Most disappointing was the chicken strips, which were McNugget-like blobs of ground up chicken in a tasteless coating. And like McNuggets, there were weird gross pieces here and there. Not what I expect for $12.
The wait staff in the lobby was slow and the theater didn't get cleaned until minutes before the start of the movie.

My new go-to theater when I need to lounge and relax while watching a movie in public. I had ordered and paid for our tickets online so there was no waiting while I got our tickets from the machine. We were in theater 3 to watch Interstellar. That's a long movie, but I didn't even notice thanks to the comfortably padded reclining leather seats. No one else sat in our row (and only 5 people total in the theater) so we had privacy...and quiet.  The whole experience was so comfortable and positive that I know I'll be back. I ordered the Carne Asada Tacos: Two seasoned beef carne asada tacos with savory applewood-smoked bacon, corn salsa, pico de gallo and a cool avocado-lime crema wrapped in double-layered corn tortillas. Served with fresh tortilla chips and salsa. The pico de gallo was good. I can't believe I ate the whole thing.

Aside from the fact that this theatre is close to home, it is not as packed and you feel like you are VIP. They don't have the best food in town, but it's not bad and the concept of people serving you while you watch a movie is pretty cool.  They also offer alcoholic drinks so that is a major plus.  You definitely have lots of leg room and you can snuggle up with your honey because the armrest goes up.  You pay $2-3 more than an average movie ticket, but you sometimes gotta live the high life for a change so spend that extra $6 for you and a date, order her an alcoholic drink, put up that armrest, and start manuevering your arm over her neck, and watch the movie.  Hopefully, your arm doesn't get a cramp from leaving it in that position for too long.  Afterwards, don't forget to validate your parking ticket and hopefully, you end the night with a nice smooch.    Good Luck!

Won't waste my time coming back here. With nobody around on a Sunday night, the 9:30pm showing of a movie nearly empty, we were refused tickets because I didn't have my ID to prove I was over 21. Really? I'm frickin' old enough to be your mother, kid. Was told we could see another movie on the forks side. For $30? No, thanks. AMC MAJOR FAIL! I'll just spend my money elsewhere.

Summary: I am consistently underwhelmed here. For the price, it should be so much better.  The concept is wonderful! And I always have a good time when I go, but the food is only so-so, often cold by the time it gets to my seat, the service is hit or miss, depending on what time and day it is, and it is impossible to get someone on the phone when calling in. Make sure to get reservations a week or so in advance for weekend shows.  Food: I have gotten the tenderloin tips a few times, and sometimes they are good, and sometimes they are too salty and the meat is poor quality. The broccoli is delicious though! When I got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken, noodles were clumped together and the sauce was lacking something.  Very bland.  Anything fried comes out cold, including fish or fries.  Salads are okay, heavy on the sauce though.  Popcorn is unlimited, but when they are busy it takes a long time to get refills.  Same with soda.  On a particular day, I had bought tickets ahead of time, and needed to change them. I got stuck in this awful loop of automated voices kicking me back and forth from their store to the 800 number over, and over, and over again. It was awful.  I spent 20 mins trying to find some sort of corporate number or something and eventually gave up.  Eventually i found a number for corporate, and they informed me that they don't really have the man power to have someone assigned to the phones at the stores. When I am paying $50 for a movie and dinner for one person, they should have the funds for this.  On a particular night where my food didn't come, then it was wrong, and the staff was unsympathetic to my plight, I decided I was done with the theatre.  Then they sent me a survey asking how they did. I filled it out honestly. I received an email with a phone number to the store's manager, so I called.  Guess who answered? That same automated bs loop! I was pissed.  So I wrote Mr. Garcia (the manager handling this) and told him exactly what I thought and that I couldn't call to give him the feedback he wanted.  When he called me back a week later, he seemed stoned or lazy or something. He was passive and unprofessional.  He said he sent me passes for a free show and I never received them.  That was 2 months ago.  So, in conclusion, I do not go here any more.

I really had a bad experience at this location tonight, not only I am not satisfied with the slow service where my popcorn and Coke took half an hour to get to us and worst part is I got charged for the order(cheesecake) I didn't even eat at all after waiting for another half an hour to get our refill for popcorn and Coke and we waited for another 10 minutes for the check this is pretty unacceptable as I am regular customer to this location and what make more worst is that I didn't get $5 off my Tuesday tickets where I had my stub premier card with me and I didn't get the discount and front desk told me to call the ticketing services because they have nothing to do with it which makes me more angry and upset for this bad service tonight on top of that I had a shitty day which is why I Wanna relax and watch movie tonight and it just adds up to my bad day.

As a movie theater, 5-stars. The service is excellent (in Cinema Suites, in Fork & Screen not really). The seats are amazing in Cinema Suites. I also LOVE the assigned seating aspect.  The food is ok... sweets and milkshakes and candy stuff is much better than normal food. The chicken fingers I had, or wings or whatever, were kinda gross.  I also love the "age limit" of the theater. If your under 18, you HAVE to be accompanied by an adult. Makes for a much quieter and enjoyable experience.  I also love that there is a FULL bar up front. Beer and a movie - can't pass it up.

Great atmosphere and customer service. The bartenders are awesome and made my husband and I few really good cocktails while we waited to go in the theater. However, the food is pretty mediocre. Overall, I had a pleasant experience and would return.

We had fun and the food was good. Sat at the very top most of the seats are well positioned. Do not chose any spot near the stairs as the view is blocked be stair rail. Also to much foot traffic is this area

Great movie house!!  I love my movies and nothing is better than being able to lay back in the CINEMA SUITES ordering dinner while you watch a good movie. The service was solid. All servers have always been really helpful and polite.   The food options on the menu remind me of and Applebee's menu. Try the fire burger! Also the parm fries are solid!   The only downside is when the bill comes. Usually they bring the bill towards the middle end of the movie which is kind of awkward because usually by that time something important is happening in the movie. Other than that its a great place to take a date!

What a wonderful idea to get food and drinks while I watch a movie. If you have not been here then you have to go at least once. I went and watched the hunger games catching fire. The waiter was excellent in getting me what I wanted and didn't bug me through the whole movie, just the boring parts. :)   The chairs were comfortable and roomy. I got to choose where I sat. The place was very clean and inviting. Great place to take a date.

Now that I have experienced the AMC Dine-in Theatre, movie going will never be the same!  I recently saw Gravity 3D in a Cinema Suite, and can say it will be hard to go back to a 'regular' theater:   - Cinema Suites are 21 and over - no little kids talking, crying or kicking my seat!   - Assigned seats - huge, comfortable reclining chairs even more cushy than my living room furniture.     - Full drink menu - gleefully drinking beer, I felt almost like we were breaking some sort of rule.  Perhaps it was flashbacks to sneaking drinks in to the movies long ago?  :)   - Food choices - while not the most extensive or fancy menu, it was pretty cool to have Mac n Cheese at a movie.  And it was Good!  The Bistro Mac n Cheese was a generous portion of cheesy pasta with topped with nicely seasoned chicken breast.   So large I couldn't finish it (and I certainly tried!).  Yes, it costs more than a typical movie theater, but it is so very worth it!

I love how this theatre is close to everything, but you can always find a parking spot and the theatre is never crowded. I just wish they (and all other movie theatres) would show movies at 8pm instead of 7 and 9.

I like coming here for the alcohol and movie experience.  The seats are comfortable, but the dining while watching can be a bit distracting.   I suggest sticking with basics when it comes to the food. They make a decent quesadilla, but it's pretty hard to mess one up. Avoid the shrimp!  If you like strong mixed drinks then this is the place to go, otherwise stick with beer.   And, if you have superman ears, try to avoid listening in on server and bartender conversations.  I overheard a couple racial comments and it got me heated.  Those kinds of conversation shouldn't take place anywhere around where customers can hear.

We went to see Pete's Dragon today.  As far as the movie itself goes, it was great.  The sound is great as well as the picture.  The rest of the experience, however, was not good.  Our seats, trays, and armrests were sticky and dirty.  The cupholders still had trash stuffed in them.  The armrests are worn out and showing the inside cushioning which is very uncomfortable.  We got there hungry so we (myself, husband and 2 kids) ordered food.  It took a long time to get it, and it was cold when it finally arrived.  My husband specifically asked for sauce on the side for his tots and it came with sauce on it anyway.  I ordered the nachos and they were cold and soggy.  Even my Coke was not good.  My kids got the macaroni and cheese and it was cold and congealed.  My husband and I went to a movie a week ago and ordered the pretzels and cheese, and the cheese was cold and congealed (gross).   We love that we can come and have our seats reserved, but lately it hasn't been a great experience.  This is not the first time the food and service has been bad but this time compelled me to finally write a review in hopes of getting this venue back to its glory days when it first opened and was soooooo nice.  In the meantime we will be looking elsewhere for our movies.

Sadly not the best experience. Weird situation with parking and no signs really directing you where to go. The escalator was broken and along with another couple we found the elevator and made our way to the theater. I love AMC especially the reclining chairs but we were in that dine in regular theater. Food was horrible!  Tasted like it all came from expired can. Hubby had gourmet Mac and cheese and I had potato skins. How can you mess that up. Wait Service soooo slow even blocked the screen ahead of us with taking orders. Popcorn bucket probably only good thing except later my stomach hated that too. Expensive movie date. Think I will stick with my favorite AMC and ditch this one.

This was my go to theather when I lived in Phoenix and I was up in the area Saturday so decided to go to a movie.  I was so disappointed, I was in #14, and the chairs hardly rock and I tried several in my row since they were not taken and they were either broken or all torn up. I use to tell all my friends and family how I love going to this movie theather, but I WILL NOT RECOMMEND IT ANYMORE.  Even as I left I heard other people complain.  I tried not to give this place any stars but it would not let me continue without leaving at least one star. NO STARS FOR THIS THEATER.

First trip to a movie theater in more than 5 years and my first to a dine-in, which we enjoyed once we FOUND it within the Esplanade complex.  Lobby was clean and attractive.  The entire complex as well as the theater in which we watched The Last Jedi was nearly empty for a 9:45 showing on a Sunday night, but appeared clean.  All interactions with staff as well as movie sight and sound was more than satisfactory.     We ordered popcorn ($9), 2 iced teas, and a brownie sundae to split, totaling roughly $30.  This was was delivered to our very comfortable seats in a reasonable time by a polite young server.    Men's room was decently attractive and reasonably clean, with minor qualm that on such a slow night, seems like someone might have picked up the paper towels overflowing the trash bins somewhere in the two hours between my initial visit and after the movie.   Overall, a pleasant, satisfactory experience.
Great way to see a movie,awesome recliners and great service  ,drinks and dinner should be more of these theaters around!!!!!!!

Super busy today (Mother's Day...go figure). Took a while for my server to take my order.  Chose the breadstick sampler (2 soft breadsticks and 6 pizzetta strips with queso blanco and marinara which I switch for alfredo sauce).  Got 4 sticks and no pizzetta.  Turns out--no pizzetta.  Ended up just keeping the breadsticks because my movie had already started and I was hungry.  Ordered a frozen strawberry margarita (these are so good!), but got it on the rocks.  Sent back.  Took about 25 minutes to get the drink, which was ordered before the food.  Again, I get that it was busy for a Sunday night.  But a little heads-up from the kitchen to the wait-staff about the pizzetta would have been helpful.  It's also nice to get your drink BEFORE the food when you have to drive.  Still love it here, but I'll be extra-cautious about when I go.

This was an amazing experience. I want to see Central Intelligence with my father and grandmother. There was a valet parking which made it easy and an escalator up to the AMC theater. There was a lot of Lounge area seating which was comfortable for the wait. The seats themselves were just ok but there was a button you could press under a light that called a person to your seat so that you can order whatever you would like off of the menu provided. The menu is superb what the prices are ridiculously expensive both for the food and the tickets. other than that great experience.

I've had a great experience everytime I've gone here. I just got done reading some bad reviews for this place and want to say that people should get over themselves. I have had food most of the time I have gone and out of about 8 things I have ordered 6 of them were great and two of them were ok or not good.  so.. I think that is a pretty good average for a theatre.  It's nice to have the option of dining and I don't expect the service to be like that of a normal restaurant because i'm there for the movie.  duh so for the whole experience it's absolutely great.  try it everyone and get the burger or the vege plate, it's awesome.  you can't beat an entire burger meal for ten bucks and you can have a cocktail with it as well.  very cool and I'm glad your here, and....if you want the server to kiss your feet, go to a restaurant and pay a hundred bucks for dinner and you'll probably get that, but.. you won't get an awesome movie experience either.  wise up people and stop being so critical, you obviously have never worked in the service business before and if you have...shame on you.

I have been sitting at the bar for 30 mins now and no one has asked me if I wanted anything!! The worst part is I've been staring at every bar tender as they walk by and they still do not acknowledge me! This is $$$ walking away and left a salty taste with the AMC experience. There's a gal with bleached white hair, an African guy with Afro spikes and a third guy....and not one "hello"

Will never go back here. We went the first time yesterday and were so disappointed. We pushed our button for service and they never came. My husband went to see what the hold up was and he was told they don't start taking orders until the movie starts. I guess yelling over the previews is more convenient to them. Finally we were able to put our orders of pretzel bites in. We were the first to order and last to receive our order. When we got the bites they were cold. My husband took them back to the server and he said "that's how they come". Really?? Who ever serves pretzel bites cold? Could it be that they just sat there for 20 minutes before he finally decided to bring it out to us?

This theater pretends to be high class yet is subpar. My family and I went there to watch a matinee 3-D movie. The food was average yet the screen did not work &  we did not get to see the movie that we paid to see. In all fairness, they gave us passes to a future film but I can't help but feeling I wasted my time in driving to this theater to watch a movie. Kinda weird to eat lunch in a dark theater without a movie playing.

My all time favorite thing to do lately... make sure you go to a movie in the cinema suites where there are leather lazy -boy recliners, full food and beverage service, and you can call the waiter with the push of a button. I have been here probably 15 times and always had a great experience!
$$$. Would suggest eating before a movie, it's on the expensive side. Lovely place though. The staff is friendly and helpful, comfortable seating and quality movies. I will be back!

My friends and I loved it! Sooo over the top from the moist towellette, free mint, free refills, comfy seats with footrests and super helpful servers. Our only mistake was eating dinner before the movie --PLEASE whatever you do--go with an empty stomach or at least be ready to eat dessert to get the full experience!

This place is awesome. Comfy chairs (although they don't recline :(...), full bar, reasonable tickets ($8.75 for matinee), reservable seats, and BEST OF ALL waiter service! Oh yeah, they come around to your seat before the show and multiple times during to see if you want another beer or some more popcorn and then present you with a bill at the end of the show. For me, this is the place to watch movies in Phoenix.

the first time i was there service as great, but as the second and third time came the service and staff was poor, the manager and staff just stood there joking and messing around with no intention of asking us if we need any help. The waiter was great food is good but lobby customer service is not all that great younger spike hair manager is kinda rude too.

Oh I love this movie theater so much. I just wish it was closer to my house. Whenever I have guests come from out of town, I take them here. I do not tell them why we are driving 45 minutes, and look at their faces when we get to the theater. They are always awestruck! I have always had wonderful experiences here. Its fabulous. You need to check out the 21+ suites at least once in your life. It will ruin regular movie theaters though! Once you have this luxury, you cannot go back easily.  I love being able to have a drink beforehand. it can be pretty expensive but it is all about the experience. Having a few cocktails before and during the movie just make it more fun.  I always order food. It is not the best food around, but again it is about the experience. I love reclining like a queen, and having them serve me food and drink with just a push of a button. I had the thai bang shrimp tacos, I dont recommend them, they were a little chewy. Their pizzettas are really good though. I also like the queso blanco dip, but it can be a little small if you are sharing. My dad said the prime rib sandwich was very tasty.  Make sure you make a reservation in advance using fandango so you can pick out your seats. The cinema suites can get packed fast, especially if it is a big movie.   This would have been 5 stars, but they took some of the perks away and it made me sad. If I never had the perks before, I would not have known, but I feel a little jipped every time I leave with out my hand towel, mint, and free sample popcorn. Please give me back my perks!
I love the place best place for a date and to relax and watch a movie

This place has a great setup and location but the service has suffered since opening.  The last 3 times I have gone there have been issues with my bill and our seats have not been clean.  The need more of a presence from management with the young staff.  I will no longer eat when seeing movies here because the food has really declined.  Feels like the inmates are running the asylum.

I went here a few weeks ago and after reading some reviews i was both excited and nervous about going.   Excited because the idea of comfy seats, food, and NO kids sounds amazing!!! (And it was!) Worried about the server walking around during the film.   As it turned out my experience was great! So awesome to watch a movie in giant lazy boy chairs and eat something other than popcorn. The servers did a good job to only sneak by when a customer paged them. (However, if you are going to see a movie you can't miss a minute of .... maybe don't go to this theater.) Otherwise very enjoyable.   The food itself is pretty average, but at least not overpriced.   I would definitely come back again!   PS. Reserve seats in advance!!!!!!!!!!

The service was extremely slow,  took about 10-15 minutes to get a drink.  Should of gone to the bar,  when I got my drink it was all ice...  Food,  well I've had better.  We started with wings,  no flavor,  straight from the freezer to the deep fryer.     I had the chicken chipotle sandwich,  recommended by the waitress,  it was only partially filled and the dipping sauce was way tooo spicy,  and I like heat.  The bread or Pita it was served on was really dry.  Wasn't anything special,  and wouldn't order again.  My date had the chicken bowl,  she ate about a third of it.  That speaks volumes.    I would not eat there again.  Don't waste your time and hard earned money on mediocre food.  Maybe a beer would be the best bet.    Come on AMC,  you can do better than this.

Ok so lets start this off the right way by saying I was there for the Twilight Breaking Dawn Premier ... you think lot of teen girls screaming there heads off to see the film.  Nope ... 18+ for the whole theater when I walked in and had a seat in one of the lobby chairs I was properly greeted and offered a drink.  Wow that is great! I could even get a ADULT beverage ;) I like.  So I showed up about an hour early just not knowing what to expect and was informed by a greeter that we could go into the theater about thirty minutes early.  We get in the theater and where greeted with a smile by our waitress who took all are information and order and got us drinks with unlimited refills, get that large popcorn get unlimited free refills.  This is great now sure the tickets cost about $10.00 a person, Drinks are about 3.59 But unlimited refills.  Overall I had a great experience and look forward to being back again soon :)
It's hard to go back to a regular theater after this! Just for an additional $2 per ticket you can enjoy Cinema Suites(over 21 only). Drinks, food, extremely comfortable and great customer service.

Went to a show a morning show and was only  $5. Seats were large and comfortable.  It was nice to he able to pick your seat ahead of time and come when you want instead of arriving early to get a good seat.  Service was good. Drink was $5 and  burger was $12. Still not too bad for getting to sit and have them bring it to you. Downside is that both the escalators are broken and only one elevator was working. I didn't mind the exercise, but it was three flights of steps to get to the entrance.

Love coming here. Eating while watching a movie is a brilliant idea. Food selection is okay, wish they had more vegan or vegetarian items. Also I don't like the fact that the drinks and popcorn sizes are all one size. I'd love to see all sizes available here just like at a regular AMC. Other than that, servers are nice and good is tasty. This time I got popcorn only and a glass of water. Popcorn was well made.

WTF..."Sorry, we're outta butter."  No butter for movie popcorn?!? That's like McDonalds running out of fries. Note, this is Thursday, not the end of a weekend. Did I mention slow service?  Oh, and the ticket kiosks were either frozen or out of paper. This theater has gone downhill for many reasons - going back to Harkins.  As a follow-up after the movie:  Paid cash for drinks  and the "server" didn't bring all of my change back.   Not even mentioning the filthy restrooms. This was all late-morning BTW.

Living in Austin Texas, i am very familiar with the dining movie experience (Alamo Drafthouse).   So while my wife were in Phoenix on vacation, we decided to see two movies (01/19/2013).   the chair were very comfortable, and the call button is a good idea (just not well executed - more on that later).  I like the idea that you can reserve your seats, and the fold out "tables" worked very well.  I don't know how exactly this thing is ran, but my educated guess is that each server has a section in several different screens at the same theater all at the same time.  So it is sort of round robin when you will be helped, as the server has other screens they need to attend to.  I also don't know how the server is alerted when I hit the call button, but the response times were different in my two experiences.  In my early movie (11:30 am on a Saturday) our server was Jackson (at least that is what our receipt said, I thought his name was Nick, but he was a tall/slender black male - great server) and he generally arrived within 5 minutes.  (He was also very on top of it as a server).  Jackson delivered the bill with about an hour left in the movie.  To me, that is really early.  I would have almost rather given him my credit card up front, so that my service could have lasted longer (which by the way - means more sales of booze and food for AMC and Jackson).  Getting my bill an hour before the movie ended probably lost AMC ~$15 in extra sales.  When it came time to deliver the bill, Jackson had them all organized and just walked up the stairs and handed everyone their bill - he knew who's bill was who's before he walked up the stairs.  During the evening show that we attended (8:30 pm same day) we had the B-team server: Nick (at least that is what his nametag said - the bill said Graham - which is odd because I wasn't served by a Graham.  Either way, a tall white guy with a Justin Bieber looking haircut).  Nick struggled from the get go.  He was either having a rough day or isn't meant to be a server.  I ordered a beer and some food, and my wife started off with a water.  he asked if we wanted waters for both of us - I said sure.  The food came first (Weird!!!!) then the beer.  Waters never made it.  Nick was a no show, so we asked the runners, who somehow/someway got the message to Nick.  her water (not mine) showed up 30 minutes after we asked for them.  Later she ordered an entree, and it came fine.  After that I ordered another beer and a dessert.  the beer came - not the dessert. Oh yea, it took Nick ~25 minutes after I hit the call button to come answer it.  I almost turned it off... and wish that I did because 10 minutes after that my beer came.  So 35 minutes after I wanted a beer it was delivered to me - I'm sure AMC can do better. Nick came by to hand me the bill and I said that the dessert never came and I wanted to make sure it wasn't on the bill.  he hit himself on the front of his head a la Homer Simpson and said he screwed up and that it wasn't on our bill.  Also, Nick was not organized with his bills - he was in the aisle way sorting out the bills as he was walking up the stairs - disconcerting to the movie goers.    I'm sure AMC has studied this at length, so they can shoot holes through my theory, but why don't they have 1 or 2 servers take care of just one screen at a time?  It seems like the response time would be much faster (thus you sell more food).  Maybe it isn't fair to the servers or something, but who cares - isn't your guests' experience priority #1?  In general we enjoyed our experience.  the food is good, if not slightly overpriced.  I thought that the beer prices were reasonable, and free refills on soda and popcorn is A-OK with me.   if they could step up the service they would have a real winner. I also enjoyed that we could reserve our seats ahead of time - very cool.

This location has good service,  and the theaters are really comfy - if you go for cinema suites. The fork and screen theaters are too packed in,  and it's really not more comfortable than a regular theater. The only benefit is the food menu. You can't get burgers and cocktails at the regular theater!  Perhaps the only downsides are the limited availability of cinema suites showings, and the lack of vegetarian options on the menu.

On Cinema Suites*: If you are of age with no children or in a group full of adults, do yourself a favor and upgrade. Five stars for this experience.  With no children, you can eat comfortably and get engrossed in the movie without the unexpected jolt of a baby crying or a parent snapping at a kid to be quiet.   The smaller and more intimate setting with fewer seats and better chairs translates to comfort. I loved the fact that you can recline with your feet up and still use the large tray. To those who complain of not being able to eat when reclined, this isn't Rome. Sit up when you eat, and lay back when you're done. It's good for your digestion.  *Fork and Screen and Cinema Suites are separated by a wide, wide ocean of class, ambiance, and comfort. This review completely ignores Fork and Screen because of how bad it is.

So, for $16.50, you can get an oversized, leather reclining chair w/a side table and swivel tray over your lap, and fab view of the picture? I think it's money well spent. It's like flying first class - once you've got a taste of it, it's hard to go back to Coach. I felt like a true baller, I really did.  I do, however, wish AMC would consider bumping their OVERLY inflated meal/drink prices. I paid $4.50 for a Coke Zero? That hurt, it did. I didn't eat any food, but my friend's fries smelled heavenly.  Oh, and I wld also suggest better signage for parking. I got lost/trapped when parking at Gallagher Kennedy. I shrugged this off and found my way to AMC parking, but hit 2 dead ends in the garage by their loading dock. But, maybe that's just me.

Refused to serve my 68 year old client a beer because he left his id at home.  Sometimes rules are kinda silly. We won't ever come back.  Silly since this is a nice place with good food. Servers are just filling rules from idiots I guess.

No surprise to see a coke be over $5 but wasn't expecting there to be no refills. Movie and food was fine and all. I sat down towards the back and there was still trash on my seat and in my cup holder. I'll give it to the cleaning crew that they "missed" one chair...other people in the back were throwing some kind of candy at people below for being on the cell phone. Typical baggage that you would see in theaters. I wouldn't go back to this one because after paying $9 for a matinee and $17 for one meal, I would expect better behavior from the people in there. Guess I was wrong.   The crew working was as friendly and quick as they could be but they had almost no control over the actions of those others in the theatre. For dine in, the only distraction I would expect would be waiters talking to patrons about simple orders... Far opposite.

The first few times we came here, it was great. Unfortunately that has changed. The menu is smaller, the service is less than subpar and they raised the menu prices.  This is the second time we have been here when they have not brought my order but managed to bring everyone else's. My kids got three refills but the server didn't come back to me once. Additionally, my son ordered his burger without a bun because he can't have gluten and, of course, they brought it on a bun. Just one thing after another and their solution is one return pass. Yeah, not coming back so...keep it.

I had been to this theater many times before it converted to the dine-in style. We just returned from our first time since the conversion and we had a pleasant experience. Normally I would not make the drive to Esplanade since I now live in Tempe, but they had a March special for buy one get one free admission to any show. Getting a ticket was a slow process since they only had two people working and the lines were long. They do have ticket machines you can use, but I had to redeem the coupon I had so needed to wait in line. I loved that we could choose our seats before going into the theater.   Once we were seated, we ordered some drinks and the Breadstick Sampler appetizer from the specials menu. The two types of breadsticks were very good, some large soft pretzel sticks, and then some cheesy garlic breadsticks. They came with sides of queso and marinara sauce. I think I would stick with finger foods like this if I visited again. They should make the Breadstick Sampler a permanent menu item, I would have it again! Downside to eating in the dark - I was very tense trying to maneuver and make sure I didn't get any sauces on me or spill my drink.   The seats were comfy and I like that you have the option to swivel the tray table over your lap or leave it to the side. Service was very attentive. As we were leaving we filled out a short survey about our experience and they gave us each a $10 appetizer voucher. I imagine we will be back to use that at some point. Otherwise like I said it is too far from Tempe, but if AMC added a dine-in location in Tempe or Mesa or Chandler, I would gladly frequent it!

I wasn't very impressed with it at all.  All the renovations are nice, and it was nice to be able to sit and have a beer while I watched the movie but everything else sucked.  The service sucked.  The food sucked. The as to the service, they take your order on a little ipad sort of thing, each person is assigned a seat number...I don't believe they actually record the seat down as the waitress continually brought everything to me. other peoples food and drinks...and checks! Ugh. ALSO she brought my 15 year old cousin a BEER! WTF! We all received our food at the same time, except for my husband...he had ordered a burger and for some reason it took a good 15 minutes to arrive.  Drink service was quick.  The food itself was sub-par. I got chicken tenders. They did not have the taste or texture of chicken. they were really weird.   I would say save your money and don't order dinner here. We will be back, but will only do drinks and light snacks.
This theater is the best! Great seating and good food. Great place to take a date or a good friend from out of town. Service is extremely friendly.

While in Phoenix visiting my brother, we decided to see Pitch Perfect 2 at this theater. We got tickets for the theater with the reclining seats, and it was awesome! The seats reclined and the footrest came up, and the seats were incredibly comfortable! We also decided to eat while at the theater and we each ordered chicken fingers and French fries, which were SO good. We were so happy with our experience at this theater and I would love to come back to this theater again!

We grabbed a movie here recently. Liked the valet parking. Nice food selection and we tried the Sushi roll and I believe the Chicken Strips. Both were good. Server was fast and overall a fun way to spend a couple hours.

I have to say I was really impressed by this theatre's food.  I ordered the avocado chicken.  The chicken was salty but well cooked.  The fries that came with it were really good too!  What was even more amazing was the chocolate brownie milk shake! Awesome brownie and chocolate.

This is absolutely my favorite place to watch a movie.  The comfy Lazy Boy like recliners are awesome!  The menu selection and food is great.  I love the service as well.  If you have never been, you will absolutely love it and return again and again.

This place has really gone downhill. It's so sad because it was my little treat to myself to be pampered with drinks and food while I enjoyed a quality movie. I came here last night and there were about 6 or 7 very awkward and impersonal employees behind the bar. My girl and I opened a tab and we're just hanging out until our movie started and at least 4 people in a row asked us if we wanted to close our tab. After telling 3 previous employees we wanted to keep our tab open, we finally decided on the 4th ask to close out. How annoying! Do you not understand the concept of an open tab? Everyone here looks frumpy and ungroomed. The whole staff needs a shower and a haircut. I also noticed the crowd is now a bunch of scummy looking people.   Now for the food: $8 for 5 boneless chicken bites. Ru fucking kidding me?  The theater: giant dividers between each row made it very difficult for me to see the screen.   In theater wait staff: Slow and incompetent.   We purchased tickets online for the 2d version of Star Wars and of course we show up and they tell us it's 3D. We were offered a refund but we had waited long enough to see the movie.   Conclusion: This theater is no longer worth the amount of money they charge. The wait staff is unpleasant and boring, you are no longer treated as high class to match the ticket price, crowd is a bunch of skanks.

I'm not a huge movie goer and much less to fancy places seeing how I'm from Idaho, so this place was freaking awesome for me and like nothing I've ever experienced.   It's definitely not cheap, but I was pretty dang impressed with the food. I had the Mediterranean Mac and it was huge and a couldn't finish it but it was super good, and my wife had the appetizer sampler and everything on that was really good. So all in all the food was surprisingly really good.   The seats were amazing. Suuuuuper comfy and they recline mechanically. There was also so much space and didn't feel at all crammed like most other movie theaters. The only real problem I had was I couldn't really see the bottom of the screen. I don't know if it was just the row we were sitting in that made it hard to see the bottom of the screen but it sucked. I had to really sit up to see the bottom. But other than that it was amazing!

We decided we would watch Wonder Woman at this location.  I'm pretty sure this location is new so they still have some kinks to work out.  If you don't know where you're going, it can be quite confusing.  The parking garage we chose because the sign said it was for AMC was a bit of a walk and a confusing one at that.  I would have preferred that they had a sign leading us to the garage that is actually right beneath the theatre.  When we finally figured out how to get to the entrance, the escalator going up was closed and suggested taking the elevator.  Well, the elevator was not in service either so we ended up taking the stairs.  Luckily, I'm in shape and it was no big deal but what if I wasn't?  Once we finally got to the top, we did notice that there was another escalator and elevator on the opposite side, which would have been nice to know.  However, again, there was no signage letting us know this.  Such an ordeal just to get to the entrance of the theatre.  Once inside, the first thing you notice is the huge bar where a snack stand would normally be.  But there's no snack stand.  Anything you want to order is done through your server inside the theatre, including soda and popcorn, which also means you must now tip said server.  The theatre was nice but no reclining seats.  You do get a swing table that you can use to eat on as well as a call button for your server.    Overall, a very nice theatre and great for a date night.  However, I feel that some of the other theatres that fall into this category are a better fit for me.  Not determined to return anytime soon.
Went for a midnight showing... no waiting in line, comfortable seats, it was a great experience. Cinema suites is the way to go!

The waitress sneaks up on you and scares the crap out of you if you arent paying attention. They are ninjas here, or something.   Besides being served food here, its a typical theatre. Nice big chairs which are comfortable to sit in an enjoy.  I wish the lights next to each seat would turn off because it gets annoying that they stay on during the movie. I like it more dark.  We only went because we had an AMC gift card and this is the closest to us. Otherwise if you dont plan on ordering over priced and visually un-appetizing food, go to another theatre

My husband and I have been here numerous times. The location is decent - I like that the Biltmore/Union shopping center is right across the street. Plus, Fuego Tacos is down below and tasty. However, there isn't much else in this plaza. A few places to eat, but whenever we visit, everything seems dead. While the parking lot can get pretty full, there's never anyone walking around. It's like a ghost town!  My husband and I used to come here more frequently, but when they closed to upgrade to the dining experience, we realized the Desert Ridge location is much closer to us. (We found out they were renovating the hard way. We stopped by one afternoon to find the AMC closed and none of the restaurants were open yet. Again, total ghost town!) Needless to say, we haven't tried the new dining experience but it's on our list. Once we try the new dining experience, look for an updated review!
Food is pricey but reserving your seats is great! Not to mention if you're on a date you can go in to the screening for 21 and older and don't have to deal with children crying.

This dine-in movie experience is very cool. Make sure you book your movie to the right type of theater, so you can get the best experience possible. There is a full bar and restaurant that is catered to you in the theater, so that you can kick back, relax, and enjoy your movie while eating dinner. Totally fun and super relaxing! :)

Since they made these theatres "AMC Dine-In" theatres, it's my favorite place in the Phoenix area to see a movie. It's nice, upscale and you pick your own seats.  The stadium theatres are the way to go. They're large, with huge, motorized reclining seats and walls in front of you and behind you. You can't see anyone behind you or in front of you, and you can't really see or hear anyone in your row, save for the person/people next to you. You get a dedicated server who will bring you anything from a soda to movie candy to spinach dip. There is also a full bar, so that's a plus. I haven't had a full meal there, but I've had a dessert (which was good), and service is attentive while being surprisingly unobtrusive.   The smaller theatres are still good, just not as secluded. I absolutely hate hearing people talk during movies, and I don't like children in the theatre, so the larger spaces are my favorite, since you can't really see/hear anyone and you have to be 21+ to see a movie in the stadium areas.   It's not as swanky as iPic, which feels like a nightclub in Vegas, but it's much cheaper ($12 per ticket for smaller theatres, $15 for stadium), and you get the wait staff here as well.  Totally recommend, I know I'll be back soon.

Five Rivers went to go see the Black Panther my husband ordered fish and chips my grandson ordered fish and chips I have fish and chips one had a hamburger and I don't remember what the 5th one had. Before we left the movie my stomach started feeling tight and strange we got home about 10 I went outside to smoke a cigarette man I threw up like The Exorcist .  And that was in February I still have the tickets in my phone the fish was cold I thought it might be a little cold from the delivery but I'm thinking that it was not to the temperature. That morning my 10:00 grandson had to fish he got sick he was sick all through the day. My first experience I was excited because it was a dine-in theater but

Went to watch Jungle Book and although we enjoyed the movie a lot, the service was not that great! Very disappointing!   We put our order in first thing when we were seated, all I ordered was the sushi roll and an icee to drink. While my sushi roll came out quickly, I had to press the red button to remind them of my icee.  When the waiter came, he said you still haven't gotten it? Uh... no! He seem frustrated and said he will get it. By the time I received my icee I had already finished my roll!  The food is good, the seats were torn and needs to be replaced. It has the potential to be better with the service!   I would recommend choosing the smaller theater since the bigger theatre seems overwhelming to the wait staff and you would be waiting a while! Also, with the smaller theater the leg room is bigger and more comfortable!

The dine in theater is an intriguing idea. Unfortunately, here it is so poorly executed, with food below fast food par, but at upscale cost. Seating is hit or miss in terms of the better auditoriums showing the various films. Essentially, you eat in the dark, not seeing how the food is actually prepared & presented. Service is also hit or miss with a bias towards misses. It's a bit more than the cost of a regular movie, but for recent releases, which have the better auditoriums, it can be nice, so long as you steer away from anything but French fries, that are more like Jack In The Box. Though you can get some alcoholic drinks, is it really worth it with places like Merc Bar downstairs from the theater? Dont forget to allow for tipping if youre dining here. All this doesn't touch on the horrible parking situation at this location.GET YOUR PARKING TICKET VALIDATED!!!!  In summary, if you want to see a popular 1st run show upon its release, and can do without the food service experience, it can be nice. Otherwise, avoid it like the plague!  Enjoy :)
Got here and every movie is sold out even if seats available.  Make sure to choose your seats or you end up in the front row!!!  Favorite theatre but sucks last two times.

I was excited to hear that there was a place like this after Farelli's closed. The seating was a bit confusing at first to know what to pick from never being there before. But once we got in and seated we fell in love with the huge cushion recliners. The drinks were fine but a bit pricey. I ordered a type of nacho and it was really good but greasy and hard to find the jalpenos in the dark. My husband had the parm fries and they were awesome! I wsih there was one of these on the west side because I would totally be frequenting it more!

I like this theatre a lot because of its location, the warm, reclining seats, and they generally play a mixture of indie and mainstream films. I've ordered food on a few occasions. The servers are pretty quick and the food came out fast considering a lot of people tend to order food during the night showings (which is when I like to go watch movies). I hate kids, so the best part is people don't drag their noisy brats into this theatre at night just because it's kinda physically demanding to get to (you walk up a few flights of stairs). Thank you for keeping the brats and their annoying, self-entitled parents away!!!

my wife and i really like the value proposition ooutIf dinner and a movie in one, and a comfy recliner to eat in.  its way cheaper than the Ipic, and the food is pretty good without being too much.  if the movie isn't any good, just have a few mojitos and you'll feel better about it.  my one gripe in case management is reading this:  they need to clean the menus more often.  They're sticky.  Edited on 08/01/2016 because I would have thought they could improve on theater cleanliness by now, but instead of getting better it's gotten worse.  If clean restrooms and clean seats are important to you, go visit the ipic in North Scottsdale.  Wife and I were there on Saturday for star trek and spent $90 on dinner, drinks, and tickets.  Though the theater wasnt busy, every surface was covered in sticky goop.  They would never get away with this in a normal, well lit restaurant, and should feel lucky they haven't had corrective action from Maricopa county environmental services.  Definitely won't take the kids there.     Try the Bistro Mac n Cheese.

Came here tonight to go see "it comes at Night". Getting our tickets came with no problem. Downside, went in sat on our seat c3 and c4 and just happens that one of our recliner seats wasn't working. We tried every vacant spots and still wasn't working. Then we moved to a different row, our seating was working this time but this couple next to us wouldn't stop talking and phone kept ringing a handful of times. Decided to go at the top, now this time seat wasn't working again. There was a light that was on , and 20 minutes later got turned off. I've been here plenty of times and every single time I've been disappointed. Only good thing is that managers were apologetic and got our tickets refunded. I'd rather go to Ipic theaters , harkins or roadhouse cinema for a better dining experience.

Very disappointed with my past 2 visits to AMC Esplanade. I'm new to Phoenix and looking for a good place to see movies several times a month. The waiter did not bring my check to my seat and asked me to follow him to the lobby to process my check. Then on receiving my check, he charged me for food I didn't order. Then sent another waiter out of the kitchen for the correct bill. In the confusion between several waiters, my credit card was lost. After an unhelpful conversation with management my card was not found or returned. Another visit, the armrest on my seat was broken, no padding, just a hard metal bar between the seats. Even though this is the closest theater to me, I will not be returning and will gladly drive further for a better movie viewing experience.

It's close to me, so I go here, and usually it's pretty empty. You're always assured a seat in air conditioning! They've always got the top movie selections - but the reason why it's not my favorite theaters is the PARKING - oy! What a pain in the butt! You have to park in the retail/restaurant parking garage, walk in the outdoor mall that is the Esplanade, but then you have to remember to get your ticket validated. Once I went and forgot, then gave my ticket to the parking lot guy - he said that they can't take that as validation anymore - $15!!! On top of my movie purchases, it was unreasonable. They should really stress making sure you have your parking taken care of. Either that, or I'm going only with people who promise to remind me to get validation!

We ordered our food before the movie started and 25 mins before the movie was over STILL. NO. FOOD. We pressed the button so we could cancel, but no one came. After waiting a few minutes we walked out (not knowing there was only 20 mins left) and went to guest services to see if we would be able to get passes to come back and try again and explained what happened with our order. They did not believe us and went to check and make sure we didn't eat our food and the rude, loud guy (not a manager) was demanding that we pay our full bill. They said no passes bc there was only 15 mins. Definitely NOT worth it.

This was my first time here and I loved it! I liked that I could buy my tickets online and you could pick your own seat. I also loved the big comfy chairs. What's up with that light right behind the seats though? You can even dine in or buy drinks. What's not to love?  I'm new to this area so I really didn't know what to expect. I didn't know if they allow you to take snacks and drinks inside. i stopped and bought a soda at McDonald's and no one seemed to know if the theater allowed you yo bring drinks.  The parking sit. Is a bit tricky. First, I pulled into one driveway where I saw the valet sign. Nope! I'm not a baller today. I then preceded around back and parked in the theater parking lot. The only problem with the theater parking structure is that the elevators don't work, so you're instructed to take the stairs on the west side. I'm not from Phoenix so I have no  sense of direction here. I can't even see the sun so I can't determine East from West that way. Ugh! I just tried the next best thing and parked close to all the other cars. It was pretty empty Saturday morning. Hasn't everyone heard about the $6 early bird special???

This really is a nice theater. The seats are very roomy, it is set up very nicely for dining, and there are free refills for soda (even though a soda is about $4 haha). If you have never dined at a theater before, I would just suggest that you get there at least 15 minutes early to order your food (the servers are very good at working with you and explaining what to do). I would also suggest not to each a movie that requires a lot of focus as the servers and food certainly can distract you (I watched "The Duff" and it was just fine :)

I've Visited several dine in movie theaters recently. I've been impressed once so far unfortunately this is not one of them. It seemed rather average. It took a long time for the service to respond once the button was pushed.  Two of our meals required silverware which we didn't get that had the ring the bell button again and wait for those to arrive. We ordered for drinks one of them was a diet and our server couldn't figure out which one was which. The chicken in the southern fried crispy tenders was tough. There are better options.

First let me say the 3D movie was great and so were all of the employees. HOWEVER, the rating is tainted by the dinner. I had the beef bowl and that tasted ok or low quality; not the case, it was contaminated causing me a night of...illness. I tried to call the manager let them know so they could take steps for health safety. I got a recoding that asked if I'd like to speak to an associate press zero. I did so and then after many rings a recording came on and said "the system is unable to complete your call at this moment please call again later". So I thought I would just alert you all. ORDER DINNER AT YOUR OWN RISK.

leave it to corporate america to capitalize on a great idea (ipic) and roll it out, steamrolling everyone in the way...  --book your seat in advance using the website (fandango's mobile site integration not working at the time of this review) I LOVE LOVE LOVE knowing that my seat is MINE, and if it isn't available, i'll just have to look for another showing --choose from either the exclusive cinema suites (think first class airline seat, and then some), or the more standard and rowdy "fork and screen" --efficient and hardworking servers and food runners. --the concept is excellent, but with declining food quality, it could die off quickly. why would i pay $8 for a (cracked) plastic bowl of popcorn? goddamit!  #chicken wings gone south. they're the fatty and mushy "pump-me-full-of-antibiotics-while-i-stand-in-my-own-shit-while-the-steroids-grow-me-bigger-than-my-body-was-ever-going-to-grow-in-90-days-fee-lot-meat" SHIT "chicken" #that means they're cutting other corners too... yikes. #food often arrives "dead" cold. SEND IT BACK. #be careful to be specific when ordering; many items are similar and your server will assume. #effect of dining while you watch has literally put all the nearby restaurants out of business. the esplanade is a ghost town note to lessees: always put a clause in your contract that competitors in the same property must be approed by you!  HINT: push the service button between your seats as soon as you arrive, even if the server stops by to say he'll be right with you. the button starts a timer which sends an "all call" if someone doesn't reach you quickly.

Esplanade is quite possibly my favorite theatre.  I bought my tickets for a 5:30 Saturday showing of Iron Man 3 (opening weekend) on the Wednesday before. Their website was glitching during my purchase, so I called and an incredibly nice dude named Eric let me purchase my tickets over the phone. Thanks, Eric! Saturday evening came along, and we walked into the theatre at 5:20. Hey, my comfy seats are saved! No standing awkwardly at the front, searching for a spot. Just sit, order your beer, get me some mozzarella sticks, life is good. Halfway through the previews and you've already run out of your Stella Artois? No worries, Husband! Just press that button next to you and a server quickly comes by to grab your refill order. Who knew there'd be 10 previews. Didn't it used to be 4? Jeez, I'm starting to feel old.  I prefer the Cinema Suites, since they're 21 and over. No kids in the seats behind you kicking your chair for two hours because their parents are three rows higher, splitting a bottle of red and not giving a crap. I believe we've learned our lesson in the Fork and Screen....  and that lesson is to split a bottle of wine and not give a crap! HELLO, that's genius. And also get some seats in the Cinema Suites.   High five, AMC.

Great place to watch a movie, while the prices are generally higher it's worth the extra money.  Food is not the greatest but it's about what you would expect out of a movie theater.  The biggest complaint I have is that the chairs are to low and when you recline them back you miss a quarter to a half of the screen. This problem could easily be fixed by raising the seats or putting in a glass wall in front instead of it being solid

Decided to go watch the avengers movie here. Ordered a pitcher of beer, 20 mins later they give me a pitcher of beer......but no cups. I spent the next 30-45 mins pushing my button, asking 4 different people for two glasses. When i finally got 2 glasses, they were the coca cola plastic ones, not a chilled glasses that everyone else had. So we got to drink warm beer. I will never return to this place, cant even do something as simple as bring cups with a pitcher. Braindead....

Came to this location to see a movie with my husband. Bought tickets beforehand. Got a text with the ticket link. Once we got to the theater, we stood in 3 different lines. No one knew how to take the electronic tickets or how to print off paper tickets. We got inside the theater and ordered a chocolate shake. They brought us a Diet Coke. We sent it back and waited an hour before they brought the shake. At the end of the movie, they brought us a bill and then never came to collect payment. We went to the bar and told them what happened. No apologies were given. No acknowledgement of how bad they were at customer service. Don't waste your time or date night trying out this place.

So the movie was amazing but this theater is shit. I will never come back. Horrible experience and I'm super disappointed. Expensive and none of the food tasted very good and our service or lack of service was just insane. Seriously don't come here.  Not worth it at all. I'll stick with studio movie grill. It was my moms birthday they screwed up our order and then instead of just removing the item from our check they gave me a stupid coupon for 12$ off my next visit? What next visit? Seriously? We left both of our lights for service on FOREVER at one point and they never came back so we gave up and shut them off halfway through the film. Seats are too close together no leg room could hardly stand after the 2 hour movie I was in so much pain. Don't waste your money!

Very sad, disappointing night.  Just came back from seeing the showing of Grease -- 40th Anniversary showing.  1) the movie started but the background "elevator music" was still playing over the movie sound track from the movie.  2). After about 10 minutes into the movie, they restarted the movie thank God.  3). Food and beverage service was mediocre at best.  4). My friend received an order of pretzel bites he did not order......did not receive the order he placed.......until we pressed the call button 3 times.   Finally got that, but his chicken tenders were cold and dry!! 5) I never received a final beverage order, with 30 minutes left, but was still charged for it.   6)  Did not even receive my bill at the end,  even though I gave the server my debit card when I first sat down and ordered.  Had to track down the manager to actually get my bill to sign for it.  Basically,  not sure if I'd ever go back,  not even to use the free pass they handed out at the beginning of the show due to the screwup.  Just really bad service overall and a less than wonderful experience!

This place like other AMC is going down hill fast.  Just 2 yrs ago I would have given 4-5 stars.  Seats are Falling apart.   Cracks in leather.   Last time I went the armrest was missing.   I know this place gets a lot of business and I would think profitable.  However if they don't maintain it I will stop going soon.

A good concept to keep what was a dyeing movie theater alive.  The big comfortable reserved seats and no one under 18 without supervision policy make for a nicer viewing experience.  You can see movies in a suite cinema for $3 more, the only point I see in spending more money for a nicer seat is knowing you're in a theater where everyone is over 21.  Not worth it to me.  The full bar in the spot that used to be a concession stand is a nice touch.  The food is reasonably priced, but not all that good.  The burger I had was probably on par with something from a cliche american chain restaurant.  Decent, but nothing special.  You can get much better food across the street for similar prices.  I also found it a little difficult to eat my meal.  The big reclining leather seats are nice for movie viewing, but I did not enjoy leaning forward to take a bite and not worry about spilling all over myself.  The staff did a nice job of trying to stay transparent during the movie.  You have to press the button for service, but the waiter did quietly ask if I needed anything else when he bused away my empty tray, and dropped off the check.  And to make things better, when the credits started rolling he advised audience members who were getting up to leave to stay until the end because there was a stinger.  The heads up was much appreciated.  I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to give this theater a try.  But if you live in the Biltmore or Arcadia areas, this is probably your best option.

Prior to visiting this place I thought the dinner/alcohol/movie concept was a brilliant one....now? Not so much.  Pros:  -Big Cozy Seats -Alcohol  -Food   Cons: -The big cozy seats have big huge consoles that make it impossible for one to get cozy w/their movie date (the whole yawn & stretch routine won't fly here fellas) -Higher than normal ticket prices (up to $5 more) -Parking is kind of inconvenient (be sure to bring in your ticket for validation) -Tickets need to be purchased in advance (this cannot be done via gift card) -Food/Alcohol is somewhat pricey/undesirable ($20 pre-tip for faux chicken fingers and soda) My friend even let an alcoholic beverage go to waste..it was that bad  All in all, I didn't love it. The theater was nice, our server was sweet, and the movie (Warm Bodies) was bomb diggety, but in the future I think I'll skip the extra cost/ inconvenience and resort back to watching films the good old fashioned (eat a delicious dinner elsewhere) way.

This used to be the ONLY theatre we would go to in Phoenix. Now, after a long series of declining experiences, it's the only theatre we WON'T go to. Consistently dead escalators and elevators (it's a third floor theatre), ever declining service levels and (sorry) a horribly incapable staff all conspire to make for a lousy but expensive theatre experience. Go ANYWHERE else and you'll be happier.
Took 40 minutes to get two Caesar salads to go today.  Ridiculous.  Way over priced as well.  I won't go back again.

World class place! I've been to a couple dine in theaters and honestly the food is usually sub par with high prices because of convenience. But this place had great food! I would eat at this place if it were just a restaurant. Great service as well! And still one of my favorite concepts, feed me while I recline and watch a movie- ahhhh so relaxing

Saw a movie here for the very first time last night. Decided to take my friend for her birthday since it looked spectacular from the website and we wanted to try something different. We usually go to Studio Movie Grill so I expected it to be similar...  There were definitely a lot of differences starting with the fact that they don't let you print your tickets from home. You have to pick them up at a kiosk when you arrive which was actually very quick and easy as long as you have the credit card you bought the tickets with on you. Also, they have a specific age rule so that kids under the age of 18 aren't allowed to go there unless they are accompanied by a parent or guardian over the age of 21. What a great rule!   There was a pretty good sized bar in the front lobby but not a single person was sitting at it. The bar at SMG has always been packed out every time I've gone, so this should have been a red flag.   About 15 minutes before the start of our movie, we headed into our designated theater. I was really excited until we walked in and there was a horrible stench. To be honest, it smelled like Chuck E Cheese.   Our seats were great! Smack dab in the center of the room. They were also very comfortable and clean. The problem was it was so dark, we had to squint to read our menus. And this was before the movie! A waiter appeared literally 2 minutes later and asked us what we wanted which was unexpected since I hadn't even pressed the call button yet. We both thought the mac and cheese sounded really good but I ended up ordering a Pizzini which is supposedly one of their "signature items" and she got a bacon cheeseburger. If you get a Pizzini, they charge you 99 cents to upgrade to french fries or else you are stuck with crunchy, loud potato chips. No way was that appropriate for the movie! We also both ordered diet cokes since the alcoholic beverages were way too overpriced and I had already spent $12.75 each on the tickets.   The food came out really quickly. Almost too quickly to the point where I started to question how fresh it was. The fries were way too salty and tasted like they were from McDonald's. The Pizzini was very dry and bland. Luckily it came with a special dip that was sort of spicy, but still decent.   After eating half of the Pizzini and half of the fries I was extremely full. Decided to focus on the movie and save the rest of my food to take home for later. However, I was unable to do that because THEY DON'T GIVE OUT TO GO BOXES?!  About 20 minutes before the movie ended I pressed the call button to see if I could get one, but nobody ever showed up. At that point there was still one waitress roaming around collecting people's bills, but she didn't even acknowledge me. I can't believe they would have the nerve to charge $12 for an entree and then not even allow us to take any leftovers home. This was a huge disappointment, but mainly because I hate wasting food. On our way out I looked to see if anyone else had received a box, but they hadn't.   One of the main reasons why I probably won't go back to this theater was that parking was a huge pain. It's one of those structures where you take a ticket and then when you leave you have to stick it in a machine and pay. At least I was able to get away with not paying since the movie theater validates tickets at the front when you walk in. Just be sure to keep your ticket with you, and not in your car.   Overall, I was not impressed. Was expecting a first -class experience, but instead received one that was mediocre. I think I am going to stick with Studio Movie Grill since it is cheaper and the food is much better.

Never had a bad experience here! Sometimes the service can be slow if the theater is full, but other than that, service is usually pretty good. The food is decent. The selection could be better. The drinks are good and usually change, where the are specialty mixes.

Students pay student prices ONLY on Thursdays.  Otherwise, everyone pays $9.50 per ticket past 6p (seniors may have discounted rate).   $9.50!  Good thing garage parking is validated up to four hours!    On a positive note, in fifteen minutes or more, I get to squeeze in a good workout before catching a movie.  I love climbing up and down those flights of stairs!

I've gone a couple times and always enjoyed myself. They have two types of theaters, one for only over the age of 21 and the other is for over the age of 18 or with an adult's presence. I've only ever gone to the the one for adults only. The seats are very comfortable and the servers do a nice job bringing food and drinks, but still staying out of the way of the viewing audience.  The food is really good. I'm a huge fan of the macaroni and cheese. It's got grilled chicken and comes with a piece of pretzel bread that's doughy and perfect to dip in left over cheese sauce. My husband likes the jalepeno burger, jalepenos are diced into the meat and fried jalepenos are served on top of it. There is a bar in the front of the theater and the drinks are really good too.  Parking for the Esplanade is validated for up to 4 hours and is easy enough to get in and out of.

Great idea -- bad followthrough.  Drinks were weak, despite their price.  Food was decent, although we had to eat ours WITH OUR HANDS.  The server never brought silverware or napkins.    After the food was served and we realized we were utensil-less, we rang the call button and the proceeded to wait 20 minutes, while NO ONE came to answer the button and our hot food got stone cold.  I ordered a brussels sprouts appetizer and another main dish.  My husband ordered a steak salad.  My main dish never arrived, so after we finished eating our now-cold-food WITH OUR HANDS and the film came to a close, the server walked over and plunked down the tab on my tray without a word.  I handed it right back to her, saying I never received my main dish, silverware or napkins.  There was no acknowledgement of, or apology for, the missing dish, utensils and napkins.  Next joke!

Theater #5 - Row B Photo Attached.  Center of the house would be rows C & D.  The last row has a big wall in front of you and you are near the ceiling.  Very large screen.  Overall good food.  Service was not as good as the Roadhouse Cinemas.  Overall 4 out of 5 stars.

Finally tried the New AMC theater. I am a loyal Harkins T-shirt wearing ,cup toting  Movie goer. But the old man and I decided it was time.   1- Most comfortable theater we have ever been in! We were in the Cinema Suites side. It was first class the whole way. Seats lay almost flat.  2- You can order food/ drinks- adult beverages- The whole Cinema Suites area is 21 and over- no kiddies... 3. Food was really really good. We had burgers and fries- Delish. I also had a waffle, maple, bacon ice cream dessert- Best dessert I've had in a while. If you order soda- free refills. I ordered bottled water. Later noticed others just getting tap water- I will order that next time. 4. Even though I gave it a 5 star I have to mention. There are lights that stay on during the movie and the wait staff are walking by a lot. I was ok with that- but that may drive others crazy. 5. Not for the poor- We paid $33.12 for 2 tickets- and $68.63 plus $12.00 tip for dinner. 2 burgers and fries, 2 drinks, 2 desserts and $12.00 for the rewards stubs card.  6. Until we hit the lottery- we will reserve going to this theater for very special occasions or for movies that are 2 1/2 hours or longer.

Way ,way overpriced! They don't use cups with lids go figure!!! I got an entire cup spilled all over me and my boyfriend! Greasy overpriced popcorn! I prefer the seats popcorn and loyal program Harkins provides. Don't waste your money unless you get the lounging seat theater!
Why can't they bring something like this to Tucson!!!  Their service is off the charts! Unbelievable!  I'd pay these prices for this service any day.

I've been to IPIC, studio movie grill...the other dine-in locations and this place was good. The food was great and the seats comfortable. The staff was professional and parking was easy. They validate parking at the front.

What a nice change! I enjoy much more the whole movie experience! Been there since they opened it back then and with the remodel to a new level, I can go more than just being inside of a movie theater! The food is good, the drinks with more options; it just fun!!

Worth. Every. Penny.  Recently went to AMC Esplanade for a movie and WOW. Tickets were $15 but considering what they come with, it was worth it!  They boast a full menu and bar, and prices are decent- similar to eating at many chain restaurants. Thought the popcorn was a little expensive- it's $7 for a small bag, but you can get free refills. I had the Sicilian Pizzini ($9.99 with Parmesan fries), and a Shock Top beer. My meal was delicious! It was crazy to think I was eating that in a movie theatre.   The seats fully recline and are incredibly comfortable! They make a little squeaky noise as you adjust during the movie, but it's not enough to notice or annoy other movie goers. The staff was excellent and attended to our needs immediately after we called for them.   As someone who is time challenged, being able to reserve and pay for seats online at home was a huge help! We got there 5 minutes to showtime and our seats were waiting for us, instead of having to search to find seats together. Cinema Suites are 21+ too, which was a nice plus with no children!  I will never go to another theatre again. It's either watch at home, or go to Cinema Suites.

This is easily the worst theater I've ever been to. Seats are wildly uncomfortable, and make an obscene amount of noise anytime anyone moves. On top of that upon getting to my seat I found it covered in spilled soda and sticky (are there not people to clean the theaters??). attendants run into and out of the theaters the entire movie but didn't bother to tell the patrons being incredibly loud to respect the rest of the paying customers and shut the hell up. Hey AMC, you know what makes lots of loud noise? Ice in plastic cups. So why do you serve your soft drinks this way? To add to the noise of the creaky uncomfortable seats?   Lastly, the parking and theater is not easily handicapped accessible. The parking directions for the theater is vague. We ended up parking in the wrong lot and my 85 year old grandmother who just had hip replacement surgery had to walk much farther than she should have to get to the theater. Staff was snarky and unhelpful when this was mentioned. Getting out of the parking lot was just as convoluted. No signage for exits and when there were signs they led to nowhere. WTF esplanade? Get your shit together.   Suffice it to say we will never be back to this theater.

The new Esplanade provides a nice afternoon or evening out. The price for the regular movies is comparable to 3D movies and much more worth it.  The seats (especially the ones in Cinema Suites, which fully recline!) are comfortable. The wait staff is very friendly and attentive. The refreshments are good, and food and drink prices are not inflated and more reasonable that those at the sports stadiums. An imported beer and unlimited popcorn is $13, not more than most theaters' large combos.  Parking is validated. If you are the ultimate movie fanatic, are not picky about atmosphere, and can go to movies at 10 in the morning, you can find a better deal elsewhere. But if you are a regular Joe, you will enjoy an occasional movie at the Esplanade.

A very cool concept and if I could give a 4.5 star I would. The ONLY downfall is the ledge covers the very bottom of the screen the higher up you sit. The food prices are extremely reasonable for a movie theater.. Great job AMC!

I give it a 3 because you can get beer. But that is where my happiness stops. Menus are always sticky. Service has been terrible the last few trips. Drinks wrongly ordered or don't come out at all. Seats are duct taped in red tape....just because it is the same color as the seat doesn't hide the tacky patch job. Food is just okay. I prefer other AMC locations to this subpar experience.

Honestly the whole experience at this theater keeps getting worse each visit. Food quality is poor, price is high, service is way below average. For a family of 3- we bought tickets for $35 which is fine- but then choose to use the "dine in" aspect of this location...the server was friendly at first but service was poor. We ended up spending $75 on food and drinks where the boneless wing basket was laughable- I honestly thought some nuggets had accidentally fallen into our sauce basket and they were bringing us more wings- my sons popcorn came 35 minutes into the movie after I had to ask twice- even though we ordered prior to start of film...and then our waters never came out - so I went to the bar myself and got them. The servers were laughing and chatting amongst themselves in a little kitchen/nook area, yet rarely checked on their patrons. I have worked in pubs, coffee shops, and 5 star resorts... it doesn't matter location- service should always be a priority. Maybe management should do some training of basics. As a theater we enjoy it but if you're offering food and beverage you need to step it up.

I can say hands down I won't be returning.  We were able to enjoy the preview weekend offered for the new Fork & Screen features, and the best thing I can say about it was I'm glad it was free.  All in all we enjoyed 2 free movie tickets, as well as free dinner and soda.  When we arrived we were helped quickly by a friendly guy who helped us get our tickets and headed to the new bar in the lobby.
