And open letter to the Esplanade Theaters:  Dear Mr. or Ms. Esplanade I enjoy your theaters. They are close to my home. And close to many restaurants and shops. Although I have to say the actual shops and restaurants at the Esplanade. Well, they suck. Except for Houstons. The choices of businesses and the horrible signage sends everyone scurring across the street. Yea, that's right. To the Biltmore. Just thought you should know. Your seats are comfortable and generally pretty dang clean. And your crazy concession prices. I don't even mind. It's like the crazy drink prices at the airport. I always expect it and actually enjoy overspending for some strange reason. Just part of the experience I guess.  I really just have one other thing to say Esplanade people: FIX THOSE DAMN ESCALATORS!!!!! IF I WAS LOOKING FOR A FREAKIN HIKE BEFORE AND AFTER MY MOVIE I'D GO TO CAMELBACK MOUNTAIN!  Thank you for your time.  Most Sincerely, Thomas S.

Horrible service!!! They didn't remove empty plates for an hour. Brought us 2nd round of drinks over 20 minutes of ordering and didn't take empty glasses.  I actually left the movie to see what was going on. Everything on the little table was piled up. Screwed up bill and tried to fix it with me during the finale of movie (last 5 minutes). They're supposed to be great reclining chairs. But, they were held together by red duct tape.  WTF!!!!

This is my favorite theater in the valley.  The reclining seats are great, the food is good, and the service is usually quite nice.  I was prompted to write this as I just refunded my tickets and it was easy and the service person was most pleasant and efficient.  I would be ideal if the process was online, but if one call and a quick resolution is the requirement, I can't complain.  And if you ever have to watch a kids movie that doesn't appeal to you, getting a glass of wine in the process is not a bad way to go :-)

Purchased tickets online in advance and arrived early to eat. Sign on the door, not online but taped to the door, no kitchen available. Ridiculous. The point of a Dine-in theatre is to DINE. When manager was asked why AMC's website didn't notify customers that their kitchen ovens were down and had been since Christmas he claimed that AMC "doesn't own or control its website."  More ridiculous. The story then changed to we'll have a kitchen later this afternoon when the prep work is done. What?  Piss poor service and experience. Harkins - they don't promise what they can't deliver.

Haven't been here in a while. Walked into the theater and my heart hurt. The place is so worn out. Chairs are all cracked and are not as comfortable as they were. Service and food is still good, but come on AMC, where is your pride. So so sad.

One of the best movie theaters I have been to in a long long time.  When its 115 degrees outside, nothing beats sitting in an air conditioned theater.  My buddy and I went here twice during our stay.  We saw Inception and Cyrus.  Both decent flicks by the way.  5 stars.  That's right!  Know why?  $5.25 to get in.  That is unheard of.  I worked at a movie theater back in the day and those were the matinee prices THEN.  Here they are still that cheap.  That is awesome!   The theaters were really nice and they had multi levels in them.  We sat in the middle level for both movies.  There is nothing in front of you so you can stretch out your legs if you want.  The seats were comfortable and everyone we encountered was nice and friendly.  They also validate parking too which is awesome!  Overall a great theater!

I know there are a lot of other great reviews on here about this theater and I agree that the dinner theater experience is fantastic. They give free refills on soda and popcorn (although they are awfully slow at it as others have pointed out), and it was wonderful to reserve seats ahead of time. However, the leather chairs were awful! We went twice while I was home and my mom and I both felt the same. The first time we thought it was just because we sat in one of the lower rows, but the 2nd time going (just to give it another chance) was the same. They are not cozy, very stiff, and the lumbar section actually hurt my lower back. Additionally, maybe because I am shorter person (5'3"), I could not put my feet on the ground so my legs were dangling unless I sat Indian-style (criss-cross applesauce for you PC people out there). For me, it is now a search to find a similar type theater with more comfy seats!

We love the Esplande 14. In fact, we call it "our" theater and have a hard time going anywhere else. Its clean, great staff complete with tasty movie theater treats. And, its a great theater if you're looking to make a good old fashioned date night this is the place for you... great restaurant and bar options within walking distance to the theater. We often get Stingray for happy hour at the Biltmore and then walk over to the theater.

Alright, I tried this theater one more time and am so glad I did.  It was a very different experience this time so I have to update my review.  I went with my boyfriend to see The Heat (which was awesome, too).  The popcorn was spectacular this time!!!  I was so excited and it tasted so good that I ordered a refill.  Woo hoo!!  I did not order the unsweetened tea (which wasn't good the two times I previously ordered it), but instead ordered the sweetened raspberry tea.  It was also very good.  And, just because we were uber hungry, we ordered some of their parmesan fries from the appetizer menu.  They were amazing.  I mean, they were really, really amazing!  Everything about this movie experience was wonderful and exactly what I've been wanting all along.  Thank you to AMC for correcting the former issues and making this the 5 Star experience I've been wanting.  I'll be back again and again.
Absolutely love this theater. Senior (daytime) is 6.50, we had reserved seats (recliners) with full menu, food brought right to your seats. Food was great and so was the service.

It's not a local theater it's a national chain.  I prefer to support my local Harkins.  I do like the new food options and actually the prices are not bad.  If you go here see the movie in the over 21 theaters they serve alcohol and the seats are a little more comfortable.

Today was our first time at the AMC Dine-In theatre. We were excited to try something new and it is a neat idea for sure, but I feel the price just isn't worth it. With only 8 people in the theatre room that we were in, 4 of the people being in our party.. The service should have been better, we waited long intervals after pushing the light for service and items were forgotten. The food was cold, overpriced, and bland. The mixed drinks are WAY overpriced and could've been better. We probably won't go again and that's disappointing.

Took my wife to the dine in theaters here twice in the past few weeks. Both times we had a pretty good experience. Food is decent. We ordered the nachos and some popcorn. Popcorn was expensive (8.75) but they give you a very large bucket. The nachos were $10 and it was also a pretty big portion. I like the black beans, pico, and guac on the nachos. Wish there wasn't the processed nacho liquid cheese, but the fresh toppings distract from that. Also free refills on drinks is a good perk!   Service is decent. The first time we went there was a long wait for our food and drinks, but we were in a larger theater. The second time we were in a smaller theater and service was very quick.   Reclining seats, pretty comfortable. One complaint, although it's not a huge problem, is that the trays aren't made to go all the way across your chair such that it would be easy to share with your neighbor. My wife had to hold the plate of nachos so that I could share some. Would be nice if there were trays that go all the way across so it's easier to slide food back and forth and share with each other.   Overall nice theater! We'll be back.

We like coming here for dinner and a movie and we sometimes bring family and/or friends. The seating is pre purchased and assigned, and very comfortable. The food is quite good. We share orders of Parmesan fries, and chicken tenders, and bottomless popcorn. The parking is validated, covered, and convenient. Sure you pay a little bit more than you would for fast food and a movie, but the seating, the food and the facility make for a fulfilling experience.

The food is actually really yummy. My daughter and I ordered nachos and my fiance ordered the pretzel bites. Both very yummy. For an entre I had the taco trio (1 shrimp, 1 salmon maybe?...and one chicken). The fish tasted very fresh. The only thing I didn't really like was that the seats didn't recline and it was so dark 40 mins before the previews even started, I couldn't read my menu. Our waitress seemed like she was ready to leap off the tallest building she could find. I really feel for her, being a waitress is no easy task, but I found myself looking longingly at the other smiling, friendly wait staff. I almost hated to press my button to ask her anything. Anyways, if you're in the area it's worth it but if your pleasures lie in comfort, it would be worth the drive to find a better theater for the same price.

We went to an early afternoon show and it was a terribly disappointing experience. This was our first and last visit to AMC Esplanade. Yes, the drinks are weak and sugary and the food isn't great - but we expected that.  We didn't expect a broken escalator with no direction on how else to find your way up to the theatre, a seat that didn't recline and loudly creaked and groaned every time I moved (I'm only 135 lbs!!!), no soap in the bathroom, only half of the sinks in the bathroom functioning, and a dirty toilet stall. The experience was certainly NOT worth the price we paid. One star added for decent service from the staff in the theatre.

The dine in theater here is a lot of fun and a nice option, especially if you are already planning on dinner before a movie.  The quality of the food is just ok, but if you aren't expecting gourmet fancy pants food, it's pretty good.  Our server was attentive and helpful as well.  The price, it can get to you.  $15 for a ticket with fees, $12 for a drink, $16 for an entre, soon you are out $50 per person before tip.  I was also disappointed in the cleanliness of the theater, some pages of my menu were stuck together.  No big deal, I'll just exchange it with the seat next to me.  That menu was completely stuck together so I had to use The Boy's menu which was still sticky, but at least not stuck together.   It's fun for a splurge but not an everyday kind of option.  Don't forget to validate your parking!

The ticket prices were very high for a weekday ($24 for two at noon).   Service in the theater was almost non-existent - it took at least 30 minutes into the movie to get server despite pressing the request for service button.   The most insane part of the experience was the fact they offer only one size popcorn- enough to feed an army!!!  What a waste.  I wouldn't waste the money coming here

I've come to this theater about two or three times since moving here. The seats are terrible and not comfortable at all. No recliners unless you're lucky enough to get tickets to that auditorium. I could care less for the dine-in experience. It's caused the food, drink, and ticket prices to be higher. Plus you have to add tip on top of that. There also needs to be a way the servers can tell who turned their light on in proper order... the other night we waited forever for a server to come to us, and it was blindly obvious that people who came after us were getting served before us because they were closer to where the server was... and the table light is blinding when you're watching a movie. There's no way to turn it off besides covering it with the menu on the table. Will never recommend this theater and will not return.

I've been three times to experience dine in movies. Seats are super comfy, service is prompt and everyone seems super excited to work here. It's charming to have a bar out front to enjoy a drink prior to the show. Stock up on a huge glass of free water while you're there. Bottles are for sale in the movie theater but why pay for some H2O? :) Bring your parking stub for 4 hour validation.  SEATING There are some pretty neat seats available. With a last minute decision my brother and I sat row 1 for a 3D movie. (Groot was awesome from Guardians of the Galaxy. I'd probably date him.) Turns out the seats up close *recline*.    For another flick we sat further back. (Boo, those seats did not recline. Not sure if seating varies per theatre.) No complaints as sitting in a recliner with A/C blasting away makes for a perfect August day.  Here's where the envy crept in: Behind the front row section is a mini-bar area. You can buy seats that spin! (Seriously, I know how I old I am. Shet it.) I thought it was cool to have a personal table/bar area.  Some of the seats could use WD40. Have no fear, you'll be so entranced by the seats a squeak or two is ok.   DRINKS & FOOD Sweet Geezus, the portions are HUGE. I fork tasted the Tenderloin Tips and eyeballed Rick N's sandwich. Both could readily be shared and both parties satiated. What did I eat? Dessert. Yes, I had a chocolate martini. (Thanks Carlos V. for treating! And driving our sorry butts around.)  The drink menu is impressive. However, I like things simple. It was easy peasy to order a dirty vodka martini w/o any fluffy stuff.  CON Come early. The escalators have been offline the three times I've been there. Elevators exist, however, they are on the small side and fit four people. In case anyone forgot, it's HOT in PHOENIX in AUGUST. [Head shake]  Note: Voicemails left with questions about theatre seating may not be returned. Bummer!

I like: ~the location (close to me) ~you can grab a drink after a movie or grab dinner before all in the same area ~the theater is traditionally cleaner than most  I hate: ~the smell of gas leaking when you walk out of the parking garage after you park ~getting stuck in the garage after the movie-- i don't get what the hold up is people???  Have your VALIDATED TICKET in your hot little hand as you approach the exit.  Often times, you can be stuck in the garage for 15 mins.  totally blows.  So I gave 3 stars, even though I like the theater itself, it's the parking that deserves zero stars-- so 3 stars it is.

Last weekend, I went here to see 12 Years A Slave. Figured I might as well be comfortable in a reclining chair while watching a movie that was going to make me feel quite the opposite.  PROS: -This movie theater is really nice, which isn't surprising considering the area. -Assigned seating. No having to get to a movie theater ultra early and risk breaking your neck in the front trying to see the screen.  -Comfy chairs that recline. It's like being in your own living room! -It's totally okay to drink here, there's a full bar! -Because there's a full bar, it's 21 and over! No screaming children..unless you're just a screaming adult. In that case, stay at home and watch a movie.   CONS: -Because it is really nice, tickets are a little pricey. -The upper levels, where I sat, have a railing that is too high. It renders the reclining chair pointless because I had to sit straight up and still struggled to see the entire screen. I mean.. I know I'm like 5'4" but c'mon!  -Although there's a full bar, it's expensive and makes sneaking booze in more appealing here than a normal movie theater where you can't drink. -A bowl of popcorn (yes..a bowl, not a bag) is about $8 and only comes in one size.   Overall, it was an enjoyable experience despite the cons. It definitely would not be my go-to movie theater, only if it was a movie I was really excited to see.   I can imagine this would be a great first date place, especially if you're the type of person who worries about having nothing to talk about during dinner. No talking required if you're eating dinner in a quiet movie theater! And talk about efficient-if the date's bad it'll be over by the closing credits.
I wanted to love this. The service was good. But I'm so... SO sick. Maybe I'm the fool for trusting movie theater food with SHRIMP served to me in the dark. I won't be back. Just not worth this...

I have been wanting to visit this done in theater for quite some time. Today we made our way from Goodyear to Phoenix to check it out. First off when you arrive if you park in the garage just go ahead and take the elevator up because the theater is on top. We made the mistake of going down to the ground level then we had to walk up the escalator stairs since none to the stairs going up were working.  The lady working at the ticket booth was awesome and she helped us figure out what movie to see after the one we were originally going to see was sold out.  She also explained how the whole thing worked. So far so good.  We were early so we sat at the bar and had a drink and appetizer. I ordered a margarita. It was super sour. I had to have them add watermelon pure to it and still couldn't drink it. Later I heard a waiter talk someone out of ordering one. We did a sampler appetizer that was pretty good.  Once we finished that it was time to head into the theater. We found our seats and they were worn out! I had to switch with my husband because the one I sat in originally was so worn out I felt like I was laying down. We ordered a pitcher of beer and popcorn. It took forever to get the beer and even longer to get the popcorn. It was $35 for those two items. I thought it was going to be around $27 but didn't check my receipt to see what they charged. I did hear someone else complaining about being over charged on our way out. When I mentioned it to my son he told me that he did not get all his change after he paid.  I was seriously disappointed with this theater. The seats were not nearly as comfy and the living room theaters and I felt like we got ripped off with the whole dine in thing.  The best part of this experience was sharing a pitcher with my hubby. I doubt we will be back after today's experience.

This is our theater of choice. It's clean, short lines for everything from tickets to refreshments. You can always find a seat. And  those seats are comfortable.  Covered parking. They validate and there is food nearby that is tasty.  They also have $5 dollar movies until 12 PM. So basically matinees are cheap. I enjoy that.

This used to be one of my and my husband's favorite movie theaters and we have been here a number of times  but after tonight's experience we will not be back. When we walked into the theater we were greeted by a friendly server and she offered to show us our seats. I thought we were off to a good start and a pleasant movie going evening. I thought wrong!!! When we looked at the seats we were about to sit in, they looked like some ferocious cat had scratched them all up! The white inside of the chair was showing and the leather was shredded. We flagged down the server and asked for a different seat. She promptly told us to check with customer service and left.  Upon sitting in our new seats we went to take a look at the menu and the menus were sticky and greasy and the food tables were sticky and had crumbs all over them. So disgusting! Even after all of this we still wanted to see the movie. When I opened the menu I immediately had sticker shock! The prices had increased significantly and many of my favorite food items from before were gone. Most of the meals were $16 with the appetizers being $8. This was not including a beverage. We were looking at $20 per person for food and a non alcoholic beverage!! We were finally ready to order and no one came to assist us. We saw servers buzzing all over the theater and not one stopped to help us. We turned on the conveniently located service button  not once but 3 times still no service. We finally stopped one of the servers and told him we were ready to order. He said we were not his section and he would find our server. At this point we had waited 15 mins and were ready to leave. Our server finally appeared. She gave us some story about new management and chaos. We placed our order and settled in to watch the movie.  At this point the previews and movie began and I thought things would start looking up. No such luck! We got no drinks or food for another 20 mins as we watched all of the people around us that ordered after we did get their food. When the food finally came I took one bite and it was cold! I kid you not!! This was the final straw. We picked up our food walk into the hallway and asked to speak to a manger. We told her the situation and our she offered us the option to order something different, no apologies just more cold food. We just informed her we were leaving and would like a refund of our tickets. She sent us to customer service and no apologies there either. We got the refund and left. This was the absolute worse experience we have had at this theater. Never again!

I'm still exploring my new neighborhood and thought I'd check out my local theater. I looked up movie times online beforehand, but had no idea what I was getting in to.  When I bought my Saturday afternoon ticket, I was a bit thrown back by the $16.50 ticket price. Unless that comes with a full body massage during the movie, seems a bit steep. The young man at the counter explained how everything worked and asked me to pick out my seat from his screen. He printed out my ticket and I was on my way.  I had no idea what to expect from this point.  As soon as you get your ticket, you can head right over to the bar in the lobby and get yourself a nice frosty adult beverage. I was already short on time so I didn't get a chance to visit the bartenders.  I walked to the theater, turned the corner and was stunned by the rows and rows of huge recliners! I had no idea! I found my seat amongst a spicy group of older single gals and told them it was my first time here and I didn't know what to do. They pointed to the cocktail menu.  That's right my friends. You can order booze. From your recliner. At the movies. AND someone brings it to you.   Nestled under my drink menu -- full bar by the way -- was the food menu. Wait, so now you're telling me I can have someone bring me beer while watching a movie AND I can have a cheeseburger? Wow! I ordered my burger and onion rings, which were spectacular, and told the waitress she'd have to pry me out of that seat to get me out of there afterwards.  It's a bit pricey, but totally worth it. Makes a perfect date night too. Plenty of bars right out on the esplanade to grab a cocktail.  I cannot wait to go back!  **hint hint gentlemen!

Been here several times but this time was by far the worst service. It took 35 minutes to place my first order, then i waited so long for them to come back that i decided it would be quicker to just go to the counter and place and get my order. Then add to it the fact that they changed thier menu and got rid of some of the faves.

This place is freaking awesome.  I first discovered it with my fat Friend Jeff.    The ultra premium seats in the top shelf section have room o' plenty for kicking back and handy snacks (blanket recommended).   A great practice is going to a morning screening when the tickets are actually affordable--they drop down to $7 bucks or so before 11am. Not a bad day to start the day especially if you're hungover.  You just push the button on your seat and an Oompa Loompa servant pops out of nowhere to take your food/drink order.  Alcoholic beverages available and encouraged.   Food is on par with red robin and drinks are on par with a TGI Fridays/ Applebee's.    That said, those choices aren't half bad when you're watching a movie in a first class airplane chair whilst receiving aforementioned handy J from your buddy Jeff!  Male-male matinee !

I don't really see the appeal of this theatre. Yes, you can order food while watching a movie...but the food isn't good, it's over priced, and you have to deal with waiters walking around throughout your movie talking to people and taking orders. Not to mention you have to pay your bill during the last few minutes of the movie...very distracting.  We shared the app trio with fries, jalapeno poppers, and a BLT flatbread....the food all tasted like it could have just as well come out of the freezer, overly salty...nothing special. Additionally, it was awkward to share as I had to reach across the seat to get anything (there's no table between the pair of seats).The seats themselves were fine, but nothing special. My biggest complaint is that the movie ticket price itself is more expensive than other AMC locations....why? To have the ability to order food in the theatre that you also have to pay for? It just seems silly to me. Maybe I'm crazy...but I think it's nice to go to dinner and actually talk to the people you are with before going to the movies and don't think you should have to pay extra to have the option of ordering food.....Anyway, sorry for the rant, if this is something you are interested in doing, I suppose this location is as good as any other, but I wouldn't go again.

Ugh. This hurts. In theory I wanted to love the idea of this concept. I've been here several times since the "revamping" and it continues to suck worse each time. The service is horrendous. It's like trying to reign in convicts into jail. The food sucks, over priced and is oddly enough, getting worse each time. They bring you the check without a "you need anything?" It's obnoxious and not worth the money.  Don't be swayed, this venue is declining by the second. Wait for it on redbox.

LOVE this theater, It is reasonably priced and has good food and great service. The seats are comfortable when you get the recliners not the red seats. I did feel the seats were too close to eachother and the first time I went I was a lil distracted by the constant movement. But you get use to it and are able to focus. The lounge/bar area is nice and staff is very helpful and friendly.

Ok so this is how we should watch movies ALL the time! Once you've experienced this theater going back to a regular AMC or Harkins Theater feels like such a downgrade. lol.   I've only been here twice but I seriously love it! The fact that you get the whole Dinner AND a movie experience is amazing. You can't go wrong with comfortable reclined seats and your food and drinks being brought to you. I brought my boyfriend for the first time and at first he was pretty iffy about it and upset that I paid so much for our tickets. But once we got in and sat down he changed his mind about it immediately and loved it! lol. Plus I love saying I told you so. =P  The staff is always extremely friendly and quick at serving you. I think the food and drinks are a bit over priced but you really pay for the experience of the theater I think. I got the bacon cheeseburger which I thought was a bit dry and needed some type of sauce to it. I'd liked to try the drinks next time I come.   Soo.. if you haven't been here? GO! You might feel differently about going back to Harkins after this experience. =)

This theatre is in a nice location so my husband and I enjoy coming here for a dine in movie experience. Things were very disappointing when we attended a movie last night. After finding our seats and looking at the menu we were saddened to find that it had completely been changed and all of our favorite items were basically gone. The menu had been reduced to basic "bar food" items. Then as the previews start we hear a "vacuum" sound in the theatre. We thought it was a temporary noise or maybe they were just cleaning the theatre next to us. Not the case, it was a sound we had to endure the WHOLE MOVIE!!!!! After several of us becoming disgruntled over the loud noise, my husband goes to complain and reports back that the movie attendant said it was the wind and there wasn't anything that could be done about it. Well, that's nice! Love paying to watch a movie that has a loud distracting  background noise! It would have been nice if a manager would have addressed the issue or at least given us a free voucher for the inconvenience when we exited the movie. It seemed that they didn't give a hoot about our experience and that was unsettling. None to say the least, not returning to this location any time soon.

I only go to this theatre for Cinema Suites--Fork and Screen is sort of a lackluster (but still expensive) time.   That said, I love the recliners and the wine has always been good.   The food, however, is TERRIBLE.  Just tonight, I ordered truffle fries... and they were barely lukewarm.  Also, I was one of about 6 people in the theatre so crowd/wait time could not have been a factor.  Sigh.

The new Esplanade is fantastic!  Food exceeded my (admittedly low) expectations. Everything packed a lot of flavor, and there was more thought and care put into it than I would normally expect from a restaurant that sources its food from a national distributor. For example, the breadstick that came with the Chicken Mac 'n Cheese was a soft pretzel. Cute, no? The Mac 'n Cheese and Chicken Fajita Wrap were on par with the best meals I've had at a TGI Fridays or Applebys. I mean that in the best way possible... This is simple whitebread American dining, but it's done well. Price points for food and alcohol were competitive with those chains as well... Most of the meals clocked in under $10, though soda was almost $4.   Service was scary good. Push a button, BOOM! they're there at your side. Our drinks were refreshed before we could finish them. Super friendly waitress. Their efficiency bordered on supernatural. I mean, it's not like they can just look out over a one-room restaurant to see what's going on with their section of tables. So mad kudos to everyone who works there.   There are two kinds of theaters, and you have to go to the AMC website to know which one your show is playing in. Note that the high-end theaters are 21+. Even the basic level had extraordinarily comfortable seating. Seats are arranged there mostly in groups of four. The enormous comfy chairs are worth the slightly higher ticket price.   If you go during the day, don't pay the extra $1 to order your tickets from AMC's site. Otherwise, it's worth it: The seats are assigned.  My only complaint is that the popcorn only comes in a small bag. Refills are unlimited, and you only need to push a button to get more, but it's difficult to share a bag with a group of friends without calling for more every five minutes.

This is the only place I see movies these days. Who wants to deal with the pain in the butt of getting to the theater early and having to fight for seats when you can reserve your seats ahead of time at this theater? I love all the conveniences this theater provides- 1) easy seating, 2) servers who bring you drinks and food (minus one star because the food is just ok in my opinion) and 3) covered parking. Thanks AMC for making movie-going so much more pleasant!

This is my favorite sunday night movie place. My boyfriend and I only like going to the Cinema Suites theatre. Don't even bother with the Fork and Screen side (it just isn't as good). The flatbread pizza is yummy and the servers are pretty great. I wish the prices were a little better or had a better reward system.   Plus I really wish they had $1 sodas like at Harkins... That is my one downfall.   But Overall great experience I haven't even tried any of the other dine ins... no reason to

The movie was terrible (Rough Night) which of course is not something the theatre can help but everything else was sub-par as well. The drinks came with no ice because they "ran out of ice" at 8pm. We cancelled the soft drinks and had to remind the server that we ordered pop corn. We also ordered food (mac and cheese had to be sent back to be warmed up because it sat for so long til we received it and the southwest salad was some kind of mystery meat that I should not have eaten but I hadn't eaten all day so was famished and ate a third of it. When the bill came the soft drinks were still on the bill so had to ask it to be revised which took a while. Unfortunately both my daughter and I have upset stomachs now. The meal costing $50 along with the price of the ticket made this a very expensive evening. We will not return again and will not recommend this dine-in theatre to anyone. The others we frequent (Scottsdale Quarter and Fashion Square) are much better.

This is my favorite theatre to go to with my husband on Date Night. The food is (almost) always good and if it isn't cooked to your definition of perfect, they will gladly bring it back and either remake it or offer you a substitute. No complaints when you want to change your seats, just bring your tickets to the front and they will switch them for you. We go out of our way to go to this amc location because it's the best.
Friendly service. Clean environment. Decent food and snacks. Shows movies. All you can ask from a theatre.
Great theater,wish the seats fully reclined and that they had food that was a little cheaper but it's not a bad theater, it's very small and intimate.
One of my favorite places to see a movie.  Garage parking, nice staff great seats, and mostly empty.  You can have the theatre to yourself sometimes.

This was my first visit to a dine-in theater. The seats were comfortable except that they lean a little too far back for me. The food was of mixed quality. The parmesan fries were delicious, the grilled beef sandwich was okay, but the milk shake was just awful. It was very very expensive, quite small, and worst of all extremely watery, with actual chunks of ice cubes still in it. Absolutely no hint of any ice cream.  The staff were pleasant and courteous, over-all a nice afternoon.

This will be the last time I frequent this movie theater!  Bad from beginning to end.  It took 20 minutes for someone to come take our order.  25 minutes later half of our food arrives.  Fries were cold and maybe there were 15 in the entire bowl.  Another 20 minutes goes by and our drinks and popcorn arrive.  I explained to the waitress that the fries were cold and that we barely received any to speak of.  She said she couldn't take it off our bill because we had eaten most of them (because we were starving!)  I said I was just explaining to her they were cold and wasn't even asking for them to be taken off our bill.  The movie stated time to start was 7:15... which we all know means there will be a few trailers to watch.....we sat through over 20 minutes of commercials and then about 20 more minutes of trailers!  The movie did not start until almost 7:50.  (though no fault of the theater the movie was HORRIBLE!)All in all a very frustrating and expensive evening.... we spent over $100 for four of us to have two orders of fries, popcorn, one diet coke and one sparkling water, one appetizer, one cocktail and a southwestern chicken bowl.  I get the strong feeling they are really upselling the food and keep you there longer just to bolster their numbers.    That was the worst movie experience!

I wish I could  rate this theater with 5 stars. Why I can't: It smells like old moldy carpet in the lobby Um, there is a partition wall in front of every row of seats. I am 5'7 and when u sit in the recliner (21 and over theater), you can't see 1/4 of the bottom of the screen!!! Everyone in my row commented on it out loud and I asked the server if anyone had ever complained: his response was a look that said "of course" and he said that MANY people have complained. Even taller men in my row couldn't see the whole screen. The more you reclined, the more you lost view of the bottom screen. That sucked. The sound in the theater was not loud enough. Only once did the rear house speakers activate and that was at the END of the movie. It was way too low, especially when you're eating crunchy food. Please, AMC corporate, please spend the money to update the theater lobby and overall interior. Paint, carpet, decor are still out of the 80's. Come on, it's the Esplanade. Take note of Ipic Scottsdales interior and mirror that as much as possible!!! We all know you have the capital to do it.   The plus side: Not that expensive for 21 and over. Seats are comfy Food was actually better than Ipic theater in Scottsdale. Our food (2 entrees and a dessert for three of us) was $35.  Much more affordable than the over priced menu at Ipic. Parking validation for the garage is a plus Nice staff

Menu isn't as good as it used to be but always a comfortable fun time. Staff is always very friendly.   The gumbo Mac is fabulous!  The shakes are unnecessarily large and the popcorn always perfectly salty.

It's a good thing the seats are comfortable and the showtimes are good because wow has it become expensive to go to the movies. No wonder people stay home and stream.... haven't been to the movies for a long time and it will be a long time before I spend that kind of money to go again.

The absolute best place to watch a movie in Phoenix! Real food with a gourmet/gastro pub vibe! Everything I've had there had been good, but no matter I may eat, I always save room for dessert! The waffle dessert is the bomb! Don't leave without it! Absolutely the best dessert I've had in a while. The candied bacon will delight you're taste buds!

As a movie theater itself, nothing to complain about. You have lots of room to move around, very comfortable reclining seats, nice staff at the check-in area. Perfect atmosphere to enjoy a movie, if you don't eat.   The fact that you can also dine in makes it really formidable. You just push the button and a server comes to you for drinks and food.   However don't be fooled by the idea to "dine in" for a full meal. The menu is limited and it's pretty much only snacks. Also only one or two items have less than 1000 calories. Even the salads, according to the menu, have 1000 to 1500 calories per portion. Unacceptable. Full of very unhealthy food that would be processed, stored, and converted into adipose fat. Great. I had different sushi rolls both times and they were not even good. Too dry and I didn't even taste the fish. My other complaint goes to the service: it's slow and (probably) poor organized. They got me food before drinks, and the drinks took more than 20 minutes to come. I understand the first time I was here the room was packed and the servers were running around for the confusion. But last night they had no excuse, there were probably 10 people total in room #4. How can you supposed to be totally focused on the movie when suddenly you remember "Didn't I order a beer?" A beer takes 2 minutes to be delivered.  No one ever apologized for the waiting time and of course, they still charged me for the full thing. Like If I had proper service and good food.   The other issue is the location. I assume 99% of the customers drive here and the only parking available is the covered gated one next to Esplanade. Way too expensive. Last night I paid $9 for 2 hours and a half. In the end I paid more for the parking than for the movie. Perhaps there's another parking somewhere else...but I refuse to walk more than 500 feet alone at night in Central Phoenix.   So in the end, yes try it out, but don't make it your first choice as a movie theater. There are better cheaper ones more conveniently located in Phoenix.

One of my favorite places to catch the latest flick.  It has lots of food/drink options all around, yet because it's not mall you won't find tons of kids, tween and teens running all over the place all of the time.  Most kids who are there are there to watch a particular movie.  In and out of there.    It's also just a perfect meet spot for folks from different parts of town.  It was almost equal distance for friends from N. Phx, Old town Scottsdale, North Tempe and me in SoMo.  With it's location, you know it has to keep things nice, and it always does.  And as a note, something about the place must work to help keep kids calm.  We took a pack of kids (Ok, 3 boys) here to see the first Harry Potter when it came out.  It was awesome.  Got everyone a Starbucks to sip on while waiting in the long line - even though we'd pre bought our tickets we had to get there early to ensure good seats.  And even after an early morning drive that could have made them whiny and a Venti serving of sugar and caffeine - they all behaved perfectly through the entire thing - as did almost all other kids during the whole Harry process.  Dang impressive.

Yes, the 21+ box seats are comfortable.  Yes, it's cool to be able to push a button and have a drink delivered to your seat.  Sure, eating actual food instead of movie theater food is probably a lot healthier.  However, the seats at the AMC theater down in Tempe are just as comfortable, and although they don't recline like the fancy ones at this theater do, the theater down there also doesn't have a wall that cuts off the very bottom aspect of your movie screen.  The food here is pretty poor in quality, so we don't often take advantage of this option.  The drinks are nothing special, a little too sugar-based for me.  The tickets are much higher in price here than at any normal AMC theaters in the Valley.  If you're going to offer food and drinks at your theater, you're going to be making a lot more money off your customers since they're going to be buying more to eat and drink.  I'm pretty sure that movie theaters make most their money on concessions, and combining a theater and a restaurant/bar is a neat trick to increase your profits.  Therefore, I would suggest that your base prices be cheaper at an AMC dine-in theater, or at least equally priced to any other AMC theater instead of marked up.  If someone doesn't take advantage of the food option at this theater, the price for a ticket here is horrendously overpriced, especially when you can find other AMC theaters that are just as comfortable down south.  That said, this theater always seems to sell out in advance, so I won't argue against the business plan anymore.  Instead, I'll drive a bit out of my way to watch a movie in equal comfort for a third of the price.

Upon arriving to our movie a little late, but we had paid ahead of time there were people in our seats. Staff failed to accommodate us, and just let the people chill in our seats. They offered movie passes, but I don't ever want to go back to a AMC period. So I will be filing a claim with the bank! Don't bother calling corporate they are just as rude, and they use no empathy. This company is horrible, I will be going to studio movie grill for now on.

I love this place!! Their food is pretty good and the seats are super comfortable!! The service is always really great and the staff is very nice. It may seem a little pricey but it is worth it! It's hard to go to a normal theater after going to this one! It's almost like watching a movie at home but your getting waited on! Definitely recommend this theater!!

OK, not a bad chain of movies and we go there almost exclusively. It's clean and that's a plus.  Well,we have had to talk to the service desk to get them to focus the damn movie twice but who hasn't?  What I don't like is the popcorn. OK, not a real big deal but at the prices they charge you'd expect a little more effort.  So many other movie chains give the customer self-serve options for garnishing your popcorn but all these places offer are "butter" flavored oil. Well, it ain't butter flavored. It is disgusting.   And popcorn flavor? United Blood Service serves better popcorn in their recovery area.  Come on AMC, get with the future-present.  I'm sure you could come up with a better supplier and better buttery topping than the motor oil you serve. Plus there's plenty of places that offer self-serve sprinkle-on flavors. You serve salt packets. Woo Hoo. Hell, I was in a Daytona Beach Florida theater that had a better concession stand than you do.   If you force us to buy your food at your inflated prices, at least give us something to delight us. Try anyway.

Super fancy! I like how you can order while watching movie. The only downfall is that it could be very annoying since they keep walking in front and we can't focus on the movie but that's normal for a theatre like this, nothing too serious.  Service was ok, it wasn't fast. The popcorn did come early except the drinks where we waited for about 40 mins! But that's ok. Maybe next time, you guys can give the drinks a little faster. We got the basil strawberry drink thingy & the titosaurus. Titosaurus was ok & the basil strawberry drink was good. We like the fancy red recliner chairs.   This place is good for dates! I do wish the arm rest in between can be pulled up so there is extra spaced, you know :)  Overall, experience was good! The servers were very nice though & made sure everything is good!  Thanks! Coming back here again & hopefully the drinks won't take forever.

So I came here yesterday to see snow white and the huntsmen, everything went good as always, except they are cutting back, for example they no longer sell gourmet popcorn, so no more free sample of the day, no more hot towel to wipe your hands, and no more mint ghiradeli chocolate at the exit. the special touch this theater had is gone. Might as well be a regular theater with nice seats

Came here for the 1st time with a date on Saturday night and had a fairly good experience. It was a bit difficult to find the actual theater and I didn't feel there was adequate signage posted after I parked in the adjacent deck. Also, the elevator in the parking deck was broken so I had to take the stairs in four inch wedges- um no bueno. And I walked around the first level for a bit before I realized the theater was up the escalator because again- lack of good signage.  Minor annoyances aside- it's a pretty nice place. There were plenty of tables in the lobby area so my date and I  sat and had drinks out there until closer to showtime. They have an extensive drink menu with most cocktails costing $9 - $12. I had the hard strawberry lemonade. Very refreshing but not enough alcohol in it for me. I found it to be pretty watery.  In any case, close to showtime we made our way to our screening room. Unfortunately it didn't have reclining seats which was really disappointing! My date said only certain screening rooms there have recliners. Minus a star for that because I just didn't find the seats to be overly comfortable or generous in the legroom department.  As for the menu, if you are in search of a healthy dining out experience, it will not be found here. Lots of burgers and fried foods on this menu. Almost every item on the menu was listed at 1000 or more calories and almost NONE of it is vegetarian friendly. There are approximately TWO salads on the menu and both come with chicken.   Luckily I'm a pescatarian, so I was able to order the fish and chips. However, that was a whopping 2200 calories! It came with two cheesy biscuit things which probably had a ton of calories, so I didn't eat those. Ate half the fish & fries and took the rest home for lunch the next day. I will say it was tasty.  All in all this place was fair, but the unhealthy, non-diverse food menu & lack of reclining seats in every screening room make this a less than desirable option compared to non-dine in theaters such as the new Harkins at Fashion Square.

Seats recline, but the angle for the legs and back are not independent. Also, legs cannot be bent to an angle other than the defaulted angle.  No real butter for popcorn. It's coconut oil with butter flavor. I can tell. It's no good. Harkins butter is the best in town.  Service is good, don't have to leave seat.    You do have to leave to use the toilet though.

Have been here twice and enjoyed each visit so far. Once you enter, there's a bar you can order drinks and wait at if you don't want to go into your designated theatre too early (you can take your order inside). Seating is assigned, you can choose where you want to sit when you purchase a ticket. The food is pretty good, but beware of how much you're spending! The service is alright, I don't have much to say about it. The only thing I would change is the leather seats - they're comfortable, but act like a rocking chair.
Seats & floor was dirty with popcorn & spilt soda, movie was 30 mins late in starting

This used to be my favorite theater, but it has gone down in quality pretty significantly. Our waiter acted as if he could care less, the menu was sticky & dirty, and my food was lukewarm. Price wasn't a factor until quality became one. I'm disappointed...

Uhmm it's our first time in this theater. It's pretty neat. The great thing about it is they do have amazing foods being served! Well as the name implies, it's  a dine in movie theater. So cool! Though they don't have reclining seats, but it's okay because  seat is pretty comfy, plus the mini table for your food which is nice. Well obviously the main highlight of their theater is their 'dine in' service. So that's about it. It's great! They serve the food on your table. Amazing! Our server was very nice, she did an excellent job!  Their food is surprisingly good actually! It's not the typical movie theater foods..they have real good food!  I got myself a bowl of grilled chicken with quinoa, and it's fantastic! Hubby enjoyed his food too! And I really like the  pizza we got! So fresh and it's like homemade good!  The only thing though, their food is quite expensive! But hey there is no cheap food in a movie theater LOL! That's how they make so much money- with their expensive popcorn, food and drinks!  The place seem clean. And I like that they have couches on their waiting area, which is so not typical for a movie theater! Very nice! So, overall, it was a fun movie time indeed! We will come back.

Why haven't I reviewed this place yet?  I've been to about a dozen different movies since Esplanade became a dine-in theater, and every experience has been great. On my most recent visit, the Hunger Games double feature, I was reminded why this place really is a gem: reserved seating. I'd purchased my ticket a month in advance because I'm just that much of a geek.  Typically, I only order water and popcorn unless someone else is paying then I'll order a cocktail and entree. The cost for food really isn't that much more than a nice dinner out, and being able to combine dinner and a movie certainly is swell.

Ok so they finally got new recliners...that's fantastic However how is it that every time I come here they are always OUT of the item I want in the menu??? Seriously how do you not plan and keep the items on hand for the items you have on your menu?? They were out of the steak and shrimp bowl

Pretty nice theater but not super fancy. The lady working the ticket sales wasn't very friendly or patient. We couldn't purchase our movie tickets online using our gift cards and tried to call ahead but no one answered the phones. Therefore when we arrived we were stuck with crappy seats.   Food was good but pricey for what you get. You're definitely paying for the convenience. Also, the seats don't fully recline which is a bit of a bummer.

The new Fork and Screen is awesome! Being able to lounge at the full bar out front and then go in and have dinner...well, it doesn't get better than that! Keep it classy, not trashy, NCM...and they did an awesome job making this my newest obsession!

One of the things that frustrates me when I want a night out is that the movie I want to see is never playing at the right time to eat dinner out too. You either have to eat dinner way too early to finish in time and make the show or eat after the show but by then it is midnight. lol     So how to solve the issue, go to a dine in theater. I am mad I did not think of this idea myself. Haha! I had heard a lot about this concept this year but had not had the chance to go to one yet. I finally indulged this past Saturday. I had not been to this location since they remodeled so did not know what to expect except the things I had heard, which were all wonderful.    The concept is a bit different from a regular movie. You purchase your seats with a certain seat number ahead of time, kind of like a play or concert. You can choose between the Dine In Theater or the Lounge. The lounge is three dollars extra and has reclining seats. They advertise the lounge as having " A more adult like feel! "  Ok, don't ask me what that means-hahaha! but My friends say it is great.     When I first walked in I noticed the nice lobby lounge chairs and bar. You can order drinks and food outside like in the old days-;0) that's ok too but the great thing here is that your theater chair is actually like a table at a restaurant. No more long lines at the popcorn counter, wow! (People who are late a lot will love it here! Ya hear that certain friends of mine?-lol- You all can run to your seat, get food delivered, and Wah-La the movie starts. brawhahah- sorry I digress) They give you full service right at your seat and even extend it during the movie. There is a button to call the waitress over when you need something but to be honest I never needed to punch the buttons. The servers were all over us the minute we sat down and the minute we needed anything. Actually, the service here was outstanding which prompted me to write a review! I thought it would be a bit distracting but it really was not.    The food was OK not bad but not OMG I am going to die either. The menu was a lot more innovative then I thought it would be so I would go back to try some other things.I just ordered the bread and pretzel basket with red sauce and spicy cheese dip. It was good but how do you go wrong with that? My friend had a burger that she said was good. The Parm fries were tasty.  The thing I liked best is getting refills given to me at my seat. Yahoooo! The simplest things are the smallest blessings.    OK, have to write the negative. You pay for the convenience. The place is very expensive so bring your wallet. The cheapest movie is 12 bucks and the lounge is 15 and the food is over priced. Wow! Shocking you say. Food overpriced at the movies? I am so surprised! But in this case it is really over priced. Well, like I said before you pay for the convenience, I suppose. Sadly, I won't be able to go here all the time but a nice treat every now and again. I suppose when you factor in gas and travel time between a restaurant and a movie house it might be similar.  Check it out. Definitely worth at least a one time visit to see what you think.

So last year we came to see a movie. We ordered some burgers... Well there was a hair in my burger, which made it pretty impossible to enjoy the movie after that. They did get me an all new burger which was good and had no hairs but I don't think I will be coming back.

This AMC theater was outstanding! Went out on a date and we heard they serve wine at your seat so we were all in!   We were able to choose the movie, pick our seats and pay all on our smart phone! So easy. The seats are fantastic! They recline to your like and are so plush and comfortable. They have little table that pivot to the side or in front of your seat.   I ordered white wine and my date ordered red. We also ordered a brownie a la mode and they asked if we were splitting it. When we got it, it was on two plate! Perfect.  Overall great experience and I will definitely be back.

Drive from Scottsdale to this location to see Southpaw because of the limited availability and got there 10 minutes before the showing only to find out that our 16 and 19 year old children were not allowed into the theater because it is for 21 or older.   My wife and I did not understand and thought at first that either the movie content was too harsh or sexually explicit or possibly the theater serves alcohol and turns into a bar or something.   Only to find out after sometime that this is exclusively for 21 and older as designated for adults by the theater.  Had we know earlier we would not have made the drive there and wasted our time. Like a 16 and 19 year old are going to be a distraction like infants in a Disney animation movie.   Come on what a crock of crap!!  We decided that instead of not being allowed in to see Southpaw that we would see Mission Impossible and asked for student discounts only to be asked by the ticket person to show student ID which the 16 year old did not carry with them because the high school requires them to use a lanyard to display at all times and they only carry around at school. The person taking the tickets was stand pat at needing the student ID which I replied "give us a break you already screwed us over by not allowing us to see Southpaw and now you want to pull this?"  Besides the worst customer service I have ever experienced the food for all us was horrible.  The coconut shrimp was tasteless and terrible and the mushroom burger had a strange smell.  The ticket person should be fired or taught some customer service because if you piss off all the customers you will eventually have no customers.   I would give this place a zero stars or negative if I could, but the one star is for the waitress that served us.  Btw the ticket person seated us on the end of the first row to see an action movie when the entire second row was empty.  I never make this statement, but this place sucks and will strongly encourage you not to go here.  I will never be back!!

This theater was clean and overall good during our experience.  The food wasn't amazing but it was decent!  The chairs and area was nice and comfortable, I wish there was more seat offers cause movies book fast but it was still a Good time!

Reserving specific seats is nice and the kids serving were polite, but  the rest of the concept and execution doesnt work for me. It's too dark to see menus, trailers are too loud to easily communicate with wait staff (let alone your companion), and  settling tabs during films is inevitably distracting.    I'm told their Cinema Suites format is more spacious than our "Fork & Screen" option,  but when the 400 pound patron in front of me descended into his Playskool-strength theatre seat - and into my knees with the force of a medium speed car accident, that less than luxurious 'impression' evoked something more akin to "Fuck & Scream" -  I literally blurted "Fuck" and screamed at  the bone cracking pain  radiating from both patellas.   When I slid over behind fatso's 100+ pound wife, she's banging into me too, so it's not their fault. The seats are just cheap, with lousy springs and they're hard to settle into comfortably.  I was kicked from behind periodically.  All by adults btw.  It's interesting how many yelpers rip kids and seem to feel 'adults only' or food/bev service somehow conveys a first class experience.  To me it felt more like a bad coach flight; cabin lighting's busted and some douchebag's  reclining into your space.
